original: de dgar bar bya ba'i phyir sra ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dgar bar bya ba'i phyir sra ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The term “solidity” is mentioned in order to distinguish it from the other elements.

original: sra ba smos pa ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs dgar ba yin te /
analyzed: sra ba smos pa ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs dgar ba yin te /
translated: The mention of “solidity” distinguishes the element of earth from the derivative form of the element of earth.

original: rtsub pa dang mkhrang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsub pa dang mkhrang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “solidity” is “hardness” and “rigidity.”

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs lci ba yin yang sra ba dang mkhrang ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs lci ba yin yang sra ba dang mkhrang ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Although derivative form of the element of earth is heavy, it is not by nature solid or rigid.

original: chu'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: chu'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the water element?

original: gang gsher ba dang rlon pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gsher ba dang rlon pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is that which is moist and liquid.

original: bdag rang gi mtshan nyid ni gsher ba'o //
analyzed: bdag rang gi mtshan nyid ni gsher ba'o //
translated: Its own characteristic is moisture.

original: gzhan la yang gsher bar byed pas ni rlan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang gsher bar byed pas ni rlan pa'o //
translated: It is liquid because it moistens other things.

original: me'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: me'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fire element?

original: gang dro ba dang smin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la rang nyid tsha ba'i rang bzhin yin pas dro ba'o //
analyzed: gang dro ba dang smin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la rang nyid tsha ba'i rang bzhin yin pas dro ba'o //
translated: It is that which is hot and that which ripens. Its own nature is heat.

original: rdzas gzhan la yang dro ba dang smin par byed pas na smin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan la yang dro ba dang smin par byed pas na smin pa'o //
translated: It is that which ripens because it ripens other things.

original: rlung gi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gi khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the wind element?

original: gang bskum pa dang / rmyang ba dang / yang zhing g-yo ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang bskum pa dang / rmyang ba dang / yang zhing g-yo ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: that which contracts and stretches, and that which is light and mobile.

original: lus kyi rkang lag la sogs pa nang du bskum zhing phyir rmyangs pa dang / phyi'i 'dab ma la sogs pa g-yo zhing khyer bar byed pa ni rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: lus kyi rkang lag la sogs pa nang du bskum zhing phyir rmyangs pa dang / phyi'i 'dab ma la sogs pa g-yo zhing khyer bar byed pa ni rlung gi khams so //
translated: The wind element is that which contracts and stretches the internal parts of the body, such as the arms and legs, and that which moves and carries the external parts, such as the leaves of trees.

original: yang na ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyang yod de //
analyzed: yang na ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs kyang yod de //
translated: Or else, derived form also exists.

original: de dang 'khrul bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs smos so //
analyzed: de dang 'khrul bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs smos so //
translated: The term “movement” is mentioned as a synonym for that in order to avoid confusion.

original: de la yang ba ni rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la yang ba ni rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Here, lightness is the nature of the wind element.

original: g-yo ba ni rlung gi khams kyi las te /
analyzed: g-yo ba ni rlung gi khams kyi las te /
translated: Movement is the action of the wind element.

original: g-yo ba zhes bya ba las bstan pa'i sgo nas yang ba zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes bya ba las bstan pa'i sgo nas yang ba zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The nature of lightness is clarified by the term “movement” in the sense of an indication.

original: gang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid du yang ba ni rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: gang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid du yang ba ni rlung gi khams so //
translated: The wind element is that which is light in the sense of being mobile.

original: gang g-yo ba med pa la yang ba 'ba' zhig yod pa de ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs yin no //
analyzed: gang g-yo ba med pa la yang ba 'ba' zhig yod pa de ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs yin no //
translated: That which is only light and is not mobile is derived form.

original: de las zhes @42b bya ba smos pas chog mod /
analyzed: de las zhes @42b bya ba smos pas chog mod /
translated: Why is it sufficient to say “from that”?

original: khams zhes smos ci dgos she na /
analyzed: khams zhes smos ci dgos she na /
translated: Why is it necessary to say “from the elements”?

original: sa 'ba' zhig smos na ni 'byung ba las gyur pa dkar po dang dmar po la yang 'jig rten nas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa 'ba' zhig smos na ni 'byung ba las gyur pa dkar po dang dmar po la yang 'jig rten nas zhes bya ste /
translated: If only “earth” were mentioned, then the derived form that is white or red would be called “from the world.”

original: de dang nor bar 'gyur ba dgag pa'i phyir khams kyi sgra smos so //
analyzed: de dang nor bar 'gyur ba dgag pa'i phyir khams kyi sgra smos so //
translated: The term “element” is used to avoid confusion.

original: gang gong du bshad pa rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gong du bshad pa rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the above explanations are included in the following, the root text says:

original: gang gzugs 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gzugs 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Whatever is form is included in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.”

original: gang 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs 'di dang / gong du bshad pa'i gzugs med pa'i ming gi phung po bzhi gcig tu bsdus na ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs 'di dang / gong du bshad pa'i gzugs med pa'i ming gi phung po bzhi gcig tu bsdus na ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever form has the characteristic of the four great elements and the four formless aggregates that were explained above are collectively called “name and form.”

original: mngon pa'i chos las ni gzugs rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mngon pa'i chos las ni gzugs rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In the Abhidharma, form is of three types:

original: bltar snang ba la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bltar mi snang ba la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bltar yang mi snang ba thogs pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: bltar snang ba la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bltar mi snang ba la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bltar yang mi snang ba thogs pa yang med pa'o //
translated: visible and resistant, invisible and resistant, invisible and non-resistant.

original: ming yang gsum ste /
analyzed: ming yang gsum ste /
translated: Name is also threefold:

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ma gtogs par tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang gzugs gsum dang ming gsum gcig tu bsdus nas ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ma gtogs par tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang gzugs gsum dang ming gsum gcig tu bsdus nas ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: excluding the aggregate of consciousness, the three aggregates of feeling, perception and formations, and the three kinds of form, i.e. the visible, the audible and the tangible, are combined and called name-and-form.

original: de la bltar snang la thogs pa dag bcas pa'i gzugs ni /
analyzed: de la bltar snang la thogs pa dag bcas pa'i gzugs ni /
translated: Among them, visible and resistant form

original: gang ming gi dbang po'i yul du gyur pa gzugs zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gang ming gi dbang po'i yul du gyur pa gzugs zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: is that which is established as form and becomes the object of the sense of sight.

original: bltar mi snang la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs ni /
analyzed: bltar mi snang la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs ni /
translated: Invisible and resistant form

original: rdzas dgu ste /
analyzed: rdzas dgu ste /
translated: is the nine substances.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang / sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg ste yul bzhi'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang / sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg ste yul bzhi'o //
translated: The five sense faculties of eye, etc. and the four objects of sound, smell, taste and touch.

original: bltar yang mi snang la thogs pa yang med pa'i gzugs ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: bltar yang mi snang la thogs pa yang med pa'i gzugs ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Invisible and non-resistant form is non-indicative form.

original: skye mched drug bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye mched drug bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the six sense spheres,

original: ming gang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ming gang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis drug gi skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Name and form condition the six sense spheres.”

original: skye mched ni drug dag tu zad do //
analyzed: skye mched ni drug dag tu zad do //
translated: The sense spheres are just six.

original: skye mched drug ming tsam smos pa rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir mig gi skye mched dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skye mched drug ming tsam smos pa rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir mig gi skye mched dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the classification of the sense spheres, which are merely mentioned as “name,” he says, “the eye sense sphere,” and so on.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i gzugs kyi rgyu las ni /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i gzugs kyi rgyu las ni /
translated: Among them, the eye sense sphere arises from the cause of form, which is the four great elements.🔽The ear sense sphere arises from the cause of sound, which is the four great elements.🔽The nose sense sphere arises from the cause of smell, which is the four great elements.🔽The tongue sense sphere arises from the cause of taste, which is the four great elements.

original: mig gi skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched kyi bar du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig gi skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched kyi bar du 'byung ngo //
translated: The body sense sphere arises from the cause of touch, which is the four great elements.

original: ming gi phung po bzhi rgyu las ni yid kyi skye mched 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming gi phung po bzhi rgyu las ni yid kyi skye mched 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind sense sphere arises from the cause of the four aggregates of name.

original: yang na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dangs pa dang gsal bar gyur na mig gi skye mched nas lus kyi skye @43a * //🔽mched kyi bar du 'gyur ro //🔽ming gi phung po bzhi gsal bar gyur na /
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dangs pa dang gsal bar gyur na mig gi skye mched nas lus kyi skye @43a * // mched kyi bar du 'gyur ro // ming gi phung po bzhi gsal bar gyur na /
translated: Alternatively, when the four great elements become clear and pure, the eye sense sphere arises from the cause of form, which is the four great elements.🔽The ear sense sphere arises from the cause of sound, which is the four great elements.🔽The nose sense sphere arises from the cause of smell, which is the four great elements.🔽The tongue sense sphere arises from the cause of taste, which is the four great elements.🔽The body sense sphere arises from the cause of touch, which is the four great elements.

original: yid kyi skye mched du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched du 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind sense sphere arises from the cause of the four aggregates of name.

original: de la gzugs spyod yul du gyur pa lta ba'i bdag nyid can gzugs dangs shing gsal ba ni mig gi skye mched do //🔽sgra spyod yul du gyur pa nyams pa'i bdag nyid can gzugs dangs shing gsal ba ni rna ba'i skye mched do //
analyzed: de la gzugs spyod yul du gyur pa lta ba'i bdag nyid can gzugs dangs shing gsal ba ni mig gi skye mched do // sgra spyod yul du gyur pa nyams pa'i bdag nyid can gzugs dangs shing gsal ba ni rna ba'i skye mched do //
translated: The eye sense-faculty is the subtle matter which is the basis of the visual consciousness, and which is the cause of the perception of visible form.🔽The ear sense-faculty, etc., are the subtle matter which is the basis of the auditory consciousness, etc.

original: dri spyod yul du gyur pa snom pa'i bdag nyid can gzugs dangs shing gsal ba ni sna'i skye mched do //🔽ro'i spyod yul du gyur pa myang ba'i bdag nyid can gzugs dang sa shing gsal ba ni lce'i skye mched do //
analyzed: dri spyod yul du gyur pa snom pa'i bdag nyid can gzugs dangs shing gsal ba ni sna'i skye mched do // ro'i spyod yul du gyur pa myang ba'i bdag nyid can gzugs dang sa shing gsal ba ni lce'i skye mched do //
translated: The nose sense-faculty is the subtle matter which is the basis of the olfactory consciousness, and which is the cause of the perception of odor.🔽The tongue sense-faculty is the subtle matter which is the basis of the gustatory consciousness, and which is the cause of the perception of taste.

original: reg bya'i spyod yul du gyur pa 'jam rtsub la sogs pa tshor ba'i bdag nyid can gzugs dangs shing gsal ba ni lus kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: reg bya'i spyod yul du gyur pa 'jam rtsub la sogs pa tshor ba'i bdag nyid can gzugs dangs shing gsal ba ni lus kyi skye mched do //
translated: The body sense-faculty is the subtle matter which is the basis of the tactile consciousness, and which is the cause of the perception of tangibles.

original: chos spyod yul can du gyur par shes shing rig pa'i bdag nyid can ni yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: chos spyod yul can du gyur par shes shing rig pa'i bdag nyid can ni yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: The mental faculty is the subtle matter which is the basis of the mental consciousness, and which is the cause of the perception of factors.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni skye mched drug car yod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni skye mched drug car yod do //
translated: In the realm of desire, there are six sense-faculties.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni sna dang lce gnyis ma gtogs pa lhag ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni sna dang lce gnyis ma gtogs pa lhag ma bzhi'o //
translated: In the form realm, there are four bases, excluding the nose and tongue.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni yid kyi skye mched 'ba' zhig yod par zad do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni yid kyi skye mched 'ba' zhig yod par zad do //
translated: In the formless realm, there is only the mental base.

original: reg pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: reg pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to explain contact,

original: drug gi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs smos so //
analyzed: drug gi skye mched kyi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs smos so //
translated: the sutra states, “Conditioned by the six bases of contact, there is contact.”

original: grangs smos pa'i bar du byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs smos pa'i bar du byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the number,

original: mig gi kun reg pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi kun reg pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
translated: the sutra states, “eye contact” and so on.

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: de bas na yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum dus gcig tu tshogs pa la reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum dus gcig tu tshogs pa la reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the three—the object, the sense faculty, and the consciousness—are called contact when they are assembled in one moment.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang sgra dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gsum dus gcig tu tshogs pa ni rna ba'i kun tu reg pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang sgra dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gsum dus gcig tu tshogs pa ni rna ba'i kun tu reg pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Similarly, the three—the ear, sound, and the ear consciousness—are called ear contact when they are assembled in one moment.

original: dbang po lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //🔽de la mig gi kun du reg pa nas lus kyi kun tu reg pa'i bar du lnga ni /
analyzed: dbang po lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro // de la mig gi kun du reg pa nas lus kyi kun tu reg pa'i bar du lnga ni /
translated: The same applies to the remaining faculties.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i reg pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i reg pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Among them, the five from eye-contact to body-contact are called “contact with obstruction.”

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po thogs pa dang bcas pa brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po thogs pa dang bcas pa brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye and the other faculties with obstruction are dependent.

original: yid kyi kun tu reg pa ni lhag par yul la 'jug pa'i reg pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi kun tu reg pa ni lhag par yul la 'jug pa'i reg pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Mental contact is called “contact with a special object.”

original: mig la sogs pas gzugs kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pas gzugs kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Because the eye and the others, having form as their object,

original: mthong ba @43b rnams kyi rjes la yid kyis dpyod par byed pas na /
analyzed: mthong ba @43b rnams kyi rjes la yid kyis dpyod par byed pas na /
translated: afterwards the mind investigates.

original: lhag par yul la 'jug pa'i reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag par yul la 'jug pa'i reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “contact with a special object.”

original: tshor ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain feeling, he said:

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Conditioned by contact, feeling arises.”

original: tshor ba'i tshogs drug ces bya bas grangs bstan to //
analyzed: tshor ba'i tshogs drug ces bya bas grangs bstan to //
translated: The statement “the group of six feelings” shows the number.

original: grangs bstan pa nyid kyis dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs bstan pa nyid kyis dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the divisions by means of the number, he said:🔽“The six feelings are feelings born of eye-contact,🔽and so on up to:🔽feelings born of mind-contact.”

original: mig gi kun tu reg pa las bstan pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mig gi kun tu reg pa las bstan pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The feeling taught as the contact of the eye is mentioned.

original: mig dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum tshogs pa las gang skyes pa'i tshor ba ni mig gi kun tu reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum tshogs pa las gang skyes pa'i tshor ba ni mig gi kun tu reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The feeling that arises from the union of the eye, object, and consciousness is called the feeling that arises from the contact of the eye.

original: de yang yul du 'ong ba dang / yul yid du mi 'ong ba dang yul gnyis ga ma yin pa phrad pa'i rgyu las tshor ba rnams pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang yul du 'ong ba dang / yul yid du mi 'ong ba dang yul gnyis ga ma yin pa phrad pa'i rgyu las tshor ba rnams pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, from the cause of contact with a pleasant object, an unpleasant object, or a neither pleasant nor unpleasant object, there are three types of feeling.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba skye'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba skye'o //
translated: A pleasant feeling, a painful feeling, and a feeling that is neither pleasant nor painful arise.

original: de la yul yid du 'ong ba dang phrad na ni bde ba'i tshor ba skye'o //
analyzed: de la yul yid du 'ong ba dang phrad na ni bde ba'i tshor ba skye'o //
translated: If there is contact with a pleasant object, a pleasant feeling arises.

original: yul yid du mi 'ong ba dang phrad na ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skye'o //
analyzed: yul yid du mi 'ong ba dang phrad na ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skye'o //
translated: If there is contact with an unpleasant object, a painful feeling arises.

original: yul yid du 'ong ba yang ma yin mi 'ong ba yang ma yin pa dang phrad na ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba skye ste /🔽de bzhin du sgra snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa dang phrad pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: yul yid du 'ong ba yang ma yin mi 'ong ba yang ma yin pa dang phrad na ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba skye ste / de bzhin du sgra snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa dang phrad pa'i sgo nas /
translated: When there is contact with a neutral object, neither pleasant nor unpleasant, there is the sensation of neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: rna ba'i kun tu reg pa las kyang tshor ba rnam pa gsum skye ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i kun tu reg pa las kyang tshor ba rnam pa gsum skye ste /
translated: In the same way, there are three sensations arising from contact with the ear, in relation to pleasant, unpleasant, and neutral sounds.

original: dbang po lhag ma rnams la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbang po lhag ma rnams la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to the other sense faculties.

original: de la sim par byed pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba ste /
analyzed: de la sim par byed pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba ste /
translated: Here, the pleasant is the sensation of pleasure.

original: dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la phan 'dogs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la phan 'dogs par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is what benefits the sense faculties and the four great elements.

original: gdung bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ste /
analyzed: gdung bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ste /
translated: The unpleasant is the sensation of suffering.

original: dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la gnod par byed ces bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la gnod par byed ces bya ba'i don to /
translated: It is what harms the sense faculties and the four great elements.🔽The neutral is the sensation of neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: sim par yang mi byed gdung bar yang mi byed pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sim par yang mi byed gdung bar yang mi byed pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That which neither benefits nor injures the faculties and the four great elements is called neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la phan par yang mi byed gnod par yang mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi la phan par yang mi byed gnod par yang mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it neither benefits nor injures the faculties and the four great elements.

original: yang na lus dang dbang po dang yid la rjes su 'dzin cing phan 'dogs pa'i tshor ba gang skyes na /🔽skyes pa'i tshe dang gnas pa'i tshe na bdag bde'o @44a * //
analyzed: yang na lus dang dbang po dang yid la rjes su 'dzin cing phan 'dogs pa'i tshor ba gang skyes na / skyes pa'i tshe dang gnas pa'i tshe na bdag bde'o @44a * //
translated: Or, when a feeling that is favorable to the body, faculties, and mind and that benefits them arises,

original: snyam du sems la /
analyzed: snyam du sems la /
translated: at the time of its arising and at the time of its presence, one thinks, “I am happy.”

original: de dang bral na bdag sdug bsngal lo snyam du sems pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang bral na bdag sdug bsngal lo snyam du sems pa ni bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is separated from it, one thinks, “I am suffering.” This is called pleasant feeling.

original: lus dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la gnod par byed pas /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la gnod par byed pas /
translated: That which injures the body, faculties, and consciousness

original: gang skyes pa dang gnas pa'i tshe na bdag sdug bsngal lo snyam du sems la /
analyzed: gang skyes pa dang gnas pa'i tshe na bdag sdug bsngal lo snyam du sems la /
translated: at the time of its arising and at the time of its presence, one thinks, “I am suffering.”

original: de dang bral na bdag bde'o snyam du sems pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang bral na bdag bde'o snyam du sems pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought, “I am happy when separated from it,” is called the feeling of suffering.

original: lus dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la phan par yang mi byed gnod par yang mi byed pas /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la phan par yang mi byed gnod par yang mi byed pas /
translated: That which neither benefits nor harms the body, the sense faculties, or the consciousness,

original: gang skyes pa dang gnas pa'i tshe na bde'o snyam du yang mi sems sdug bsngal lo snyam du yang mi sems pa ni /
analyzed: gang skyes pa dang gnas pa'i tshe na bde'o snyam du yang mi sems sdug bsngal lo snyam du yang mi sems pa ni /
translated: and which, when it arises or persists, is not thought to be pleasant or painful,

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the feeling that is neither pleasant nor painful.

original: de la yid kyi kun tu reg pa'i tshor ba bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la yid kyi kun tu reg pa'i tshor ba bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the statement, “Pleasant feeling, etc., is mental contact,”

original: mig gi kun tu reg pa nas /
analyzed: mig gi kun tu reg pa nas /
translated: mental contact ranges from contact with the eye to contact with the mind.🔽The satisfaction that arises from contact with the eye, etc.,

original: lus kyi kun tu reg pa'i bar dag gi sim pa la ni bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya /
analyzed: lus kyi kun tu reg pa'i bar dag gi sim pa la ni bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya /
translated: is called the feeling of pleasure.🔽The pain that arises from contact with the eye, etc.,

original: gdung ba la ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gdung ba la ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the feeling of suffering.

original: de la yid kyi kun tu reg pa'i tshor ba sim pa la ni //
analyzed: de la yid kyi kun tu reg pa'i tshor ba sim pa la ni //
translated: The satisfaction that arises from contact with the mind🔽is called the feeling of pleasure.

original: ming du bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba'i yid bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / gdung ba la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya mi bya'i /
analyzed: ming du bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba'i yid bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / gdung ba la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba zhes bya mi bya'i /
translated: The mental feeling called “pleasant” is called “the pleasant feeling.”🔽The mental feeling called “painful” is called “the painful feeling.”

original: yid mi bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya'o //🔽de la mig gi kun tu reg pa nas /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya'o // de la mig gi kun tu reg pa nas /
translated: The mental feeling called “neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant” is called “the feeling that is neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.”

original: lus kyi kun tu reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba ni /
analyzed: lus kyi kun tu reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba ni /
translated: The feeling that arises from contact with the eye up to the feeling that arises from contact with the mind

original: dbang po gzugs can la brten nas lus kyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //🔽yid kyi kun nas reg pa nas skyes pa'i tshor ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can la brten nas lus kyi tshor ba zhes bya'o // yid kyi kun nas reg pa nas skyes pa'i tshor ba ni /
translated: are called “bodily feelings” because they are based on the material sense faculties.

original: sems la brten pa'i phyir sems kyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems la brten pa'i phyir sems kyi tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The feeling that arises from contact with the mind is called “mental feeling” because it is based on the mind.

original: brgal ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ma gtogs pa'i bde ba yang ma yin pa sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tshor ba gsum po yod par cis mngon /
analyzed: brgal ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ma gtogs pa'i bde ba yang ma yin pa sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tshor ba gsum po yod par cis mngon /
translated: Objection: How do you know that there is a third feeling called “neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant” that is not included among the feelings of pleasure and pain?

original: smras pa lud dang rig pas mngon te /
analyzed: smras pa lud dang rig pas mngon te /
translated: Response: It is known through reasoning and scripture.

original: lung las bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / yang bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs nas /
analyzed: lung las bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / yang bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs nas /
translated: The scriptures state that there is pleasure, there is pain, and there is that which is neither pleasure nor pain.🔽And it is said that one abandons pleasure and pain,

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that one endowed with mindfulness abides in neither pleasure nor pain.

original: @44b rig pa yang yod de tshor ba dang bral ba'i sems skye ba mi srid pas /
analyzed: @44b rig pa yang yod de tshor ba dang bral ba'i sems skye ba mi srid pas /
translated: There is also awareness, because it is impossible for a mind to arise that is devoid of feeling.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ma myong ba'i dus na bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin tshor ba kun la rang gis rig pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ma myong ba'i dus na bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin tshor ba kun la rang gis rig pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, when one does not experience the feelings of pleasure or pain, there is the feeling of neither pleasure nor pain, which is awareness by intrinsic awareness.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na tshor ba gsum char dang ldan no //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na tshor ba gsum char dang ldan no //
translated: In the desire realm, one possesses all three feelings.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa na ni tshor ba bde ba dang btang snyoms gnyis ka dang ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa na ni tshor ba bde ba dang btang snyoms gnyis ka dang ldan no //
translated: In the first and second absorptions of the form realm, one possesses both the feelings of pleasure and equanimity.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan gsum pa yan chad nas srid pa'i sred pa'i rtse mo man chad ni tshor ba btang snyoms 'ba' zhig dang ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan gsum pa yan chad nas srid pa'i sred pa'i rtse mo man chad ni tshor ba btang snyoms 'ba' zhig dang ldan no //
translated: In the third meditation of the realm of form and above, and in the summit of cyclic existence, there is only the sensation of equanimity.

original: sred pa bstan pa'i bya ba'i phyir tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sred pa bstan pa'i bya ba'i phyir tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate craving, he says: “Conditioned by sensation is craving.”

original: sred pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / 'dod chags dang / rab tu chags pa zhes bya ba rnam grangs su gtogs so //
analyzed: sred pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / 'dod chags dang / rab tu chags pa zhes bya ba rnam grangs su gtogs so //
translated: Craving is a synonym for attachment, clinging, desire, and strong desire.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug la chags pa ni sred pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug la chags pa ni sred pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Attachment to the six sense objects such as form is called craving.

original: sred pa sred pa'i longs spyod la tshva chu 'thung ba bzhin du rgyun du spyod kyang ngoms mi myong ba ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa sred pa'i longs spyod la tshva chu 'thung ba bzhin du rgyun du spyod kyang ngoms mi myong ba ni sred pa'o //
translated: Craving is the insatiable enjoyment of objects of desire, like a thirsty person drinking salt water.

original: phye ma leb brlag pa'i gnas me'i gzugs la chags pa de bzhin du mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin brlag pa'i gnas bud med dang / skyes pa gnyis gcig gi gzugs la gcig chags pa ni gzugs la sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phye ma leb brlag pa'i gnas me'i gzugs la chags pa de bzhin du mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin brlag pa'i gnas bud med dang / skyes pa gnyis gcig gi gzugs la gcig chags pa ni gzugs la sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as a moth is attached to the form of a flame, which is the cause of its destruction, so too are men and women attached to each other, the cause of the destruction of their purity. This is called craving for form.

original: brlag pa'i gnas ni ri dags glu la chags pa bzhin du sgra rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa ni sgra la sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brlag pa'i gnas ni ri dags glu la chags pa bzhin du sgra rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa ni sgra la sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as a deer is attached to the sound of a flute, so too are people attached to various kinds of sounds. This is called craving for sound.

original: mi gtsang ba'i sbrang bu mi gtsang ba'i dri la dam par 'dzin cing chags pa /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i sbrang bu mi gtsang ba'i dri la dam par 'dzin cing chags pa /
translated: Just as a fly is attached to the smell of filth, holding it to be supreme,

original: de bzhin du dri rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa ni dri la sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dri rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa ni dri la sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: so too are people attached to various kinds of smells. This is called craving for smell.

original: phag mi gtsang ba'i ro rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa de bzhin du ro rnam pa sna tshogs la zhen pa ni ro la sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phag mi gtsang ba'i ro rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa de bzhin du ro rnam pa sna tshogs la zhen pa ni ro la sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as a pig is attached to various kinds of foul tastes, so too are people attached to various kinds of tastes. This is called craving for taste.

original: yungs mar gyi sgang bu yungs mar gyi snod kyi reg pa la chags pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yungs mar gyi sgang bu yungs mar gyi snod kyi reg pa la chags pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a person is attached to the touch of a pot full of sesame oil,

original: 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa'i reg pa la chags pa ni reg pa la sred pa zhes bya'o //🔽'dod pa lnga'i yon tan de dag sngon spyad de /
analyzed: 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa'i reg pa la chags pa ni reg pa la sred pa zhes bya'o // 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan de dag sngon spyad de /
translated: Attachment to the contact of softness, roughness, etc. is called craving for contact.🔽Craving for the five sense pleasures is attachment to the five sense objects.

original: 'das pa la phrad par smon pa dang / ma 'ongs pa @45a * //
analyzed: 'das pa la phrad par smon pa dang / ma 'ongs pa @45a * //
translated: Craving for the past is the desire to meet with those sense pleasures that one has previously experienced.🔽Craving for the future is the desire to quickly associate with those sense pleasures that have not yet been experienced.🔽Craving for the present is the desire to not be separated from those sense pleasures that are being experienced.

original: rnams dang yang myur du 'grogs par smon pa dang / 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan gyi ro la chags pa dang / lta ba phyin ci log rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa ni chos la sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnams dang yang myur du 'grogs par smon pa dang / 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan gyi ro la chags pa dang / lta ba phyin ci log rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa ni chos la sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Craving for the world is attachment to the taste of mundane concentration and attachment to the various erroneous views.

original: de yang bsdu na phyi'i dngos po la chags pa dang / nang gi dngos po la chags pa dang / lta ba la chags pa'o //🔽de la phyi'i dngos po la chags pa ni /
analyzed: de yang bsdu na phyi'i dngos po la chags pa dang / nang gi dngos po la chags pa dang / lta ba la chags pa'o // de la phyi'i dngos po la chags pa ni /
translated: Moreover, if one condenses those, they are attachment to external things, attachment to internal things, and attachment to views.

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la chags pa'o //🔽nang gi dngos po la chags pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la chags pa'o // nang gi dngos po la chags pa ni //
translated: Among those, attachment to external things is attachment to the five sense pleasures.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment to internal things is attachment to the five appropriated aggregates.

original: lta ba la chags pa ni rtag par mngon par chags pa dang / chad par mngon par chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba la chags pa ni rtag par mngon par chags pa dang / chad par mngon par chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Attachment to views is attachment to eternalism and attachment to nihilism, etc.

original: len pa bsten pa'i phyir //
analyzed: len pa bsten pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the reliance on grasping,

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba len pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba len pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the condition of existence is grasping. What is grasping?

original: bzhi bzhi zhes bya bas grangs bstan to //
analyzed: bzhi bzhi zhes bya bas grangs bstan to //
translated: Four kinds of grasping are taught by the expression “four kinds.”

original: yang srid pa nye bar len par byed pas len pa 'am 'dod pa dang lta ba la sogs pa'i sems kyi rgyun mi gtong zhing 'dzin par byed pas na len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa nye bar len par byed pas len pa 'am 'dod pa dang lta ba la sogs pa'i sems kyi rgyun mi gtong zhing 'dzin par byed pas na len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Grasping is so called because it causes the appropriation of a new existence, or because it holds the stream of thought, not relinquishing desire, views, etc.

original: yang na shing gi don ni len pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang na shing gi don ni len pa'i don te /
translated: Or, the meaning of “grasping” is the meaning of “fuel.”

original: las kyi me 'bar ba'i phyir len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi me 'bar ba'i phyir len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Grasping is so called because it is the fuel for the blazing of the fire of karma.

original: dper na bud shing gi rgyus me 'bar ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bud shing gi rgyus me 'bar ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the fire blazes because of the fuel,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bud shing gi rgyus skyes bu'i las kyi me 'bar bar 'gyur ba'i don ni len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bud shing gi rgyus skyes bu'i las kyi me 'bar bar 'gyur ba'i don ni len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: so the fire of the karma of the person blazes because of the fuel of the defilements. This is the meaning of “grasping.”

original: yang na len pa'i don ni 'khri ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang na len pa'i don ni 'khri ba'i don te /
translated: Or, the meaning of “grasping” is the meaning of “binding.”

original: dar gyi srin bus rang gi lus dkris pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dar gyi srin bus rang gi lus dkris pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as a silk worm wraps itself up in its own cocoon,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bcings bas bdag nyid bcings nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bcings bas bdag nyid bcings nas /
translated: one is bound by the bonds of the afflictions,

original: thar pa'i gegs byed pa ni len pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i gegs byed pa ni len pa'o //
translated: and this creates an obstacle to liberation.

original: rab tu dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the divisions, he says,

original: 'dod pa'i len pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i len pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “the appropriation of desire,” and so on.

original: gang 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags nas de mi gtong ba ni 'dod pa'i len pa'o //🔽lta ba len pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags nas de mi gtong ba ni 'dod pa'i len pa'o // lta ba len pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The appropriation of desire is when, having become attached to the five sense objects of the desire realm, one does not let go of them.

original: rtag par lta ba dang chad par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa la sogs pa la chags shing /
analyzed: rtag par lta ba dang chad par lta ba dang / lta ba bsnyems pa la sogs pa la chags shing /
translated: The appropriation of views is when, having become attached to the views of permanence, annihilation, the conceit of views, and so on,

original: de mi gtong ba ni lta ba len pa'o //
analyzed: de mi gtong ba ni lta ba len pa'o //
translated: one does not let go of them.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa len pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa len pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The appropriation of the conceit of morality and asceticism is when, having become attached to the conceit of morality and asceticism,🔽one does not let go of them.

original: mi'am lha'am brgya byin nam tshangs par gyur cing ces smon lam log pa'i rgyu @45b de 'dod pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: mi'am lha'am brgya byin nam tshangs par gyur cing ces smon lam log pa'i rgyu @45b de 'dod pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
translated: One who is attached to the cause of a false vow, thinking “May I become a human, a god, Indra, or Brahma,” is one who holds morality and asceticism as paramount.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa len pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa len pa'o //
translated: This is the grasping of the pride of morality and asceticism.

original: bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The grasping of the assertion of a self is🔽the non-abandonment and attachment to the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba la mngon par chags shing mi gtong ba ni bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba la mngon par chags shing mi gtong ba ni bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is called the grasping of the assertion of a self.

original: 'dod pa len pas ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal nyid skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa len pas ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal nyid skyed par byed do //
translated: Grasping of desire generates the suffering of the desire realm.

original: len pa gsum gyis ni khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal nyid skyed par byed do //
analyzed: len pa gsum gyis ni khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal nyid skyed par byed do //
translated: The three graspings generate the suffering of the three realms.

original: yang na gang 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
analyzed: yang na gang 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
translated: Or, the twenty real entities of desire realm objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering,

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du /
translated: up to those to be abandoned by the path of meditation,

original: 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang khong khro ba dang ma rig pa ste rdzas nyi shu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang khong khro ba dang ma rig pa ste rdzas nyi shu'o //
translated: consisting of desire, pride, anger, and ignorance.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?🔽There are five types of attachment: one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path, and one to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du 'dod chags lnga dang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /🔽bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du nga rgyal lnga dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /🔽bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du khong khro ba lnga dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du 'dod chags lnga dang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du nga rgyal lnga dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du khong khro ba lnga dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
translated: There are five types of pride: one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path, and one to be abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽There are five types of anger: one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path, and one to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du ma rig pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du ma rig pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five types of ignorance: one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, one to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path, and one to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: spyir lnga bzhi nyi shu'o //🔽the tshom dang bcas pas bsgom mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyir lnga bzhi nyi shu'o // the tshom dang bcas pas bsgom mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In general, there are twenty: four times five.🔽Doubt is not abandoned by the path of meditation because it is impossible to meditate on it.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni the tshom med de //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni the tshom med de //
translated: Doubt does not exist on the path of meditation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas lam mthong ba'i spang bar bya ba'i the tshom bzhi dang / de'i steng du ngo tsha med pa dang / phrag dog dang / 'jungs pa dang / zhum pa dang / the tshom dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas lam mthong ba'i spang bar bya ba'i the tshom bzhi dang / de'i steng du ngo tsha med pa dang / phrag dog dang / 'jungs pa dang / zhum pa dang / the tshom dang /
translated: There are four doubts: doubt that is abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm, doubt that is abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, doubt that is abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation and doubt that is abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.🔽

original: gnyid dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa ste /
analyzed: gnyid dang / khro ba dang / 'chab pa ste /
translated: The four doubts from objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering up to objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path, plus the four nonvirtuous actions of shamelessness, secrecy, miserliness and lethargy, plus the three of sleep, anger and concealment.

original: rdzas bcus bstan nas rdzas sum cu rtsa bzhi po 'di ni 'dod pa len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas bcus bstan nas rdzas sum cu rtsa bzhi po 'di ni 'dod pa len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These thirty four substances are called grasping desire.

original: lta ba len pa zhes bya ba la khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa bzhag nas khams gcig cing yang lta ba'i rdzas bcu ste /
analyzed: lta ba len pa zhes bya ba la khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa bzhag nas khams gcig cing yang lta ba'i rdzas bcu ste /
translated: Grasping view is the ten substances of view that are concomitant with each of the three realms, from objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering up to objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, excluding the haughtiness of ethics and rituals.

original: sum cu ni lta ba len pa @46a * //
analyzed: sum cu ni lta ba len pa @46a * //
translated: These thirty are called grasping view.

original: zhes bya'o // ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bar du log par lta ba bzhi lta ba bsnyems pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bar du log par lta ba bzhi lta ba bsnyems pa bzhi ste /
translated: In the desire realm, there are four views to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, four views to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, four views to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, and four views to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: brgyad kyi steng du 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba rnams te bcu'o //
analyzed: brgyad kyi steng du 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba rnams te bcu'o //
translated: Thus there are ten: eight views and two overesteemings of discipline and austerity.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams na yang bcu /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams na yang bcu /
translated: Similarly, there are ten in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang bcu ste rdzas sum cur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang bcu ste rdzas sum cur 'gyur ro //
translated: And there are ten in the formless realm. Thus there are thirty substances.

original: khams gsum gyi tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang lam mthong ba spyir rdzas drug ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang lam mthong ba spyir rdzas drug ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The six substances in the three realms that are overesteeming of discipline and austerity and the path in general are called the grasping of overesteeming of discipline and austerity.

original: ji ltar zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na //
translated: How is that?

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa ste gnyis dang / de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams na yang gnyis gzugs med pa'i khams na yang gnyis gnyis te rdzas drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa ste gnyis dang / de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams na yang gnyis gzugs med pa'i khams na yang gnyis gnyis te rdzas drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, there are two types in the form realm and two types in the formless realm. Thus there are six substances.🔽Pride in discipline and ritual is the pride of thinking, I have good ethics such as refraining from killing and I have good ritual such as refraining from eating meat.

original: de la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa la srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims ngan pa spang ba ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa la srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims ngan pa spang ba ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Discipline is the avoidance of bad ethics such as killing.

original: lus dang ngag gi tshul dang las su bya ba rnams la nges par 'jug pa ni brtul zhugs te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi tshul dang las su bya ba rnams la nges par 'jug pa ni brtul zhugs te /
translated: Ritual is the definite engagement in the conduct and action of body and speech.

original: skra 'dreg pa dang dus su rkang lag bkru ba la sogs pa'i las nges par byed pa'am /
analyzed: skra 'dreg pa dang dus su rkang lag bkru ba la sogs pa'i las nges par byed pa'am /
translated: It is the definite performance of actions such as shaving the head, washing the feet at certain times and so on.

original: bde ba spang nas me lnga dang khyi'i dka' thab la sogs pa'i tshul 'dzin pa ni brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: bde ba spang nas me lnga dang khyi'i dka' thab la sogs pa'i tshul 'dzin pa ni brtul zhugs so //
translated: The observance of the five fires, the austerities of the dog, and so on, after having abandoned happiness, is austerity.

original: smad pa'i lta ba la nges par yon tan du bzung nas dbang phyug la sogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: smad pa'i lta ba la nges par yon tan du bzung nas dbang phyug la sogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa sngon du btang ste /
translated: After having taken up a contemptible view as a virtue, one takes up the view of the self, and so on, and

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs 'dzin pa ni dag pa'i rgyu dang / lam ma yin na de dag la dag pa lam gyi rnam pa lta bur 'dzin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs 'dzin pa ni dag pa'i rgyu dang / lam ma yin na de dag la dag pa lam gyi rnam pa lta bur 'dzin te /
translated: one takes up morality and austerity. If the cause of purification and the path are not the cause of purification and the path, one takes them as the cause of purification and the path.

original: gang phyin ci log gi rnam par zhugs pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa la len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang phyin ci log gi rnam par zhugs pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa la len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is engaged in a distorted manner is called the pride of morality and austerity.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa'i rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur @46b mngon par chags te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa'i rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur @46b mngon par chags te /
translated: Therefore, one is attached to what is not the cause of explanation as the cause.

original: dbang phyug dang gtso bo la sogs pa ni 'jig rten rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rgyu ma yin na /
analyzed: dbang phyug dang gtso bo la sogs pa ni 'jig rten rnams kyi bskyed pa'i rgyu ma yin na /
translated: Since Iśvara, the primal substance, and so on are not the cause of the creation of the world,

original: de la rgyu mngon par chags pas na phyin ci log go //
analyzed: de la rgyu mngon par chags pas na phyin ci log go //
translated: one is attached to them as the cause.

original: lam ma yin pa la lam du mngon par zhen pa ni grangs pa'i ye shes kyi sbyor ba la sogs pa grol ba'i lam ma yin na mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: lam ma yin pa la lam du mngon par zhen pa ni grangs pa'i ye shes kyi sbyor ba la sogs pa grol ba'i lam ma yin na mngon par zhen te /
translated: The conceit of morality and ritual is the adherence to the view that a path which is not a path is a path. It is the adherence to the view that the path of the Jainas, the path of Kapila, the path of Akşapāda, and so on, are paths to liberation, when they are not.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pas de mngon du byas pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pas de mngon du byas pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The morality and ritual that are manifested by that adherence are called the conceit of morality and ritual.

original: ci'i phyir na 'o na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na 'o na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa de lta ba las bkar te logs shig tu bshad /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa de lta ba las bkar te logs shig tu bshad /
translated: Why is the conceit of morality and ritual mentioned separately from the views?

original: len du lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: len du lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is a counteragent to the path.

original: 'di ltar grangs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi ye shes la sogs pa grol ba'i lam ma yin yang thar pa'i lam du blta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar grangs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi ye shes la sogs pa grol ba'i lam ma yin yang thar pa'i lam du blta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of yoga of the Jainas, and so on, are not the path to liberation, but they are considered to be the path to liberation.

original: yang na khyim ma gnas pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la slu bar byed de /
analyzed: yang na khyim ma gnas pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la slu bar byed de /
translated: Or, it deceives the householder and the renunciate.

original: khyim na gnas pa'i phyogs la ni kha zas gcod pa dang mer mchod pa la sogs mtho ris kyi lam ma yin yang lam du shes pas slu bar byed pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la yang 'dod pa'i yul gyi bde ba spangs pas dag par yid ches shing /
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa'i phyogs la ni kha zas gcod pa dang mer mchod pa la sogs mtho ris kyi lam ma yin yang lam du shes pas slu bar byed pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la yang 'dod pa'i yul gyi bde ba spangs pas dag par yid ches shing /
translated: In the case of the householder, though fasting, burning one's body and so on are not the path to higher rebirth, they deceive by knowing them to be the path.🔽In the case of the ordained, though they have abandoned the bliss of sense objects, they are deceived by believing that they are pure,

original: me lnga'i dka' thub dang skra 'bal ba dang / kha zas rtsub po za zhing tsher ma'i steng na nyal ba la sogs pa lam ma yin pa lam du 'du shes pas slu bar byed do //
analyzed: me lnga'i dka' thub dang skra 'bal ba dang / kha zas rtsub po za zhing tsher ma'i steng na nyal ba la sogs pa lam ma yin pa lam du 'du shes pas slu bar byed do //
translated: and by perceiving the five fires, plucking out one's hair, eating coarse food, sleeping on thorns and so on as the path, though they are not the path.

original: bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bya ba la /🔽gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bya ba la / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
translated: The statement that it is the appropriator of the self is as follows.🔽Attachment, pride and ignorance operating in the form and formless realms and the ten objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering

original: bsgom pas spang ba'i bar du bcu bcu ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang ba'i bar du bcu bcu ste /
translated: up to the objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: sum cu'i steng du /
analyzed: sum cu'i steng du /
translated: On top of the thirty,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi the tshom bzhi bzhi brgyad de /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi the tshom bzhi bzhi brgyad de /
translated: there are four doubts in the form realm and four doubts in the formless realm, making eight.

original: sum bcu rtsa brgyad ni /
analyzed: sum bcu rtsa brgyad ni /
translated: The eighteen are:

original: bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bya'o //🔽ji ltar zhe na gzugs kyi khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bya'o // ji ltar zhe na gzugs kyi khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
translated: The eighteen are called the “self-talk of grasping.”🔽How so? There are five attachments in the form realm, from those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering up to those to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar byas pa'i bar du 'dod chags lnga dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams na yang lnga ste bcu'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar byas pa'i bar du 'dod chags lnga dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams na yang lnga ste bcu'o //
translated: Likewise, there are five in the formless realm, making ten.

original: @47a * // gzugs kyi khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
analyzed: @47a * // gzugs kyi khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
translated: There are five kinds of pride in the form realm, from those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering up to those to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du nga rgyal lnga dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na yang de bzhin du lnga ste bcu'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du nga rgyal lnga dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na yang de bzhin du lnga ste bcu'o //
translated: Likewise, there are five in the formless realm, making ten.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi sdug bsngal la mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /🔽bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du ma rig pa lnga dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams na lnga ste bcu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi sdug bsngal la mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du ma rig pa lnga dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams na lnga ste bcu'o //
translated: There are five kinds of ignorance in the form realm, from those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering up to those to be abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽Likewise, there are five in the formless realm, making ten.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas /
translated: There are five kinds of ignorance in the formless realm, from those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering up to those to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bar du the tshom bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na yang the tshom bzhi ste /
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bar du the tshom bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na yang the tshom bzhi ste /
translated: There are four doubts abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: the tshom brgyad do //
analyzed: the tshom brgyad do //
translated: Thus there are eight doubts.

original: de ltar na rdzas sum cu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de ltar na rdzas sum cu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro /
translated: Thus there are thirty eight substances.

original: brgal ba nyon mongs par 'dra ba las /
analyzed: brgal ba nyon mongs par 'dra ba las /
translated: Objection: If doubt is similar to affliction,

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnams ni /
translated: then the afflictions of the desire realm

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi len par bshad la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi len par bshad la /
translated: are explained as the appropriated aggregates of the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa la gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i len pa zhes mi bya /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa la gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i len pa zhes mi bya /
translated: But the afflictions of the form and formless realms are not called the appropriated aggregates of the form and formless realms.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bdag tu smra ba'i len pa zhes bya ba lan du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems ni kha nang du lta ba yin pas /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba'i len pa zhes bya ba lan du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa dang / sems ni kha nang du lta ba yin pas /
translated: The response is that the afflictions of the form and formless realms are called the appropriated aggregates of the self because the mind is directed inward.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag la bdag tu lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag la bdag tu lta ste /
translated: Those afflictions view the self.

original: de bas na de dag bdag yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na de dag bdag yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore they do not exist as the self.

original: nyon mongs pa la bdag tu lta zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la bdag tu lta zhing /
translated: They view the afflictions as the self.

original: smra bar zad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smra bar zad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The root text states, They are merely verbal expressions.

original: bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bshad do //🔽yang na khyim na gnas pa'i phyogs rnams ni /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bshad do // yang na khyim na gnas pa'i phyogs rnams ni /
translated: The phrase they are verbal expressions of self is explained.

original: bu smad la sogs pa 'dod pa la chags pas na 'dod pa len par byed do //
analyzed: bu smad la sogs pa 'dod pa la chags pas na 'dod pa len par byed do //
translated: Or, those who are householders take up desire because they are attached to desire, such as attachment to wives and children.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams ni lta ba sna tshogs la chags pas na lta ba len par byed do //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams ni lta ba sna tshogs la chags pas na lta ba len par byed do //
translated: Those who have gone forth take up views because they are attached to various views.

original: gang khyim pa'i phyogs la dus khrims dang zas gcod pa la sogs pa'i dka' thub byed pas /🔽mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam du chags pa dang / rab tu byung ba yang tshul de nyid kyis /
analyzed: gang khyim pa'i phyogs la dus khrims dang zas gcod pa la sogs pa'i dka' thub byed pas / mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam du chags pa dang / rab tu byung ba yang tshul de nyid kyis /
translated: Those who are householders take up the pride of morality and ascetic practices because they are attached to the path to heaven and liberation through the practice of austerities, such as fasting and observing the rules of purification.🔽Those who have gone forth take up the pride of morality and ascetic practices because they think that liberation is attained through that very method.

original: thar bar sems pas na phyogs gnyis ka ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa len to //
analyzed: thar bar sems pas na phyogs gnyis ka ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs bsnyems pa len to //
translated: Thus, both sides take up the pride of morality and ascetic practices.

original: mu stegs pa bdag tu smra ba rnams ni bdag tu smra ba len to //
analyzed: mu stegs pa bdag tu smra ba rnams ni bdag tu smra ba len to //
translated: Those tīrthikas who are proponents of self take up the verbal expression of self.

original: de la spang ba'i rim pas @47b dgod na /
analyzed: de la spang ba'i rim pas @47b dgod na /
translated: If we arrange these in the order in which they are abandoned,

original: sa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: there are three types of grounds.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rig pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rig pa'i sa'o //
translated: the level of the path of seeing, the level of freedom from attachment, and the level of recognition of what has been done.

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who are stream enterers

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi sa la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi sa la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: are said to abide on the level of the path of seeing.

original: de'i tshe lta ba phyin ci log sna tshogs dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs kyis thar pa'i lam du 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log med pas mthong ba'i lam gyi sa la ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe lta ba phyin ci log sna tshogs dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs kyis thar pa'i lam du 'dzin pa'i phyin ci log med pas mthong ba'i lam gyi sa la ni /
translated: At that time, since they are free of the various mistaken views and of the mistaken belief that moral discipline and ritual are the path to liberation, on the level of the path of seeing

original: lta ba len pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa'i len pa spang ngo //
analyzed: lta ba len pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs bsnyems pa'i len pa spang ngo //
translated: they abandon the grasping of mistaken views and the grasping of the conceit of moral discipline and ritual.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni /🔽'dod pa'i khams gyi /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni / 'dod pa'i khams gyi /
translated: Those who are once returners

original: 'dod chags spang bar bya ba la 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags spang bar bya ba la 'jug pa yin la /
translated: are engaged in abandoning the attachment of the desire realm.

original: phyir mi 'ong bas ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags spangs pas ni /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong bas ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags spangs pas ni /
translated: Those who are nonreturners have abandoned the attachment of the desire realm.

original: de gnyis ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: These two are said to abide on the level of freedom from attachment.

original: de'i tshe 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa kun spangs pas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa kun spangs pas na /
translated: At that time, since all the afflictions of the desire realm are abandoned,

original: 'dod pa len pa spang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa len pa spang ba yin no //
translated: it is the abandonment of the appropriation of desire.

original: dgra bcom pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dus na ni /
translated: At the time of being an arhat,

original: bdag gi bya ba ni byas /
analyzed: bdag gi bya ba ni byas /
translated: one understands that one's task is done,

original: khur ni bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa khong du chud pas /
analyzed: khur ni bor zhes bya ba la sogs pa khong du chud pas /
translated: one has cast off the burden, and so on.

original: byas pa rig pa'i sa la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byas pa rig pa'i sa la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: One is said to abide on the stage of one who knows what must be done.

original: dgra bcom pa'i dus na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dus na /
translated: At the time of being an arhat,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: since all the afflictions of the form and formless realms are completely abandoned,

original: bdag tu smra ba len pa spang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba len pa spang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said to be the abandonment of the appropriation of self.

original: srid pa bstan pa'i phyir len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: srid pa bstan pa'i phyir len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba /
translated: In order to demonstrate existence, it says the condition of appropriation is existence.

original: srid pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: srid pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is existence?

original: len pa'i dbang gis las dge ba dang mi dge ba byed pa la yang srid pa zhes bya /
analyzed: len pa'i dbang gis las dge ba dang mi dge ba byed pa la yang srid pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called existence because, under the influence of appropriation, one performs virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis srid pa skye ba'i gnas de la yang srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis srid pa skye ba'i gnas de la yang srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is also called existence because, under the influence of karma and affliction, one is born in a place of existence.

original: srid pa gsum ste zhes bya bas grangs smras pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: srid pa gsum ste zhes bya bas grangs smras pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase “the three existences” indicates the enumeration of the divisions.🔽

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la /
translated: The phrase the three existences indicates the enumeration of the divisions. In order to demonstrate this, he says: namely, the existence of the desire realm, the existence of the form realm, and the existence of the formless realm.

original: gtsor byed pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: gtsor byed pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i srid pa'o //
translated: The existence of the desire realm is the realm in which the five sense objects such as form and sound are predominant.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa ni spangs kyi /🔽bsam gtan bsgom zhing gzugs gtsor byed cing gzugs la brten pa'i @48a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa ni spangs kyi / bsam gtan bsgom zhing gzugs gtsor byed cing gzugs la brten pa'i @48a * //
translated: The existence of the desire realm is so called because attachment to the sense objects is not abandoned there.

original: khams ni gzugs kyi srid pa'o /
analyzed: khams ni gzugs kyi srid pa'o /
translated: The existence of the form realm is the realm in which the meditative absorptions are cultivated and form is predominant, i.e., form that is based on the meditative absorptions.

original: gzugs la chags pa spangs nas /🔽dbang po lnga la sogs pa'i gzugs dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs la chags pa spangs nas / dbang po lnga la sogs pa'i gzugs dang bral ba ni /
translated: The existence of the form realm is so called because attachment to form is abandoned there.

original: gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o //🔽de dag nyid gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o // de dag nyid gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The existence of the formless realm is the realm that is free from the form of the five sense faculties, etc.🔽The existence of the formless realm is so called because attachment to form is abandoned there.

original: bde ba la 'dod pa'i srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde ba la 'dod pa'i srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just what these are, he says: The existence of the desire realm is the realm of pleasure, etc.

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa ni sems can dmyal ba yan chad gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha man chad la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa ni sems can dmyal ba yan chad gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha man chad la bya'o //
translated: Existence in the desire realm is from the hells up to the gods who control others' emanations.

original: de la tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba ni brgyad de bstir med pa dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / tsha ba dang / 'o dod cher 'bod pa dang / 'o dod 'bod pa dang / 'joms pa dang / thig nag dang / yang sos so /🔽bstir med pa'i sems can dmyal ba ni /🔽'dzam bu'i gling 'di'i 'og dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu na 'dug ste /
analyzed: de la tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba ni brgyad de bstir med pa dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / tsha ba dang / 'o dod cher 'bod pa dang / 'o dod 'bod pa dang / 'joms pa dang / thig nag dang / yang sos so / bstir med pa'i sems can dmyal ba ni / 'dzam bu'i gling 'di'i 'og dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu na 'dug ste /
translated: There are eight hot hells: Avīci, Tapana, Pratāpana, Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghāta, Raurava and Mahāraurava.🔽The Avīci Hell is located 20,000 yojanas below this Jambudvīpa.

original: bstir med pa'i sems can dmyal ba de'i gnas kyi 'phang yang dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu /
analyzed: bstir med pa'i sems can dmyal ba de'i gnas kyi 'phang yang dpag tshad stong phrag nyi shu /
translated: The height of the Avīci Hell is 20,000 yojanas.

original: dkyil yang stong phrag nyi shu ste /
analyzed: dkyil yang stong phrag nyi shu ste /
translated: The center is also 20,000 yojanas.

original: spyir de dag gi gnas dpag tshad stong phrag bzhi bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyir de dag gi gnas dpag tshad stong phrag bzhi bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: In general, their abode is 40,000 yojanas.

original: skabs cung zad kyang med de bstir med pa na bstir med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skabs cung zad kyang med de bstir med pa na bstir med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: There is not even a little space, so it is called Avīci, meaning no interval.

original: yang na sdug bsngal nyid sna tshogs pa bar chad med par 'gyur bas na bstir med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal nyid sna tshogs pa bar chad med par 'gyur bas na bstir med pa ste /
translated: Or else, since various sufferings occur there without interruption, it is Avīci, the Unrelenting Hell.

original: 'di ltar dmyal ba de la ni phyogs bcu na me 'bar ba chen po 'byung zhing me shin tu 'bar bas sems can gyi lus bsreg pa dang / lcags kyi mdung rtse thogs pa'i dmyal ba'i srung ma rnams kyis mdung gi rtse la blangs shing /
