analyzed: 'di ltar dmyal ba de la ni phyogs bcu na me 'bar ba chen po 'byung zhing me shin tu 'bar bas sems can gyi lus bsreg pa dang / lcags kyi mdung rtse thogs pa'i dmyal ba'i srung ma rnams kyis mdung gi rtse la blangs shing /
translated: Thus, in that hell, a great blazing fire arises in the ten directions and the blazing fire burns the bodies of sentient beings, and the hell guardians impale them on blazing iron spears.

original: zangs po cher rgyun du 'tshed par byed pas na /
analyzed: zangs po cher rgyun du 'tshed par byed pas na /
translated: They are continuously boiled in a copper cauldron.

original: bstir med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstir med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the Unrelenting Hell.

original: bstir med pa'i sems can dmyal ba'i tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa gcig tu gnas te dus byed do //
analyzed: bstir med pa'i sems can dmyal ba'i tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa gcig tu gnas te dus byed do //
translated: The lifespan of sentient beings in the Unrelenting Hell lasts for one eon.

original: de la rab tu tsha ba la sogs pa'i sems can dmyal ba bdun ni bstir med pa'i sems can dmyal ba de'i gong nas rim bzhin du brtsegs mar gnas te /
analyzed: de la rab tu tsha ba la sogs pa'i sems can dmyal ba bdun ni bstir med pa'i sems can dmyal ba de'i gong nas rim bzhin du brtsegs mar gnas te /
translated: The seven hells such as the Hot Hell are stacked one above the other above the Unrelenting Hell.

original: bstir med pa'i gong na rab tu tsha ba'o //
analyzed: bstir med pa'i gong na rab tu tsha ba'o //
translated: Above the Unrelenting Hell is the Hot Hell.

original: rab tu tsha ba'i gong na tsha ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu tsha ba'i gong na tsha ba'o //
translated: Above the Hot Hell is the Very Hot Hell.

original: tsha ba'i gong na 'o dod cher 'bod pa'o //🔽'o dod cher 'bod pa'i gong na 'o dod 'bod pa'o /
analyzed: tsha ba'i gong na 'o dod cher 'bod pa'o // 'o dod cher 'bod pa'i gong na 'o dod 'bod pa'o /
translated: Above the Hot Hell is the Hell of Loud Screaming.🔽Above the Hell of Loud Screaming is the Hell of Screaming.

original: 'o dod 'bod pa'i gong na 'joms pa'o //🔽'joms pa'i gong na thig nag go //
analyzed: 'o dod 'bod pa'i gong na 'joms pa'o // 'joms pa'i gong na thig nag go //
translated: Above the Hell of Screaming is the Hell of Crushing.🔽Above the Hell of Crushing is the Black Line Hell.

original: @48b thig nag gi gong na yang sos so //
analyzed: @48b thig nag gi gong na yang sos so //
translated: Above the Black Line Hell is the Reviving Hell.

original: kha cig ni sems can dmyal ba bdun po de dag bstir med pa'i dmyal ba'i ngos na gnas so zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: kha cig ni sems can dmyal ba bdun po de dag bstir med pa'i dmyal ba'i ngos na gnas so zhes 'chad do //
translated: Some say that these seven hells are located on the side of the Unrelenting Hell.

original: tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba la ltos nas de bas kyang cher cha bas lus dang sems shin tu gdungs pas na tsha ba rab tu tsha ba'o //
analyzed: tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba la ltos nas de bas kyang cher cha bas lus dang sems shin tu gdungs pas na tsha ba rab tu tsha ba'o //
translated: Compared to the Hot Hell, the bodies and minds of the beings in this hell are tormented even more, so it is called the Hell of Extreme Heat.

original: rab tu tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba de'i tshe tshad ni bskal pa bar ma phyed du gnas nas dus byed do //🔽me lce 'bar ba chen pos lus bskor zhing bsregs pas kun tu tsha zhing gdungs pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba de'i tshe tshad ni bskal pa bar ma phyed du gnas nas dus byed do // me lce 'bar ba chen pos lus bskor zhing bsregs pas kun tu tsha zhing gdungs pa ni /
translated: The lifespan of the beings in the Hell of Extreme Heat lasts for half an intermediate eon, and they die when that period is over.

original: tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Their bodies are completely burned by the great blazing flames, so it is called the Hell of Extreme Heat.

original: de'i tshe'i tshad ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i tshe lo stong phrag bcu drug tu gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe'i tshad ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i tshe lo stong phrag bcu drug tu gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: The measure of their lifespan is that they live for sixteen thousand years of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods, which is calculated as one day and night.

original: 'o dod cher 'bod pa ni gang tsha ba cher mi bzad pa mang pos mnar bas 'o dod 'bod pas kyang mi bzad do //
analyzed: 'o dod cher 'bod pa ni gang tsha ba cher mi bzad pa mang pos mnar bas 'o dod 'bod pas kyang mi bzad do //
translated: The Great Wailing Hell is so called because the beings there are tormented by many unbearable great heats and they wail unbearably.

original: sdug bsngal lo zhes 'o dod cher 'bod de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal lo zhes 'o dod cher 'bod de /
translated: They wail, “Alas, suffering!”

original: de'i tshe'i tshad ni 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i tshe lo stong phrag brgyad thub po //
analyzed: de'i tshe'i tshad ni 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i tshe lo stong phrag brgyad thub po //
translated: The measure of their lifespan is that they live for eight thousand years of the Nirmanarati gods, which is calculated as one day and night.

original: 'o dod 'bod pa ni gtub pa'i sems can dang mi bzad pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pas gtses pas sdug bsngal zhing nyam thag nas 'o dod 'bod pa ste /
analyzed: 'o dod 'bod pa ni gtub pa'i sems can dang mi bzad pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pas gtses pas sdug bsngal zhing nyam thag nas 'o dod 'bod pa ste /
translated: The Wailing Hell is so called because the beings there are tormented by the ripening of unbearable karma and they wail in pain and distress.

original: de'i tshe'i tshad ni dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i lo stong phrag bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe'i tshad ni dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i lo stong phrag bzhi'o //
translated: The measure of their lifespan is four thousand years, where one day equals the lifespan of the gods of Tushita.

original: de la 'joms pa ni lug dang 'dra ba'i ri dang pha bong la sogs pa mang por phan tshun 'dus shing btsir nas gsod pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'joms pa ni lug dang 'dra ba'i ri dang pha bong la sogs pa mang por phan tshun 'dus shing btsir nas gsod pa ste /
translated: In the hell of Crushing, beings are crushed between mountains shaped like the heads of sheep, rocks and so forth.

original: de'i tshe'i tshad ni zung ma rnams kyi lha'i tshe tshad ji tsam pa nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i tshe lo nyis brgya gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe'i tshad ni zung ma rnams kyi lha'i tshe tshad ji tsam pa nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i tshe lo nyis brgya gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: The measure of their lifespan is two hundred years, where one day equals the lifespan of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three.

original: thig nag po ni ji ltar shing la shing mkhan gyis thig gis btab nas sog les shing 'dra ba bzhin du thig nag pos btab nas mgo 'am mdoms nas sog les 'dra zhing gshegs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: thig nag po ni ji ltar shing la shing mkhan gyis thig gis btab nas sog les shing 'dra ba bzhin du thig nag pos btab nas mgo 'am mdoms nas sog les 'dra zhing gshegs par byed pa ste /
translated: In the hell of Black Lines, beings are cut with saws along black lines drawn on their bodies, like a carpenter marking wood.

original: de'i tshe'i tshad ni sum cu rtsa gsum rnams kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i lo stong gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe'i tshad ni sum cu rtsa gsum rnams kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i lo stong gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: The lifespan of beings in Saṃjīva is calculated as follows: the lifespan of the gods of Trāyastriṃśa is one day and night. Multiplying this by five hundred is the lifespan of beings in Saṃjīva.

original: yang sos ni der skyes pa'i sems can gcig la gcig gtub cing gshegs pa'i gnod par @49a * //
analyzed: yang sos ni der skyes pa'i sems can gcig la gcig gtub cing gshegs pa'i gnod par @49a * //
translated: In Saṃjīva, beings cut and stab each other with weapons,

original: byed pa ste brgyal bar gnas pa las rlung grang mos bus shing nam mkha' las kyang sems can khyed cag yang sos zhes bya ba'i sgra byung ba dang / yang sos par gyur nas gcig la gcig gis gnod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa ste brgyal bar gnas pa las rlung grang mos bus shing nam mkha' las kyang sems can khyed cag yang sos zhes bya ba'i sgra byung ba dang / yang sos par gyur nas gcig la gcig gis gnod par byed pa ste /
translated: but when they faint and fall down, a cool wind blows and a voice from the sky says, “Be revived!” and they revive and again harm each other.

original: de'i tshe'i tshad ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i lo lnga brgya'i bar du gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe'i tshad ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i lo lnga brgya'i bar du gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: The lifespan of beings in Saṃjīva is calculated as follows: the lifespan of the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings is one day and night. Multiplying this by five hundred is the lifespan of beings in Saṃjīva.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po de brgyad la sgo bzhi yod de /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po de brgyad la sgo bzhi yod de /
translated: Each of these eight great hells has four gates.

original: sgo gcig cing lhag pa'i sems can dmyal ba bzhi bzhi ste /
analyzed: sgo gcig cing lhag pa'i sems can dmyal ba bzhi bzhi ste /
translated: The four additional hells are the four great hells:

original: sems can dmyal ba bcu drug go //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba bcu drug go //
translated: the sixteen hells are the eight hot hells and the eight cold hells.

original: lhag pa'i sems can dmyal ba bzhi ni me ma mur dang mi gtsang ba'i rdza ba dang spu gri la sogs pa'i mtshon gyi lam dang ba tsha'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems can dmyal ba bzhi ni me ma mur dang mi gtsang ba'i rdza ba dang spu gri la sogs pa'i mtshon gyi lam dang ba tsha'i chu bo'o //
translated: The four additional hells are the hell of hot embers, the hell of filth, the hell of the road of razors and so on and the hell of the river of hot ashes.

original: de la me ma mur ni pus mo nub tsam ste /
analyzed: de la me ma mur ni pus mo nub tsam ste /
translated: The hell of hot embers is knee deep in embers.

original: der sems can dag gi rkang pa bcug ma thag tu sha khrag dang pags pa ma lus par bsnyil bar byed do mi gtsang ba'i rdzab ni rab tu dri mi zhim pa'i ngan skyugs kyi 'dam gyis gang ba /
analyzed: der sems can dag gi rkang pa bcug ma thag tu sha khrag dang pags pa ma lus par bsnyil bar byed do mi gtsang ba'i rdzab ni rab tu dri mi zhim pa'i ngan skyugs kyi 'dam gyis gang ba /
translated: When sentient beings enter there, their flesh, blood and skin are immediately burned away. The hell of filth is filled with a swamp of extremely malodorous vomit.

original: de'i nang na srin bu kun ta zhes bya ba lus thal ka la mgo gnag cing /
analyzed: de'i nang na srin bu kun ta zhes bya ba lus thal ka la mgo gnag cing /
translated: In it, there are worms called kun da, whose bodies are white, their heads are black

original: mchu khab bzhin du gnas pa rnams kyis der zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyi rus pa yang thal bar 'bigs so /
analyzed: mchu khab bzhin du gnas pa rnams kyis der zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyi rus pa yang thal bar 'bigs so /
translated: and their beaks are like knives. They pierce the bones of sentient beings who enter there and eat them.

original: spu gri'i sogs gtams pa'i lam po che ni sems can rnams der 'jug pa na spu gri gshibs pa'i lam gyis rkang pa bzhag ma thag tu sha khrag dang pags pa ma lus par rlog par byed pa dang ral gri 'dab ma'i tshal yod do //
analyzed: spu gri'i sogs gtams pa'i lam po che ni sems can rnams der 'jug pa na spu gri gshibs pa'i lam gyis rkang pa bzhag ma thag tu sha khrag dang pags pa ma lus par rlog par byed pa dang ral gri 'dab ma'i tshal yod do //
translated: The great road strewn with razors: when sentient beings enter there, the road with its razors cuts up their feet so that flesh, blood, and skin are completely destroyed.

original: sems can de dag ral gri rnon po'i so des yan lag dang nying lag rnams kyang dum bur gtub cing /
analyzed: sems can de dag ral gri rnon po'i so des yan lag dang nying lag rnams kyang dum bur gtub cing /
translated: The forest with sword-like leaves: the sharp edges of the leaves of the trees cut up the major and minor limbs of sentient beings.

original: khyi sre mo stag ris can rnams 'dus shing za /
analyzed: khyi sre mo stag ris can rnams 'dus shing za /
translated: Jackals with striped fur gather and eat them.

original: bya rog lcags kyi mchu can gyis mig kyang 'byin par byed /
analyzed: bya rog lcags kyi mchu can gyis mig kyang 'byin par byed /
translated: Crows with iron beaks pluck out their eyes.

original: lcags kyi sdong po tsher ma bcu drug yod pas sems can rnams yar 'dzeg na ni /🔽tsher ma'i kha thur du bltas par gyur cing sems can gyi lus 'bigs /
analyzed: lcags kyi sdong po tsher ma bcu drug yod pas sems can rnams yar 'dzeg na ni / tsher ma'i kha thur du bltas par gyur cing sems can gyi lus 'bigs /
translated: The iron tree with sixteen thorns: when sentient beings climb up it,🔽the thorns turn downward and pierce their bodies.

original: slar 'bab na yang kha gyen du bltas te lus 'bigs par byed do //
analyzed: slar 'bab na yang kha gyen du bltas te lus 'bigs par byed do //
translated: When they descend, the thorns turn upward and pierce their bodies.

original: tsha chu'i chu bo ni de dag gi 'gram na sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma mtshon ral gri dang shakti dang mdung lag na thogs pa rnams kyis phyir 'byung ba dag kyang slar @49b 'dor zhing nang du bor ba rnams zangs chen por 'bras dang til la sogs🔽pa bskol ba bzhin du btso zhing skol bar byed do //
analyzed: tsha chu'i chu bo ni de dag gi 'gram na sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma mtshon ral gri dang shakti dang mdung lag na thogs pa rnams kyis phyir 'byung ba dag kyang slar @49b 'dor zhing nang du bor ba rnams zangs chen por 'bras dang til la sogs pa bskol ba bzhin du btso zhing skol bar byed do //
translated: The guardians of the hells hold swords, spears and javelins in their hands. They prevent the beings from emerging and throw them back in. They are boiled and cooked like rice, sesame seeds and so on in a large cauldron of boiling water.

original: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba yang brgyad yod de /
analyzed: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba yang brgyad yod de /
translated: There are also eight cold hells.

original: 'di lta ste chu bur dang / rab tu chu bur dang / ao sgra thams thams dang / sa la la dang / hu hu dang / autpa la dang / padmo dang / padmo chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chu bur dang / rab tu chu bur dang / ao sgra thams thams dang / sa la la dang / hu hu dang / autpa la dang / padmo dang / padmo chen po'o //
translated: They are: the Blistering Hell, the Bursting Blister Hell, the Hell of Lamentation, the Hell of Chattering Teeth, the Hell of Splitting Like a Blue Lotus, the Hell of Splitting Like a Lotus, and the Hell of Splitting Like a Great Lotus.

original: sems can de dag ha cang yang grangs ches pas mnar med pa'i lus chu bur du gyur pa dang / gas pa las ni chu bur dang rab tu chu bur dang / autpa la dang / padmo dang / padmo chen por gdags so //
analyzed: sems can de dag ha cang yang grangs ches pas mnar med pa'i lus chu bur du gyur pa dang / gas pa las ni chu bur dang rab tu chu bur dang / autpa la dang / padmo dang / padmo chen por gdags so //
translated: The bodies of the beings in the Reviving Hell are so numerous that the bodies in the Blistering Hell and the Bursting Blister Hell are designated as blisters and bursting blisters, and the bodies in the Hell of Splitting Like a Blue Lotus, the Hell of Splitting Like a Lotus, and the Hell of Splitting Like a Great Lotus are designated as blue lotuses, lotuses, and great lotuses.

original: grang bas nyen pa'i sgra rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshul las ni so sgra thams thams dang / aa la la dang / hu hu bar gdags so /
analyzed: grang bas nyen pa'i sgra rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshul las ni so sgra thams thams dang / aa la la dang / hu hu bar gdags so /
translated: The way the sound of their wailing changes due to the cold is that they are called those who wail like a goat, those who wail like an elephant and those who wail like an oozing sore.

original: dmyal ba brgyad po de dag gi tshe tshad ni /
analyzed: dmyal ba brgyad po de dag gi tshe tshad ni /
translated: The lifespan of the eight hot hells is as follows.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dpe tsam du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dpe tsam du bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said that the lifespan of the beings of the hot hells is merely an analogy.

original: 'di lta ste dge slong dag da ltar kha ra lnga bre nyi shu la dbus pa'i til gyi 'ba' ha yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge slong dag da ltar kha ra lnga bre nyi shu la dbus pa'i til gyi 'ba' ha yin te /
translated: Monks, in the present day, twenty dré of sesame seeds is one dré of Magadha.

original: glang stobs po che bzhi bcu'i khal gyi snod la bya /🔽de til gyis byur bur spyur la /
analyzed: glang stobs po che bzhi bcu'i khal gyi snod la bya / de til gyis byur bur spyur la /
translated: One load of sesame seeds is placed on the back of forty strong oxen.

original: de nas mi zhig gis lo brgyad lon zhing til de 'bru re re bor te /
analyzed: de nas mi zhig gis lo brgyad lon zhing til de 'bru re re bor te /
translated: Then a man takes one sesame seed every one hundred years and leaves it.

original: kha re nyi shu la dbus pa'i til gyi 'ba' har bzhag pa de'i tshul de'i rim gyis zad cing thug par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: kha re nyi shu la dbus pa'i til gyi 'ba' har bzhag pa de'i tshul de'i rim gyis zad cing thug par gyur pa ni /
translated: In this way, the time when the sesame seeds are exhausted and finished is the lifespan of the beings of the first hot hell.

original: bla'o // chu bur du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad zad par mi 'gyur bar nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa de ni chu bur gyi tshe'i tshad do //🔽chu bur nyi shu la rab tu chu bur gyi tshe'i tshad do //
analyzed: bla'o // chu bur du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad zad par mi 'gyur bar nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa de ni chu bur gyi tshe'i tshad do // chu bur nyi shu la rab tu chu bur gyi tshe'i tshad do //
translated: I say that the life-span of beings born in Arbuda is not exhausted.🔽Twenty Arbudas make one Nirarbuda.

original: rab tu chu bur nyi shu la so sgra thams thams so //🔽so sgra thams thams nyi shu la aa la la'o //🔽aa la la nyi shu la hu hu ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu chu bur nyi shu la so sgra thams thams so // so sgra thams thams nyi shu la aa la la'o // aa la la nyi shu la hu hu ba'o //
translated: Twenty Nirarbudas make one Hahava.🔽Twenty Hahavas make one Ahāvahā.

original: hu hu ba nyi shu la autpa la'o //
analyzed: hu hu ba nyi shu la autpa la'o //
translated: Twenty Ahāvahās make one Utpala.

original: autpa la nyi shu la padmo'o //
analyzed: autpa la nyi shu la padmo'o //
translated: Twenty Utpalas make one Padma.

original: padmo nyi shu la padmo chen po'i tshe'i tshad do //
analyzed: padmo nyi shu la padmo chen po'i tshe'i tshad do //
translated: Twenty Padmas make one Mahāpadma.

original: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba brgyad po de dag kyang 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid kyi 'og dmyal ba chen po rnams kyi thad ka na gnas so //
analyzed: grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba brgyad po de dag kyang 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid kyi 'og dmyal ba chen po rnams kyi thad ka na gnas so //
translated: These eight cold hells are located below Jambudvīpa, directly below the great hells.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling nyid kyi chu zheng de snyed du med na bstir med pa la sogs pa de snyed gnas pa'i skabs ga la yod /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling nyid kyi chu zheng de snyed du med na bstir med pa la sogs pa de snyed gnas pa'i skabs ga la yod /
translated: Since Jambudvīpa is not that deep, how can there be room for all of them?

original: lan du 'bras kyi phung po bzhin du 'dzam bu'i gling 'di yang zhabs yang la spyi phra bas na de'i phyir de dag de na gnas so //
analyzed: lan du 'bras kyi phung po bzhin du 'dzam bu'i gling 'di yang zhabs yang la spyi phra bas na de'i phyir de dag de na gnas so //
translated: because the soles of their feet are small and their bodies are large.

original: de la sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ba la /🔽rgya gar @50a * //
analyzed: de la sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ba la / rgya gar @50a * //
translated: Hell Beings

original: skad du na ra ka zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: skad du na ra ka zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In Sanskrit, the term is naraka.🔽Na means “to lead” or “to go,” and ra means “to go.”

original: na ni khrid pa'am 'gro ba'i don pas sdug bsngal gyi las kyi gnas der bsod nams ma yin pa'i las kyis sems can rnams khrid cing 'gro bas na dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: na ni khrid pa'am 'gro ba'i don pas sdug bsngal gyi las kyi gnas der bsod nams ma yin pa'i las kyis sems can rnams khrid cing 'gro bas na dmyal ba'o //
translated: Because nonvirtuous karma leads sentient beings to that place of suffering and they go there, it is called “hell.”

original: yang na na ra ka'i don ni chags pa med pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang na na ra ka'i don ni chags pa med pa'i don te /
translated: Alternatively, the meaning of naraka is “without attachment.”

original: der skyes pa rnams rtag tu sdug bsngal gyis nyen pas chags pa dang dga' ba'i bsam pa mi 'byung bas dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: der skyes pa rnams rtag tu sdug bsngal gyis nyen pas chags pa dang dga' ba'i bsam pa mi 'byung bas dmyal ba'o //
translated: Because those born there are always afflicted by suffering, thoughts of attachment and joy do not arise, it is called “hell.”

original: yang na sems can rnams der dmyal ba dang gtub pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs byed pas na dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sems can rnams der dmyal ba dang gtub pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs byed pas na dmyal ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, because sentient beings are made to experience various sufferings such as being burned and cut there, it is called “hell.”

original: yi dags zhes bya ba la yi dags kyi sgra ni shin tu song ba la bya ste /
analyzed: yi dags zhes bya ba la yi dags kyi sgra ni shin tu song ba la bya ste /
translated: The term preta is derived from the root pra, meaning to go, and ta, meaning badly.

original: ser sna la sogs pa'i las kyi dbang gis mi'i gnas 'di nas dus ring mo zhig tu phyir mi ldog par song bas na yi dags te /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa'i las kyi dbang gis mi'i gnas 'di nas dus ring mo zhig tu phyir mi ldog par song bas na yi dags te /
translated: They are called pretas because they go badly, that is, they do not return for a long time from this human realm due to the power of their karma, such as miserliness.

original: yi dags su skyes pa rnams ni lhag par yang tshe ring bar grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi dags su skyes pa rnams ni lhag par yang tshe ring bar grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is well known that those born as pretas have an extremely long life.

original: yang na bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pas rtag tu nyen pa'i phyir yi dags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pas rtag tu nyen pa'i phyir yi dags zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, they are called pretas because they are always tormented by hunger, thirst, and so on.

original: de dag gi gnas kyang phal cher gcong rong dang / mya ngam na gnas la mthu ni gcig tu ma chad de /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas kyang phal cher gcong rong dang / mya ngam na gnas la mthu ni gcig tu ma chad de /
translated: Their abode is mostly in the crevasses and deserts of Jambudvīpa, but their power is not uniform.

original: de la yi dags mthu bo che kha cig ni lha dang 'dra bar longs spyod spyod la /
analyzed: de la yi dags mthu bo che kha cig ni lha dang 'dra bar longs spyod spyod la /
translated: Some powerful pretas enjoy pleasures like gods,

original: kha cig ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pa bza' bar yang mi rnyed pa yod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pa bza' bar yang mi rnyed pa yod do //
translated: while others cannot find food such as filth.

original: de la yi dags kyi rgyal po sgra gcan 'dzin ni gshin rje dang 'dra bar mthu che ste /
analyzed: de la yi dags kyi rgyal po sgra gcan 'dzin ni gshin rje dang 'dra bar mthu che ste /
translated: The king of pretas, Rāhu, is powerful like Yama.

original: de yang 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid kyi 'og na dpag tshad stong phrag lngas bcad pa na gnas so //
analyzed: de yang 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid kyi 'og na dpag tshad stong phrag lngas bcad pa na gnas so //
translated: The abode of hungry ghosts is located five thousand yojanas below this Jambudvīpa.

original: yang na kha cig na re gshin rje nyid yi dags kyi rgyal po yin te /
analyzed: yang na kha cig na re gshin rje nyid yi dags kyi rgyal po yin te /
translated: Some say: Yama is the king of hungry ghosts.

original: de'i gnas ni sgra can 'dzin gyi gnas su bshad pa dang 'dra bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i gnas ni sgra can 'dzin gyi gnas su bshad pa dang 'dra bar gnas so //
translated: His abode is like the abode of Rāhu, the ascending node.

original: yi dags kyi tshe'i tshad ni mi rnams kyi zla ba gcig la yi dags rnams kyis nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i tshe lo lnga brgya gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: yi dags kyi tshe'i tshad ni mi rnams kyi zla ba gcig la yi dags rnams kyis nyin zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i tshe lo lnga brgya gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: The lifespan of hungry ghosts is five hundred years, one day and night of which is equal to one month of humans.

original: byol song zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byol song zhes bya ba la /
translated: The animals are said to be:

original: mi nas byol nas gzhan du skyes pa'am /
analyzed: mi nas byol nas gzhan du skyes pa'am /
translated: those born as animals after leaving the human realm,

original: bzur zhing 'gro bas na byol song ste /
analyzed: bzur zhing 'gro bas na byol song ste /
translated: and those who are born as animals after leaving the god realm.

original: de dag gi gnas ni rgya mtsho chen po yin par nges mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas ni rgya mtsho chen po yin par nges mod kyi /
translated: Their abode is definitely the great ocean.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa gsum du bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa gsum du bzhag ste /
translated: However, they are posited in three ways:

original: chu la spyod pa dang / skam la spyod pa dang / nam mkha' la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: chu la spyod pa dang / skam la spyod pa dang / nam mkha' la spyod pa'o //
translated: those who live in water, those who live on land, and those who live in the sky.

original: de la chu la spyod pa ni klu'i rgyal @50b po dang chu srin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la chu la spyod pa ni klu'i rgyal @50b po dang chu srin la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who live in the water are the kings of the nagas and the makara.

original: skam la spyod pa ni phyugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skam la spyod pa ni phyugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who live on dry land are cattle and so on.

original: nam mkha' la spyod pa ni bya la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' la spyod pa ni bya la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those who live in the sky are birds and so on.

original: byol song rnams kyi tshe dang / mthu ni gcig tu ma chad do //🔽dper na klu'i rgyal po sa 'dzin dang dga' bo dang nye dga' lta bur tshe'i tshad bskal pa bar mar gnas shing /
analyzed: byol song rnams kyi tshe dang / mthu ni gcig tu ma chad do // dper na klu'i rgyal po sa 'dzin dang dga' bo dang nye dga' lta bur tshe'i tshad bskal pa bar mar gnas shing /
translated: The life span and power of animals are not fixed.

original: ri rab 'dzin nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pa yang yod do //🔽lha ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ri rab 'dzin nus pa'i mthu dang ldan pa yang yod do // lha ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, the naga kings Sahu, Nanda, Upananda live for an intermediate eon and have the power to hold up Mount Meru.

original: nga rgyal lam zhes sdang gis dge ba byas pa'i las kyi rgyu las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal lam zhes sdang gis dge ba byas pa'i las kyi rgyu las skyes pa ste /
translated: The asuras are born from the cause of virtuous karma through pride or hatred.

original: de dag gi gnas kyang sa chen po 'di'i steng na gnas la /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas kyang sa chen po 'di'i steng na gnas la /
translated: Their abode is on the great earth.

original: tshe'i tshad ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dag dang mnyam par grags so //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dag dang mnyam par grags so //
translated: It is well known that their life span is equal to that of the gods of the desire realm.

original: de la mi ni gang gling bzhi na gnas pa dag ste /
analyzed: de la mi ni gang gling bzhi na gnas pa dag ste /
translated: Humans are those who live on the four continents.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i yid las skyes pas na /🔽mi'o zhes gsung rab kyi nang nas bshad pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i yid las skyes pas na / mi'o zhes gsung rab kyi nang nas bshad pa'i don to //
translated: They are born from the mind that is meritorious or nonmeritorious.

original: yang na drang srong ma nu las skyes shing bcas pas ni /
analyzed: yang na drang srong ma nu las skyes shing bcas pas ni /
translated: Or they are born from the sage Manu and are born from the creator.

original: shed bu las skyes pa ma na tsa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: shed bu las skyes pa ma na tsa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: They are called Manuṣya because they are born from Manu.

original: shed bdag / mu stegs dag skye dgu'i bdag po zhes bya /
analyzed: shed bdag / mu stegs dag skye dgu'i bdag po zhes bya /
translated: The tīrthikas say they are born from Prajāpati, the lord of creatures.

original: mi'o zhes 'jig rten pa dag smra'o //
analyzed: mi'o zhes 'jig rten pa dag smra'o //
translated: The world says they are born from Manu.🔽The four continents are Videha in the east, Godānīya in the west, Kuru in the north, and Jambudvīpa in the south.

original: de la gling bzhi ni shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / lho'i 'dzam bu'i gling dang / de la shar gyi lus 'phags gling ni zla ba phyed pa ltar 'dug ste /🔽de khor yug gi ngos gsum la /
analyzed: de la gling bzhi ni shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / lho'i 'dzam bu'i gling dang / de la shar gyi lus 'phags gling ni zla ba phyed pa ltar 'dug ste / de khor yug gi ngos gsum la /
translated: The continent of Videha in the east is shaped like a half moon.

original: dpag tshad nyis stong yod do //
analyzed: dpag tshad nyis stong yod do //
translated: Its three sides are two thousand yojanas.

original: ngos bzhi pa la ni dpag tshad sum brgya lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: ngos bzhi pa la ni dpag tshad sum brgya lnga bcu'o //
translated: The fourth side facing the ocean is three hundred and fifty yojanas.

original: de na grong khyer lus 'phags zhes bya ba zhig yod pa las dras te gling gi ming du yang shar gyi lus 'phags zhes bya bar btags so //
analyzed: de na grong khyer lus 'phags zhes bya ba zhig yod pa las dras te gling gi ming du yang shar gyi lus 'phags zhes bya bar btags so //
translated: The city of Uttarakuru is located in the middle of that continent.

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod ni dbyibs zla ba gang ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod ni dbyibs zla ba gang ba lta bu ste /
translated: The continent of Godaniya in the west has the shape of a half moon.

original: ril gyi khor yug du dpag tshad stong phrag phyed dang brgyad yod do //🔽de na nyo tshong gi zong ba lang gis byed pas na /
analyzed: ril gyi khor yug du dpag tshad stong phrag phyed dang brgyad yod do // de na nyo tshong gi zong ba lang gis byed pas na /
translated: It is yojanas in circumference and yojanas on each side.🔽Since cattle are used as currency in that continent,

original: de la dras te gling gi ming yang nub kyi ban glang spyod ces bya bar btags so //🔽byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling ni /
analyzed: de la dras te gling gi ming yang nub kyi ban glang spyod ces bya bar btags so // byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling ni /
translated: it is called Godaniya, “cattle enjoyers,” from the verbal root gṛd.🔽The continent of Kuru in the north

original: khri'u bzhin du gri bzhi ste /
analyzed: khri'u bzhin du gri bzhi ste /
translated: is square and

original: ngos gcig cing yang dpag tshad nyis stong stong nyis stong yod pa spyir na dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad do //
analyzed: ngos gcig cing yang dpag tshad nyis stong stong nyis stong yod pa spyir na dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad do //
translated: each side is yojanas, making yojanas in circumference.

original: de yang 'chi khar sgra drag po byung nas dus byed pa'i phyir /🔽gling gi @51a * //
analyzed: de yang 'chi khar sgra drag po byung nas dus byed pa'i phyir / gling gi @51a * //
translated: Since the people there die when a loud sound occurs,

original: ming yang byang gi sgra mi snyan zhes btags so //
analyzed: ming yang byang gi sgra mi snyan zhes btags so //
translated: the continent is called Uttarakuru, “loud sound in the north.”

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbyibs ni sog khar 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbyibs ni sog khar 'dug ste /
translated: The shape of Jambudvīpa is like a chariot.

original: stod che la smad phra'o //
analyzed: stod che la smad phra'o //
translated: The northern part is large and the southern part is narrow.

original: ngos gsum re re zhing yang dpag tshad stong phrag gnyis gnyis yod /
analyzed: ngos gsum re re zhing yang dpag tshad stong phrag gnyis gnyis yod /
translated: Each of the three sides is 2,000 yojanas.

original: ngos phra mo la ni dpag tshad phyed dang bzhi ste /🔽gling de na shing 'dzam bu zhes bya ba las dras te /
analyzed: ngos phra mo la ni dpag tshad phyed dang bzhi ste / gling de na shing 'dzam bu zhes bya ba las dras te /
translated: The narrow side is 1.5 yojanas.🔽In that continent there is a tree called Jambu,

original: gling gi ming yang 'dzam bu'i gling du btags so //
analyzed: gling gi ming yang 'dzam bu'i gling du btags so //
translated: and the continent is named after it.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags kyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad lo nyis brgya lnga bcur gnas la /
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags kyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad lo nyis brgya lnga bcur gnas la /
translated: The lifespan of humans in Videha in the east is 250 years.

original: lus kyi tshad ni khru brgyad do //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad ni khru brgyad do //
translated: Their bodies are eight cubits tall.

original: nub kyi ba langs spyod kyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni //
analyzed: nub kyi ba langs spyod kyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni //
translated: The lifespan of humans in Godānīya in the west is

original: lo lnga brgya la lus kyi tshad ni 'dom bzhi'o //
analyzed: lo lnga brgya la lus kyi tshad ni 'dom bzhi'o //
translated: 500 years and their bodies are four cubits tall.

original: yang na khru bcu drug go //
analyzed: yang na khru bcu drug go //
translated: Or, they are sixteen cubits tall.

original: tshangs lha nye phan rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshangs lha nye phan rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Brahma's Ministers:

original: tshangs pa chen po blon po ltar phan zhing ris der skyes pas na tshangs pa gzhan pas nang 'khor ltar gnas shing bsam gtan las langs pa na mdun du 'gro ba dang rim gro byed pas tshangs lha nye phan zhes bya ba'am tshangs pa chen po'i mdun du
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po blon po ltar phan zhing ris der skyes pas na tshangs pa gzhan pas nang 'khor ltar gnas shing bsam gtan las langs pa na mdun du 'gro ba dang rim gro byed pas tshangs lha nye phan zhes bya ba'am tshangs pa chen po'i mdun du
translated: Since they abide like inner retinue to Mahabrahma and when rising from meditative attainment they go in front and serve him, they are called Brahmapurohita, or Brahmapurohita.

original: thal mo sbyar nas smrang 'don pas na tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas smrang 'don pas na tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don zhes bya ste /
translated: Since they chant with palms joined in front of Mahabrahma, they are called Brahmapurohita.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa gcig tu gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa gcig tu gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is one eon and they die after remaining there for one eon.

original: lus kyi tshad ni khrom dgongs gcig go //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad ni khrom dgongs gcig go //
translated: Their size is one krośa.

original: tshangs chen rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshangs chen rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those called Mahabrahma

original: tshangs pa gnyis la ltos nas tshe dang kha dog dang mthu khyad zhugs pas tshangs chen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa gnyis la ltos nas tshe dang kha dog dang mthu khyad zhugs pas tshangs chen zhes bya'o //
translated: are called Mahabrahma because their lifespan, color and power are superior in comparison to the two Brahmas.

original: yang na gzhan las 'phags par dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po las skyes shing mchog tu gyur pas na tshangs chen zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhan las 'phags par dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po las skyes shing mchog tu gyur pas na tshangs chen zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, they are called Mahabrahma because they are born from roots of virtue that are superior to others and they are supreme.

original: phal pas lhag par bsam gtan gyi khyad par thob ste kun bas sngon du skyes la /🔽tha mar 'chi bas na tshangs chen no //
analyzed: phal pas lhag par bsam gtan gyi khyad par thob ste kun bas sngon du skyes la / tha mar 'chi bas na tshangs chen no //
translated: The gods of Mahābrahma are superior to the others because they obtain a special meditative attainment. They are born first and die last.

original: de'i tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa phyed dang gnyis su gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa phyed dang gnyis su gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: The lifespan of the gods of Mahābrahma is one and a half eons.

original: lus kyi tshad ni khrom dgongs phyed dang gnyis so //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad ni khrom dgongs phyed dang gnyis so //
translated: Their bodies are one and a half yojanas in size.

original: 'od chung zhes bya ba la rang gis gong ma gnyis la ltos nas de dag gi lus nas gzi dang 'od kyi snang ba chung bas 'od chung ste /
analyzed: 'od chung zhes bya ba la rang gis gong ma gnyis la ltos nas de dag gi lus nas gzi dang 'od kyi snang ba chung bas 'od chung ste /
translated: The gods called Parīttābha have less light and splendor than the two higher gods.

original: tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa gnyis su gnas nas dus byed do //🔽lus kyi tshad ni khrom @53a * //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa gnyis su gnas nas dus byed do // lus kyi tshad ni khrom @53a * //
translated: Their lifespan is two eons.

original: dgongs gnyis so //
analyzed: dgongs gnyis so //
translated: Their bodies are two yojanas in size.🔽The gods called Apramāṇābha have light and splendor that cannot be measured or determined by saying, “It is this much.”

original: tshad med 'od ces bya ba la de dag gi 'od dang gzi 'di tsam tshad kyis gzhal zhing bcad par mi nus pas na tshad med 'od de tshe'i tshad bskal pa bzhir gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: tshad med 'od ces bya ba la de dag gi 'od dang gzi 'di tsam tshad kyis gzhal zhing bcad par mi nus pas na tshad med 'od de tshe'i tshad bskal pa bzhir gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is four eons.

original: lus kyi tshad ni khrom dgongs bzhi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad ni khrom dgongs bzhi'o //
translated: Their bodies are four yojanas in size.

original: 'od snang zhes bya ba la bdag gi sar ma gtogs pa'i gnas gzhan du yang gzi brjid dang 'od kyis snang bar byed pas na 'od snang ste /
analyzed: 'od snang zhes bya ba la bdag gi sar ma gtogs pa'i gnas gzhan du yang gzi brjid dang 'od kyis snang bar byed pas na 'od snang ste /
translated: Abhasvara means that they illuminate other realms with their splendor and light, not just their own realm.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa brgyad du gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa brgyad du gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is eight eons and they die after that.

original: lus kyi tshad ni khrom dgongs brgyad do //🔽dge chung zhes bya ba la dge ba yang 'di'i skabs su bsam gtan las skyes pa'i yid kyi sa'i bde ba la dge ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi tshad ni khrom dgongs brgyad do // dge chung zhes bya ba la dge ba yang 'di'i skabs su bsam gtan las skyes pa'i yid kyi sa'i bde ba la dge ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Their bodies are eight krośas in size.🔽Parīttābha means small virtue. In this context, virtue refers to mental pleasure arising from the absorptions.

original: bdag gi sar gtogs pa las gong ma la ltos nas yid kyi bde ba chung bas na dge chung ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi sar gtogs pa las gong ma la ltos nas yid kyi bde ba chung bas na dge chung ngo //
translated: Since mental pleasure is small in comparison to higher levels, it is called small virtue.

original: tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa bcu drug tu gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa bcu drug tu gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is sixteen eons and they die after that.

original: lus kyi tshad ni khrom dgongs bcu'o //🔽tshad med dge zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi tshad ni khrom dgongs bcu'o // tshad med dge zhes bya ba la /
translated: Their bodies are ten krośas in size.🔽Apramāṇābha means immeasurable light.

original: de'i dge ba yang tshad kyis gzhal du med pas na tshad med dge ba 'am /
analyzed: de'i dge ba yang tshad kyis gzhal du med pas na tshad med dge ba 'am /
translated: Since their virtue is immeasurable, it is immeasurable virtue.

original: yid kyi bde ba tshad med pa dang ldan pas na tshad med dge ba ste /
analyzed: yid kyi bde ba tshad med pa dang ldan pas na tshad med dge ba ste /
translated: Since they possess immeasurable mental bliss, they are immeasurable virtue.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa sum cu gnyis su gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa sum cu gnyis su gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is thirty-two eons and they die after that.

original: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs sum cu gnyis so //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs sum cu gnyis so //
translated: Their bodies are thirty-two leagues.

original: ma lus dge ba rnams zhes bya ba la de dag ma lus dge ba ste /🔽yid kyi bde ba ma lus par rdzogs par yod pa'am /
analyzed: ma lus dge ba rnams zhes bya ba la de dag ma lus dge ba ste / yid kyi bde ba ma lus par rdzogs par yod pa'am /
translated: Those of pure virtue are those of pure virtue without exception.

original: de dag dam par 'gyur pa'i bde ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ma lus dge ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dam par 'gyur pa'i bde ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ma lus dge ba'o //
translated: They possess mental bliss without exception or they are pure virtue without exception because they have no other bliss that is higher.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa drug bcu rtsa bzhir gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa drug bcu rtsa bzhir gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is sixty-four eons and they die after that.

original: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Their bodies are sixty-four leagues.

original: sprin med rnams zhes bya ba la ji ltar yul gyi steng du sprin gyi mchod pa med pa de bzhin du sa de'i gong du sa gzhan gyis bsgribs pa med pas na /
analyzed: sprin med rnams zhes bya ba la ji ltar yul gyi steng du sprin gyi mchod pa med pa de bzhin du sa de'i gong du sa gzhan gyis bsgribs pa med pas na /
translated: Those of the cloudless are those of the cloudless without exception.

original: sprin med dang sprin bzhin du de dag sa dang 'brel pa med pas na sprin med de /
analyzed: sprin med dang sprin bzhin du de dag sa dang 'brel pa med pas na sprin med de /
translated: Since they are not connected to the earth like clouds, they are called the Cloudless.

original: lha de dag gi gzhal med khang nam mkha' la gnas la gzhal med khang dang lhan cig tu skye zhing du sa gcig tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha de dag gi gzhal med khang nam mkha' la gnas la gzhal med khang dang lhan cig tu skye zhing du sa gcig tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The palaces of these gods abide in space, and they are born together with their palaces and perish in the same place.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa brgya nyi shu rtsa lngar gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa brgya nyi shu rtsa lngar gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is one hundred and twenty-five eons, and then they die.

original: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs brgya nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //🔽bsod nams 'phel rnams @53b zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs brgya nyi shu rtsa lnga'o // bsod nams 'phel rnams @53b zhes bya ba la /
translated: Their bodies are one hundred and twenty-five krośas in size.

original: so so'i skye bo'i bsod nams su gtogs pa'i mchog thob pa'i gnas yin pas bsod nams 'phel rnams te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i bsod nams su gtogs pa'i mchog thob pa'i gnas yin pas bsod nams 'phel rnams te /
translated: The gods of the abode of increasing merit are so called because they are the abode of those who have attained the highest merit of ordinary beings.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa nyis brgya lnga bcur gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa nyis brgya lnga bcur gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is two hundred and fifty eons, and then they die.

original: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
translated: Their bodies are two hundred and fifty krośas in size.

original: 'bras bu che rnams zhes bya ba la gnas gzhan pas shas cher dge ba'i 'bras bu bsags pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu che rnams zhes bya ba la gnas gzhan pas shas cher dge ba'i 'bras bu bsags pas /
translated: Those called Mahābrāhmaṇas are so called because they have accumulated the results of virtue to a great degree in other abodes.

original: der skyes pa'i las ngan pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: der skyes pa'i las ngan pas ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not born there due to bad karma.

original: 'bras bu'i mchog thob pas na 'bras bu che rnams so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mchog thob pas na 'bras bu che rnams so //
translated: They are called Mahābrāhmaṇas because they obtain the supreme result.

original: yang na 'og ma so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'bras bu khyad zhugs pas thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu che rnams te /
analyzed: yang na 'og ma so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'bras bu khyad zhugs pas thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu che rnams te /
translated: Or, they are called Mahābrāhmaṇas because they obtain a result that is superior to the level of ordinary beings below.

original: de'i tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa lnga brgyar gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa lnga brgyar gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is five hundred eons, and they die after remaining there.

original: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs lnga brgya'o //
translated: Their body size is five hundred yojanas.

original: mi che rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi che rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those called Parīttābhās are so called

original: gnas gtsang ma'i ngang na de'i mchog ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i ngang na de'i mchog ma yin te /
translated: because they are not supreme among the pure abodes.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i gong ma bas bsod nams chung bas mi che ba'o //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i gong ma bas bsod nams chung bas mi che ba'o //
translated: They are called Parīttābhās because their merit is less than that of the higher pure abodes.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa stong du gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa stong du gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is one thousand eons, and they die after remaining there.

original: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs stong ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs stong ngo //
translated: Their body size is one thousand yojanas.

original: mi gdung rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi gdung rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those called Apramāṇābhās are so called🔽because they are immeasurable.

original: bsam pa dge ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam pa dge ba'i phyir /
translated: Because their intention is virtuous.

original: der skyes pa rnams kyi mthu dang lhag pa'i bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu dang tshe dang yon tan lhag par yod kyang sa 'og ma rnams la mi gnod zil gyis mi gnon pas na mi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: der skyes pa rnams kyi mthu dang lhag pa'i bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu dang tshe dang yon tan lhag par yod kyang sa 'og ma rnams la mi gnod zil gyis mi gnon pas na mi gdung ba'o //
translated: They are called the nonperplexed because they do not torment the lower levels, though they have greater power, higher absorption, lifespan and qualities.

original: yang na bsam gtan khyad par can thob pas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gdung bar mi nus pas na mi gdung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bsam gtan khyad par can thob pas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gdung bar mi nus pas na mi gdung ba ste /
translated: Or they are called the nonperplexed because they are not tormented by affliction through obtaining special absorption.

original: tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa nyis stong du gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa nyis stong du gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is to remain for two thousand eons and then die.

original: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs nyis stong ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs nyis stong ngo //
translated: Their body size is two thousand yojanas.

original: shin tu mthong rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu mthong rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those called the farseeing

original: gzhan gyis de'i lha rab tu zhi ba'i khyad par dang ldan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de'i lha rab tu zhi ba'i khyad par dang ldan te /
translated: have special peacefulness of gods that others do not obtain.

original: bde ba dang ldan pas ma thob pas na /🔽shin tu mthong ba'am /🔽lta ba rnam par dag ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pas ma thob pas na / shin tu mthong ba'am / lta ba rnam par dag ste /
translated: They possess bliss.🔽Therefore they are farseeing.🔽Or they are called farseeing because they see the pure view.

original: zag pa med par mthong bas na shin tu mthong rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa med par mthong bas na shin tu mthong rnams so //
translated: They are called the farseeing because they see without contaminants.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa bzhi stong du gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa bzhi stong du gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespans are four thousand eons, and they die when their lifespan is complete.

original: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs bzhi stong ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs bzhi stong ngo //
translated: Their bodies are four thousand yojanas in size.

original: gya nom snang rnams zhes bya'o //🔽zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan la ci dgar 'dren par bsgom yang 'dres pa dang 'khri ba med par byed pa'i mthu dang @54a * //
analyzed: gya nom snang rnams zhes bya'o // zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan la ci dgar 'dren par bsgom yang 'dres pa dang 'khri ba med par byed pa'i mthu dang @54a * //
translated: The Akaniṣṭha gods are called the “Shining Ones”

original: ldan pas na sgrib pa chen po ma lus par dag par mthong bas gya nom rnams sam /
analyzed: ldan pas na sgrib pa chen po ma lus par dag par mthong bas gya nom rnams sam /
translated: because they have the power to mix and unmix the dhyānas with and without fluxes as they wish, and because they see the complete purification of the great obscurations.

original: bzang po dang legs par mthong ste bdag med pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par mthong bas na gya nom snang rnams so //
analyzed: bzang po dang legs par mthong ste bdag med pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par mthong bas na gya nom snang rnams so //
translated: They are called the Shining Ones because they see the good, the excellent, and the selflessness and impermanence.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa brgya stong du gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa brgya stong du gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespans are one hundred thousand eons, and they die when their lifespan is complete.

original: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs brgya stong ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs brgya stong ngo //
translated: Their bodies are one hundred thousand yojanas in size.

original: 'og min rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'og min rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Akaniṣṭha gods are called the “Unsurpassed Ones”

original: gnas 'og ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas 'og ma ma yin te /
translated: because they are not in a lower realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams de'i gong nas gzugs can gyi khams gzhan med pas na 'og min nam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams de'i gong nas gzugs can gyi khams gzhan med pas na 'og min nam /
translated: Since there is no other form realm above that form realm, it is Akaniṣṭha.

original: de las mchog tu gyur pa'i gnas gzhan med de gzhan bas chung ngu dang ngan par ma gyur pa'i phyir 'og min no //
analyzed: de las mchog tu gyur pa'i gnas gzhan med de gzhan bas chung ngu dang ngan par ma gyur pa'i phyir 'og min no //
translated: Or it is called Akaniṣṭha because there is no other realm that is superior to it, since it is not inferior or lower than others.

original: yang na sdug bsngal bsags pa'i lus a'a gha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal bsags pa'i lus a'a gha zhes bya ste /
translated: Or it is called Akaniṣṭha because it is the final collection of the body of suffering.

original: bsags pa'i gzugs kyi mthar phyin pas a'a gha nishtha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsags pa'i gzugs kyi mthar phyin pas a'a gha nishtha zhes bya ste /
translated: Or it is called Akaniṣṭha because it is the final limit of the collection of form.

original: yang na a'a gha zhes bya ba ni sdig pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na a'a gha zhes bya ba ni sdig pa la bya ste /
translated: Or it is called Akaniṣṭha because it is the final limit of evil.

original: sdig pa mthar phyin te zag pa rnams skye ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir a'a gha nishtha'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mthar phyin te zag pa rnams skye ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir a'a gha nishtha'o //
translated: Or it is called Akaniṣṭha because it is the final limit of evil and the abode of the arising of the contaminants.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa khri drug stong gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa khri drug stong gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: Their lifespan is sixteen thousand eons and they die after living that long.

original: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs khri drung stong ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad kyang khrom dgongs khri drung stong ngo //
translated: Their bodies are also sixteen thousand yojanas.

original: mi che ba nas 'og min gyi gnas man chad gnas gtsang ma'i ris zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi che ba nas 'og min gyi gnas man chad gnas gtsang ma'i ris zhes bya ste /
translated: From Mahābrahma down to Akaniṣṭha is called the class of the pure abodes.

original: 'phags pa lam gyi chus nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bkrus pas sems kyi rgyud dag pa 'ba' zhig skye bas na gnas gtsang ma'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa lam gyi chus nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bkrus pas sems kyi rgyud dag pa 'ba' zhig skye bas na gnas gtsang ma'am /
translated: The noble ones are born with a pure mindstream, since the water of the path washes away the stains of the afflictions.

original: yang na bu lon gtsang ma bzhin du 'khor ba'i bu lon mthar phyung ste gsang ba rnams skyes pas na gnas gtsang ma'o //
analyzed: yang na bu lon gtsang ma bzhin du 'khor ba'i bu lon mthar phyung ste gsang ba rnams skyes pas na gnas gtsang ma'o //
translated: Or, they are pure abodes because they are born as secret beings who have paid off the debt of samsara.

original: yang na so so'i skye bo dang / ma 'dres par 'phags pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams nyi tshe gnas pas na gnas gtsang ma 'o //
analyzed: yang na so so'i skye bo dang / ma 'dres par 'phags pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams nyi tshe gnas pas na gnas gtsang ma 'o //
translated: Or, they are pure abodes because they are the exclusive abode of noble beings who are nonreturners, unmixed with ordinary beings.

original: gzugs med pa'i srid pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i srid pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To present formless states, it says:

original: gzugs med pa'i srid pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i srid pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is formless existence?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽snang bar byar rung bas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / snang bar byar rung bas na /
translated: and so on.

original: gzugs yin la /
analyzed: gzugs yin la /
translated: Form is that which is suitable to appear.

original: snang bar byar rung ba med pas gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: snang bar byar rung ba med pas gzugs med pa'o //
translated: Formless states are those that are not suitable to appear.

original: nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so //

original: zhes dmigs par byed de /
analyzed: zhes dmigs par byed de /

analyzed: de nyid der skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen yin pas na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Since that is the cause and condition for being born there, it is called the base of infinite space.🔽In other sūtras, the first thought of preparation is said to be:

analyzed: de dag gis dang por sbyor @54b ba'i sems kyang mdo gzhan dag las gzugs kyi 'du shes ni yang dag par 'das /

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes ni nub par gyur /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes ni nub par gyur /

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes ni yid la mi byed de /

analyzed: nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so zhes nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par zhugs te gnas so // zhes gsungs so //

original: de'i don yang 'di dag ni nam mkha' tsam ste /
analyzed: de'i don yang 'di dag ni nam mkha' tsam ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: These are merely space.

original: gang dbyibs dang kha dog sngo ba dang ser ba dang dmar ba dang dkar ba dang yang dag par ldan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bde ba dang mi bde ba 'dod chags dang bral te kha dog de dag la 'du shes mi 'jug pas na de'i phyir gzugs
analyzed: gang dbyibs dang kha dog sngo ba dang ser ba dang dmar ba dang dkar ba dang yang dag par ldan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bde ba dang mi bde ba 'dod chags dang bral te kha dog de dag la 'du shes mi 'jug pas na de'i phyir gzugs
translated: Whatever is blue, yellow, red, white, or has a shape, is pleasant or unpleasant, and arises from a cause is free from attachment. Since one does not engage with the idea of those colors, therefore

original: ni yang dag par 'das zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ni yang dag par 'das zhes gsungs te /

original: de ltar gzugs kyi 'du shes la yang dag par 'das pas snang ba med par song ba'i rgyus kha dog rnam pa sna tshogs par byed pa'i rgyus rdul bsags pa thogs pa can gyi dngos po la sgrib pa dang thogs pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar gyur te
analyzed: de ltar gzugs kyi 'du shes la yang dag par 'das pas snang ba med par song ba'i rgyus kha dog rnam pa sna tshogs par byed pa'i rgyus rdul bsags pa thogs pa can gyi dngos po la sgrib pa dang thogs pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar gyur te
translated: Thus, since the idea of form is truly transcended, the cause for the non-appearance of various colors is the cause for the various colors. Since one is free from the idea of obstruction and impediment with regard to the substantial entities that are the accumulation of particles,

analyzed: / de bas na thogs pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes ni nub par gyur ces gsungs so //

translated: Having thus destroyed the perception of obstruction and variety, he transcends the concentration of near attainment and through the concentration of application, he verbalizes the sphere of infinite space.

original: de bas na nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de bas na nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so //

translated: one searches for what is observed beyond consciousness and

translated: One who abides in that way is said to be in the concentration of the threshold of the base of nothingness and the concentration of the mental attention of the culmination of the preparatory stage.

original: des 'du shes de la mos pa mang du byas pas cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi nye bar bsdogs pa dang / sbyor ba ma thar thug pa'i yid la byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin las 'das nas /

translated: By cultivating that conviction in discernment a great deal, he passes beyond the concentration of the threshold of the base of nothingness and the concentration of the mental attention of the culmination of the preparatory stage.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu rtsa ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu rtsa ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: He enters and abides in the fundamental concentration that is the result of the culmination of the preparatory stage.

original: de bas na mdo gzhan las de rnam pa thams cad du /
analyzed: de bas na mdo gzhan las de rnam pa thams cad du /
translated: Therefore, in another sutra it says:

original: rnam shes mtha' yas las yang dag par 'das nas /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas las yang dag par 'das nas /
translated: Having completely transcended the base of infinite consciousness,

original: cung zad kyang med do zhes cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs te gnas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: cung zad kyang med do zhes cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs te gnas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: he enters and abides in the base of nothingness.

original: de yang dbye na cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na ni rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas /
analyzed: de yang dbye na cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na ni rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas /
translated: If that is classified, at the time of the concentration of the base of nothingness, consciousness is infinite in every way.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba la /
translated: The base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment is called neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: 'du shes ni shu ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni shu ba'o //
translated: Discernment is a boil.

original: 'du shes ni zug rngu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni zug rngu'o //
translated: Discernment is a thorn.

original: 'du shes med pa yang rmongs pa ste zhes 'du shes phra ba la gnas pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min zhes bya ste /🔽de nyid der skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen yin pas na 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o //
