translated: Abiding in subtle discernment is called neither discernment nor nondiscernment.🔽Since that is the cause and condition for birth there, it is called the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: de'i don yang 'du shes med min skye mched kyi dus na cung zad med kyi skye mched las bskyed do //
analyzed: de'i don yang 'du shes med min skye mched kyi dus na cung zad med kyi skye mched las bskyed do //
translated: The meaning of that is that at the time of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, it is generated from the base of nothingness.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na cung zad med min skye mched kyi 'du shes la chags pa dang na ba dang shu ba la sogs pa bzhin du nyes dmigs dang bcas par yid la byed pa'o //🔽cung zad med cung @56a * //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na cung zad med min skye mched kyi 'du shes la chags pa dang na ba dang shu ba la sogs pa bzhin du nyes dmigs dang bcas par yid la byed pa'o // cung zad med cung @56a * //
translated: How is that? It is the attention to the sphere of nothingness as having faults, like the attention to the feeling of pain in a boil, etc.🔽The sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is the attention to the culmination of the practice of the sphere of nothingness.

original: zad med min gyi sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pas ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na ni 'du shes dang bcas pa yang zug rngu dang 'dra bar mi bde ba yin /
analyzed: zad med min gyi sbyor ba mthar thug pa yid la byed pas ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na ni 'du shes dang bcas pa yang zug rngu dang 'dra bar mi bde ba yin /
translated: At the time of concentration, it is painful like a thorn, even with perception.

original: 'du shes thams cad du spangs pa yang rmongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad du spangs pa yang rmongs pa yin no //
translated: And it is delusion, because it is the complete abandonment of all perception.

original: shes rab tu pra ba'i 'du shes la gnas te /
analyzed: shes rab tu pra ba'i 'du shes la gnas te /
translated: It is the attention to the perception that is called wisdom.

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes las bzlog pas na /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes las bzlog pas na /
translated: It is the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, because it turns away from the perception of the sphere of nothingness.

original: de'i phyir mdo gzhan las cung zad med pa'i skye mched la gnas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo gzhan las cung zad med pa'i skye mched la gnas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in another sutra, it is said to be the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched la nye bar bsdogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin las 'das nas /
analyzed: de cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched la nye bar bsdogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin las 'das nas /
translated: It is the concentration of the threshold of the base of nothingness and the concentration of the mental contemplation of final training.

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu rtsa ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu rtsa ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: Having transcended those, one enters equipoise in the basic concentration that is the result of final training.🔽Therefore a sutra declares:

original: de bas mdo las des rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med kyi skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de bas mdo las des rnam pa thams cad du cung zad med kyi skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Having completely transcended the base of nothingness,

original: cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched las snyoms par zhugs nas gnas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: cung zad med cung zad med min skye mched las snyoms par zhugs nas gnas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: he enters and remains in the base of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs kyi mtshan ma med pas sems tsam la brten nas bsgoms te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni gzugs kyi mtshan ma med pas sems tsam la brten nas bsgoms te /
translated: In the formless realm, since the signs of form do not exist, one meditates in dependence on mind alone.🔽Therefore a sutra declares:

original: de bas na mdo las sems tsam la bsam gtan pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na mdo las sems tsam la bsam gtan pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Meditate on the mind alone.

original: de dag kyang 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams bzhin du gnas kyi rim pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams bzhin du gnas kyi rim pa ni med kyi /
translated: Also, as in the desire realm and form realm, there is no sequence of levels.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / tshe ring thung du skye ba'i bye brag tsam gyis dbye bar zad de de bas na mdo las gzugs med pa'i lha rnams kyi skye mched rnam pa bzhi po 'di ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / tshe ring thung du skye ba'i bye brag tsam gyis dbye bar zad de de bas na mdo las gzugs med pa'i lha rnams kyi skye mched rnam pa bzhi po 'di ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, a sutra states:🔽The four bases of the formless gods are:

original: gang gong du gzugs med pa'i lha rnams kyi skye ba rnam pa bzhi bshad pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gong du gzugs med pa'i lha rnams kyi skye ba rnam pa bzhi bshad pa de ni /
translated: The four types of birth of the formless gods explained above

original: gzugs med pa'i srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are called the formless realm.

original: de la nam mkha' mtha' yas su skyes pa'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa stong phrag nyi shur gnas nas dus byed do //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' mtha' yas su skyes pa'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni bskal pa stong phrag nyi shur gnas nas dus byed do //
translated: The lifespan of gods born in Infinite Space endures for twenty thousand eons.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas ni bskal pa stong phrag bzhi bcu'o //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas ni bskal pa stong phrag bzhi bcu'o //
translated: The lifespan of gods born in Infinite Consciousness endures for forty thousand eons.

original: cung zad med pa ni stong phrag drug cu'o //
analyzed: cung zad med pa ni stong phrag drug cu'o //
translated: The lifespan of gods born in Nothingness endures for sixty thousand eons.

original: tha ma ni stong phrag brgyad cur gnas so //
analyzed: tha ma ni stong phrag brgyad cur gnas so //
translated: The lifespan of gods born in the Peak of Existence endures for eighty thousand eons.

original: gzugs med pa'i lha rnams kyang gnas gang du snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas de nyid du shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye bar zad kyi gzhan du skye ba po med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i lha rnams kyang gnas gang du snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas de nyid du shi 'phos nas de nyid du skye bar zad kyi gzhan du skye ba po med do //
translated: The formless gods also die in the place where they attain meditative attainment and are reborn in that very place.

original: bskal pa 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams ni sems gzugs la @56b brten na /
analyzed: bskal pa 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams ni sems gzugs la @56b brten na /
translated: The desire realm and the form realm are eons.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ming gi phung po bzhi rnams gcig la brten /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ming gi phung po bzhi rnams gcig la brten /
translated: In the formless realm, the four name aggregates are based on one another.

original: smras pa mdung gsum rtse sprad pa'i shing gcig la gcig brten pa bzhin du /🔽ming gi phung po bzhi nyid gcig la gcig brten pa'am /
analyzed: smras pa mdung gsum rtse sprad pa'i shing gcig la gcig brten pa bzhin du / ming gi phung po bzhi nyid gcig la gcig brten pa'am /
translated: It is said that they are like three sticks supported by one another.🔽The four name aggregates are based on one another.

original: ming gi phung po bzhi rnams tshor ba'i dbang po dang ris mthun pa'i chos la brten to //
analyzed: ming gi phung po bzhi rnams tshor ba'i dbang po dang ris mthun pa'i chos la brten to //
translated: Or the four name aggregates are based on the feeling faculty and phenomena of similar type.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob par byed pa'i ltas ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob par byed pa'i ltas ni /
translated: The sign of attaining the formless meditative attainment is

original: nam mkha' las lus ltung ba snyam yid la byed pa skye'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' las lus ltung ba snyam yid la byed pa skye'o //
translated: the mental state that thinks the body is falling from the sky.

original: brgal ba / mdo gzhan dag las ni ma 'ongs pa na khams gsum gyi 'bras bu len par byed pa'i las gang yin pa de srid pa'i sgrar brjod na /
analyzed: brgal ba / mdo gzhan dag las ni ma 'ongs pa na khams gsum gyi 'bras bu len par byed pa'i las gang yin pa de srid pa'i sgrar brjod na /
translated: Objection: But in other sūtras, karma that will take you to the three realms in the future is called existence.

original: 'dir ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams nyid la srid par brjod pas mdo gzhan dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams nyid la srid par brjod pas mdo gzhan dang 'gal lo //
translated: Here, the desire, form, and formless realms are called existence. Therefore this contradicts other sūtras.

original: smras pa 'di ni nyes pa med de yang ni srid pa zhes bya ba la las la bya mod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa 'di ni nyes pa med de yang ni srid pa zhes bya ba la las la bya mod kyi /
translated: Response: There is no error here. Although the term existence is used for karma,

original: las de ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa skyed pa'i rgyu yin la srid pa gsum ni las kyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: las de ni ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa skyed pa'i rgyu yin la srid pa gsum ni las kyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: that karma is the cause generating future existence and the three existences are the result of karma.

original: 'dir rgyu'i ming 'bras bu la btags nas rgyu des khams gsum du skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu'i ming 'bras bu la btags nas rgyu des khams gsum du skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the name of the cause is imputed to the result because the cause generates the three realms.

original: gsum la srid pa zhes btags te nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gsum la srid pa zhes btags te nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore there is no error in imputing existence to the three existences.

original: skye ba bstan pa'i phyir srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skye ba bstan pa'i phyir srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain birth, the sūtra says, “Conditioned by existence, birth occurs.”

original: srid pa'i rgyu las skye ba 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyu las skye ba 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is: “Birth occurs from the cause of existence.”

original: gang sems can de dang de rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang sems can de dang de rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Those sentient beings” refers to

original: lha dang mi dang byol song la sogs pa'i sems can de dang de dag go //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang byol song la sogs pa'i sems can de dang de dag go //
translated: those sentient beings, gods, humans, animals, and so on.

original: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rigs mthun pa'i gnas tshe phyi ma de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rigs mthun pa'i gnas tshe phyi ma de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “In those and those states of sentient beings” means in those and those similar types of states of gods, humans, and so on. The meaning is: “in those and those future lives.”

original: de la mngal gyi gnas dang sgo nga'i gnas su dang po nyid du rnam par shes pa mngon par byung ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mngal gyi gnas dang sgo nga'i gnas su dang po nyid du rnam par shes pa mngon par byung ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In that regard, the first appearance of consciousness in the womb or in the egg is called “birth.”

original: der rnam par shes pa zhugs nas ma byung gi bar du yan lag dang nyid lag rdzogs par gyur pa ni kun tu skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der rnam par shes pa zhugs nas ma byung gi bar du yan lag dang nyid lag rdzogs par gyur pa ni kun tu skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The completion of the major and minor body parts after the entry of consciousness there, but before birth, is called “complete birth.”

original: mngal du yan lag la sogs ba rdzogs nas mngal nas phyir 'byung ba ni 'pho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngal du yan lag la sogs ba rdzogs nas mngal nas phyir 'byung ba ni 'pho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The emergence from the womb after the completion of the body parts in the womb is called “emergence.”

original: gang drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa rnams dus gcig tu rang gi lus rdzogs par gyur pa ni mngon par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //🔽de ltar byung ba las de dag gi phung po lnga po nyid kha zas la sogs pas rtas @57a * //
analyzed: gang drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa rnams dus gcig tu rang gi lus rdzogs par gyur pa ni mngon par 'byung ba zhes bya'o // de ltar byung ba las de dag gi phung po lnga po nyid kha zas la sogs pas rtas @57a * //
translated: The simultaneous completion of their bodies, whether born from heat and moisture or by spontaneous birth, is called “manifestation.”

original: shing 'phel bar bya ba ni phung po rnams 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shing 'phel bar bya ba ni phung po rnams 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The growth and increase of those five aggregates through food, etc., is called “the arising of the aggregates.”

original: kha zas la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i mar gyis bsku zhing mnye ba dang bkru ba la sogs pa rkyen gzhan gyis grogs byas pa ni skye mched rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha zas la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i mar gyis bsku zhing mnye ba dang bkru ba la sogs pa rkyen gzhan gyis grogs byas pa ni skye mched rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The assistance of other conditions, such as massage with oil, bathing, etc., which are not included in food, etc., is called “the acquisition of the sense bases.”

original: de dag gi phung po nyid sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rkyen la brten pa ni khams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi phung po nyid sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rkyen la brten pa ni khams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The five aggregates themselves, which are based on the causes and conditions of previous karma and afflictions, is called “the acquisition of the elements.”

original: de dag gi phung po de dag nyid tshe'i mtha'i bar du gnas pa nyid ni 'tsho ba'i dbang po 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi phung po de dag nyid tshe'i mtha'i bar du gnas pa nyid ni 'tsho ba'i dbang po 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The duration of those aggregates until the end of life is called “the arising of the life faculty.”

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i ris su skyes pa'i ris mthun pa dang ma bral ba ni ris su skal ba mthun pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i ris su skyes pa'i ris mthun pa dang ma bral ba ni ris su skal ba mthun pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The continuity of the same type of life is the continuity of the same life-stream.🔽The four kinds of birth are taught: birth, rebirth, appearance, and manifestation.🔽Birth is the appearance of the aggregates.

original: de nas mdo rnam pa bzhi bstan te gang skye ba dang skye gnas gang gis bstan pa dang / gang gis grogs byas pa dang / skye ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nas mdo rnam pa bzhi bstan te gang skye ba dang skye gnas gang gis bstan pa dang / gang gis grogs byas pa dang / skye ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: Rebirth is the appearance of the bases.🔽Appearance is the appearance of the elements.🔽Manifestation is the appearance of the life faculty and the continuity of the same life-stream.🔽The four kinds of birth are taught: birth, rebirth, appearance, and manifestation.🔽Birth is the appearance of the aggregates.

original: de la skye ba dang zhes bya ba nas mngon par 'byung ba zhes bya ba gang skye ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la skye ba dang zhes bya ba nas mngon par 'byung ba zhes bya ba gang skye ba bstan to //
translated: Rebirth is the appearance of the bases.

original: phung po rnams 'byung ba zhes bya bas nye bar brtan pa bstan to //🔽skye mched rnams rab tu rnyed pa dang khams rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya bas gang gi grogs byas pa bstan to //
analyzed: phung po rnams 'byung ba zhes bya bas nye bar brtan pa bstan to // skye mched rnams rab tu rnyed pa dang khams rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya bas gang gi grogs byas pa bstan to //
translated: Appearance is the appearance of the elements.

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po 'byung ba dang / ris su skal ba mthun pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas skye ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po 'byung ba dang / ris su skal ba mthun pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas skye ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa bstan to //
translated: Manifestation is the appearance of the life faculty and the continuity of the same life-stream.

original: yang na gang sems can de dang de rnams zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa'i sems can la snyegs te /
analyzed: yang na gang sems can de dang de rnams zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa'i sems can la snyegs te /
translated: Or else, those sentient beings means sentient beings belonging to the class of death.

original: shi bar gyur pa'i sems can dang de rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shi bar gyur pa'i sems can dang de rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: those sentient beings who have died.

original: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i char gtogs pa la snyegs te /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i char gtogs pa la snyegs te /
translated: Those sentient beings in this or that class means sentient beings belonging to the class of birth.

original: skye bar bya ba'i sems can gyi gnas de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye bar bya ba'i sems can gyi gnas de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: those sentient beings who are to be born in this or that place.

original: gang gi las dge ba la sogs pa byas pa'i shugs dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa la mtshams sbyar bar bya ba'i gnas su rnam par shes pa skyes shing brgyal ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi las dge ba la sogs pa byas pa'i shugs dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa la mtshams sbyar bar bya ba'i gnas su rnam par shes pa skyes shing brgyal ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When consciousness arises and is suspended in a place that is connected to the future through the force of karma that has been done, whether virtuous or not, that is called birth.

original: kun tu skye ba zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma rnams ni de nyid kyi bshad pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu skye ba zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma rnams ni de nyid kyi bshad pa ste /
translated: The remaining words, “complete birth,” are an explanation of that.

original: phyi mas snga ma bshad par blta'o //
analyzed: phyi mas snga ma bshad par blta'o //
translated: The latter should be seen as an explanation of the former.

original: yang na mngal du skye ba rnams mngal gyi gnas su rnam par shes pa dang po zhugs pa ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: yang na mngal du skye ba rnams mngal gyi gnas su rnam par shes pa dang po zhugs pa ni skye ba'o //
translated: Or else, for those born from a womb, the first entry of consciousness into the womb is birth.

original: sgo ngar skyes pa rnams sgo nga'i gnas su rnam par shes pa dang po zhugs pa ni kun skye ba'o //
analyzed: sgo ngar skyes pa rnams sgo nga'i gnas su rnam par shes pa dang po zhugs pa ni kun skye ba'o //
translated: For those born from an egg, the first entry of consciousness into the egg is birth.

original: drod gsher las skyes pa rnams drod gsher gyi gnas su rnam @57b par shes pa dang po skye ba ni 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: drod gsher las skyes pa rnams drod gsher gyi gnas su rnam @57b par shes pa dang po skye ba ni 'pho ba'o //
translated: For those born from heat and moisture, the first entry of consciousness into the place of heat and moisture is birth.

original: rdzus te skyes pa rnams dus gcig tu phung po cig car 'byung ba ni mngon par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rdzus te skyes pa rnams dus gcig tu phung po cig car 'byung ba ni mngon par 'byung ba'o //
translated: For those born spontaneously, the simultaneous appearance of the aggregates is birth.

original: de la mngal du skye ba'i sems can ni mi dang byol song gi skye gnas bzhi ka nas kyang skye mod kyi /
analyzed: de la mngal du skye ba'i sems can ni mi dang byol song gi skye gnas bzhi ka nas kyang skye mod kyi /
translated: Among these, sentient beings born from a womb are born from the four modes of birth of humans and animals.

original: phal cher mngal nas skye ste /
analyzed: phal cher mngal nas skye ste /
translated: But they are mostly born from a womb.

original: mngal nas skyes pa ni byol song la yang glang po dang rta dang ba lang dang ma he dang phag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mngal nas skyes pa ni byol song la yang glang po dang rta dang ba lang dang ma he dang phag la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those born from a womb are animals such as elephants, horses, cows, buffalo, pigs, and so on.

original: de dag kyang pho mo gnyis kyi khrag dang khu ba 'dres pa las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang pho mo gnyis kyi khrag dang khu ba 'dres pa las 'gyur ro //
translated: They arise from the mixture of blood and semen of both male and female.

original: mi las sgo nga las skyes pa ni /
analyzed: mi las sgo nga las skyes pa ni /
translated: Humans born from eggs:

original: shel dang / autpa la dang / panytsa la'i rgyal po'i bu lnga brgya dang / ri dags dgra'i ma sa ga'i bu sum cu lta bu'o //
analyzed: shel dang / autpa la dang / panytsa la'i rgyal po'i bu lnga brgya dang / ri dags dgra'i ma sa ga'i bu sum cu lta bu'o //
translated: the five hundred sons of the king of Pañcāla, born from eggs that arose from the tears of King Udayana, and the thirty sons of the deer mother Mādrī.🔽Humans born from heat and moisture:

original: mi las drod gsher las skyes pa ni man dha ta lta bu'i spyi bo las skyes pa dang / mdzes pa dang / nyer mdzes dang / shing tog aa mra las skyes pa'i bu mo aa mra skyong litstsha b'i'i gtso bo rnams kyi chung mar gyur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi las drod gsher las skyes pa ni man dha ta lta bu'i spyi bo las skyes pa dang / mdzes pa dang / nyer mdzes dang / shing tog aa mra las skyes pa'i bu mo aa mra skyong litstsha b'i'i gtso bo rnams kyi chung mar gyur pa lta bu'o //
translated: the one born from the crown of King Mandhātu, and the daughter born from a mango fruit who became the wife of the leaders of the Licchavis.🔽Humans born supernaturally:

original: mi las rdzus te skyes pa ni bskal pa dang po'i mi rnams lha'i gnas nas gling bzhir skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi las rdzus te skyes pa ni bskal pa dang po'i mi rnams lha'i gnas nas gling bzhir skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: the humans of the first eon who were born in the four continents from the god realms.

original: byol song skye gnas bzhi ka nas skye ba yang ji ltar 'jig rten gzhag pa las gsungs pa sgo nga las skyes pa'i nam mkha' lding gis sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu 'dren cing za ba dang / de bzhin mngal nas skyes pas mngal nas skyes pa 'dren cing za ba dang /
analyzed: byol song skye gnas bzhi ka nas skye ba yang ji ltar 'jig rten gzhag pa las gsungs pa sgo nga las skyes pa'i nam mkha' lding gis sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu 'dren cing za ba dang / de bzhin mngal nas skyes pas mngal nas skyes pa 'dren cing za ba dang /
translated: and similarly, one born from a womb catches and eats one born from a womb,

original: de bzhin drod gsher dang rdzu ba las skyes pas kyang skye gnas pa so so'i 'dren cing za ba zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin drod gsher dang rdzu ba las skyes pas kyang skye gnas pa so so'i 'dren cing za ba zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and likewise, one born from heat and moisture and one born supernaturally catch and eat those born from their respective birth processes.

original: sgo nga las skyes pa ni bya las phal cher te /
analyzed: sgo nga las skyes pa ni bya las phal cher te /
translated: Those born from eggs are mostly birds,

original: ngang ngur dang khrung khrung dang rma bya dang ne tso la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngang ngur dang khrung khrung dang rma bya dang ne tso la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: such as geese, cranes, peacocks, parrots, and so on.

original: drod gsher las skyes pa ni grog sbur dang phye ma leb dang / sbrang bu dang sro shig las phal cher skye'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: drod gsher las skyes pa ni grog sbur dang phye ma leb dang / sbrang bu dang sro shig las phal cher skye'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Those born from heat and moisture are mostly insects, such as ants, butterflies, flies, and lice.

original: rdzus te skyes pa'i sems can gang dbang po nyams pa med cing ma tshang ba med pa dang / yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad dang ldan pas cig car du skye ba skye /
analyzed: rdzus te skyes pa'i sems can gang dbang po nyams pa med cing ma tshang ba med pa dang / yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad dang ldan pas cig car du skye ba skye /
translated: Beings who are born supernaturally are those who are born simultaneously with all their major and minor body parts fully developed, without any deficiency of faculties.

original: de yang lha dang dmyal ba dang srid pa bar ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang lha dang dmyal ba dang srid pa bar ma lta bu'o //
translated: This is like the gods, hell beings and intermediate beings.

original: yi dags dag ni mngal dang rdzus te skyes pa gnyi ga yod de /
analyzed: yi dags dag ni mngal dang rdzus te skyes pa gnyi ga yod de /
translated: Hungry ghosts are born from a womb and supernaturally.

original: mngal nas skye ba ni dper na tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu la yi dags dag smras pa /
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba ni dper na tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu la yi dags dag smras pa /
translated: Those born from a womb are like the hungry ghost who said to the venerable Maudgalyayana:

original: mtshan mo bdag gi bu lnga bskyed //
analyzed: mtshan mo bdag gi bu lnga bskyed //
translated: At night I give birth to five children

original: nyin par de bzhin gzhan dag kyang //🔽bskyed de zos par gyur mod kyis //
analyzed: nyin par de bzhin gzhan dag kyang // bskyed de zos par gyur mod kyis //
translated: and during the day I eat them

original: 'on kyang ngoms par bdag ma gyur //🔽zhes smras pa lta @58a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang ngoms par bdag ma gyur // zhes smras pa lta @58a * //
translated: but I am still not satisfied.

original: bu'o // dris pa nam mkha' lding gi skye gnas mthun mthun gyis klu 'dren cing za ba ni rung gi / rdzus pa ni thams cad 'gags ma thag tu phung po mi snang bar gyur na /
analyzed: bu'o // dris pa nam mkha' lding gi skye gnas mthun mthun gyis klu 'dren cing za ba ni rung gi / rdzus pa ni thams cad 'gags ma thag tu phung po mi snang bar gyur na /
translated: It is suitable for garuḍas to seize and eat nāgas that are born from eggs, but if those born supernaturally immediately disappear when their aggregates cease, how could they be seized and eaten?

original: ji ltar za /
analyzed: ji ltar za /
translated: How do they eat?

original: smras pa de ni snang bar 'gro ba mi shes nas za ba'i phyir 'dren pa po yod do zhes kha cig gis bshad do //
analyzed: smras pa de ni snang bar 'gro ba mi shes nas za ba'i phyir 'dren pa po yod do zhes kha cig gis bshad do //
translated: Some say: They eat without knowing that they are being led there by the light of the sun.

original: drangs nas srog dang ma bral gyi bar du zar yang rung ngo zhes slob dpon gzhan dag ni bshad do //
analyzed: drangs nas srog dang ma bral gyi bar du zar yang rung ngo zhes slob dpon gzhan dag ni bshad do //
translated: Other masters say: They eat as long as they are not separated from life.

original: phung po'i dbang du byas na skye gnas de dag tu phung po rnams 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po'i dbang du byas na skye gnas de dag tu phung po rnams 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: In terms of the aggregates, the aggregates arise in those birth processes.

original: mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma dang po la yid kyi rnam par shes pa brgyal ba na rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //🔽rnam par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i 'du shes nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma dang po la yid kyi rnam par shes pa brgyal ba na rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o // rnam par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i 'du shes nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the first moment of linking, when the mental consciousness is unconscious.

original: de'i dus na tshor ba myong ba ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de'i dus na tshor ba myong ba ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of feeling is the experience of feeling at that time.

original: khrag dang khu ba 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid mer mer po ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: khrag dang khu ba 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid mer mer po ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of form is the kalala, which has the characteristics of a mixture of blood and semen.

original: de bas na phung po rnams 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na phung po rnams 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates are said to be originated.

original: skye mched kyi dbang du gyur na /
analyzed: skye mched kyi dbang du gyur na /
translated: When it is in the stage of the sense bases,

original: de'i tshe skye mched rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe skye mched rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: at that time the sense bases are said to be obtained.

original: mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe nyid na /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe nyid na /
translated: At the time of conception,

original: khrag dang khu ba ni lus kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: khrag dang khu ba ni lus kyi skye mched do //
translated: blood and semen are the body sense base.

original: de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: Mental consciousness is the mind sense base.

original: de'i dus kyi tshor ba la sogs pa ni chos kyi skye mched de /
analyzed: de'i dus kyi tshor ba la sogs pa ni chos kyi skye mched de /
translated: Feeling, etc. at that time are the entity sense base.

original: skye mched gsum po de nyid la skye mched rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye mched gsum po de nyid la skye mched rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Those three sense bases are said to be obtained.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched ni /
translated: The eye sense base, etc.

original: de'i dus na med pas de dag la mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dus na med pas de dag la mi bya'o //
translated: are not at that time, so they are not included.

original: khams kyi dbang du byas na /
analyzed: khams kyi dbang du byas na /
translated: When it is in the stage of the elements,

original: de'i tshe khams rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe khams rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: at that time the elements are said to be obtained.

original: gang de na khrag dang khu ba'i mtshan nyid ni lus kyi khams so //
analyzed: gang de na khrag dang khu ba'i mtshan nyid ni lus kyi khams so //
translated: At that time, that which has the characteristics of blood and semen is the body element.

original: de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi khams so //
analyzed: de'i tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi khams so //
translated: Mental consciousness is the mind element.

original: de na tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa ni chos kyi khams te /
analyzed: de na tshor ba la sogs pa yod pa ni chos kyi khams te /
translated: The element of mental objects exists there, consisting of the aggregates of conceptualization, formations and consciousness.

original: de gsum la khams rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de gsum la khams rnams rab tu rnyed pa zhes bya'i /
translated: These three are called the elements that are obtained.

original: khams gzhan de'i dus na med pas na /
analyzed: khams gzhan de'i dus na med pas na /
translated: The other elements do not exist at that time.

original: gzhan la ni mi bya'o //🔽tshor ba'i dbang po 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan la ni mi bya'o // tshor ba'i dbang po 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, they are not mentioned.🔽The arising of the faculty of sensation is the first formative force of life.

original: tshe'i 'du byed dang po nyid du der thos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshe'i 'du byed dang po nyid du der thos pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because it is heard first.

original: de ni lus kyi dbang po yang der smin par blta'o //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi dbang po yang der smin par blta'o //
translated: The faculty of the body should be seen as ripening there.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams ni /
translated: In the desire realm and the form realm,

original: gzugs med par 'tsho ba'i dbang po mi gnas te /
analyzed: gzugs med par 'tsho ba'i dbang po mi gnas te /
translated: the faculty of life does not exist without the faculty of form.

original: tshor ba'i dbang po ni gzugs la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang po ni gzugs la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the faculty of sensation operates in dependence on form.

original: gang gi mngal du thos pa'i sems can de dang @58b de dag pan chad de dang de rigs gcig par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang gi mngal du thos pa'i sems can de dang @58b de dag pan chad de dang de rigs gcig par gyur pa na /
translated: When the sentient beings who hear it in the womb are born,

original: rigs su skal ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs su skal ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they are said to be endowed with the fortune of the same type.

original: rga ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rga ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu las rga ba 'byung ngo //

translated: The loss of vitality and strength is the condition of the primary elements that is characterized by the loss of vitality and strength.

original: pags pa rnams rnyis shing zhum par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: pags pa rnams rnyis shing zhum par gyur pa'o //
translated: The loss of vitality and strength is the condition of the primary elements that is characterized by the loss of vitality and strength.

original: 'khogs pa ni gang 'dod pa la kun longs spyod pa la kun longs spyod nus pa med pa'am /
analyzed: 'khogs pa ni gang 'dod pa la kun longs spyod pa la kun longs spyod nus pa med pa'am /
translated: The loss of vitality and strength is the condition of the primary elements that is characterized by the loss of vitality and strength.

original: mdangs dang gzi nyams pa'o //🔽zhom pa ni gang las sus byas pa'i rnams la mthu chung zhing rang bzhin gyis nad dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mdangs dang gzi nyams pa'o //🔽zhom pa ni gang las sus byas pa'i rnams la mthu chung zhing rang bzhin gyis nad dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The loss of vitality and strength is the condition of the primary

original: shing sgu bo ltar 'khyor ba ni gang 'gro ba'i spyod lam gyi dus na /
analyzed: shing sgu bo ltar 'khyor ba ni gang 'gro ba'i spyod lam gyi dus na /
translated: You totter like an old man, staggering like a tree in a gale.🔽

original: lus kyi dbyibs g-yas g-yon du 'gyur zhing 'khyor pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dbyibs g-yas g-yon du 'gyur zhing 'khyor pa'o //
translated: The body is bent like a bow, because when one is walking, the body is bent to the right and left.

original: lud pa ngar ngar ba'i lus ni gang smras pa'i dus na bad kan la sogs pas 'gags pas dbugs phyi nang du 'byung ba rnams dka' bzhin du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lud pa ngar ngar ba'i lus ni gang smras pa'i dus na bad kan la sogs pas 'gags pas dbugs phyi nang du 'byung ba rnams dka' bzhin du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The body is covered with mucus, because when one is speaking, the breath is obstructed by phlegm, etc., and the in-and-out breathing is difficult.

original: sgur ba ni gang tshigs pa la gnas pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams nyams pas lus drang por bsrang mi nus shing mdun du sgu ba'o //
analyzed: sgur ba ni gang tshigs pa la gnas pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams nyams pas lus drang por bsrang mi nus shing mdun du sgu ba'o //
translated: The body is bent forward, because the great elements that are the basis of the joints are impaired, and one is unable to straighten the body and it bends forward.

original: khabs nag pos khebs pa'i lus ni gdong dang yan lag tu kha dog nag po phal cher byung ba'o //🔽mdun du sgu ba'i lus ni gang 'dug pa'i spyod lam gyi dus na yang lus mdun du dud cing drang por gnas par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: khabs nag pos khebs pa'i lus ni gdong dang yan lag tu kha dog nag po phal cher byung ba'o // mdun du sgu ba'i lus ni gang 'dug pa'i spyod lam gyi dus na yang lus mdun du dud cing drang por gnas par mi nus pa'o //
translated: The body is covered with black moles, because the complexion becomes mostly black on the face and limbs.🔽The body is bent forward, because even when one is sitting, the body is bent forward and cannot stand straight.

original: khar ba la 'ju ba ni gnas pa'i spyod lam las ldang ba'i dus na //
analyzed: khar ba la 'ju ba ni gnas pa'i spyod lam las ldang ba'i dus na //
translated: The body is bent forward, because even when one is sitting, the body is bent forward and cannot stand straight.🔽The body is bent forward, because even when one is sitting, the body is bent forward and cannot stand straight.

original: bar ba lam brten par ldang mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: bar ba lam brten par ldang mi nus pa'o //
translated: The second is the inability to rise from a sitting position without support.

original: dbang po kun smin pa ni rang bzhin gyis nyam chung bas gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa mi gsal bar mthong zhing thos pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po kun smin pa ni rang bzhin gyis nyam chung bas gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa mi gsal bar mthong zhing thos pa'o //
translated: The third is the inability to see and hear clearly due to the natural weakness of the faculties.

original: nyams pa ni gang las su bya ba rnams la brtson 'grus med de /
analyzed: nyams pa ni gang las su bya ba rnams la brtson 'grus med de /
translated: The fourth is the inability to work, due to the loss of energy.

original: yan lag zhig pas rtag tu le lo dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag zhig pas rtag tu le lo dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the loss of limbs, due to constant laziness.

original: 'du byed rnams rnyings par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rnyings par gyur pa ni /
translated: The sixth is the aging of the formative forces.

original: phung po lnga'i tha mar gyur te /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i tha mar gyur te /
translated: This is the last stage of the aggregates.

original: phung po nyid kyang 'chi ba'i tshe'i dus dang nye bar gyur pa'o //🔽zhig par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: phung po nyid kyang 'chi ba'i tshe'i dus dang nye bar gyur pa'o // zhig par gyur pa ni /
translated: The seventh is the aging of the aggregates themselves, when death is near.🔽The eighth is the loss of the objects of the senses.

original: gang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams la sngon bzhin du blta ba dang mnyan par 'dod pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams la sngon bzhin du blta ba dang mnyan par 'dod pa mi skye'o //
translated: This is the inability to see and hear as before, and the desire to do so no longer arises.

original: rmongs pa ni dran pa'i blo @59a * //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni dran pa'i blo @59a * //
translated: The ninth is the loss of memory, due to the loss of mental power.

original: nyams pas sngon byas pa dang smras pa rnams brjed cing mi dran pa'o //
analyzed: nyams pas sngon byas pa dang smras pa rnams brjed cing mi dran pa'o //
translated: One forgets and cannot recall what was done or said in the past.

original: zhan pa ni yid kyi log pa las /
analyzed: zhan pa ni yid kyi log pa las /
translated: The tenth is the loss of understanding, due to the loss of mental power.

original: gnyis stug cing rgyun ring du gnyid la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis stug cing rgyun ring du gnyid la gnas pa'o //
translated: The second is when one is in deep sleep for a long time.

original: 'bri ba ni de ltar gnyid kyis log pa las gang myur du ldang mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'bri ba ni de ltar gnyid kyis log pa las gang myur du ldang mi nus pa'o //
translated: Diminution is when one is unable to rise quickly from sleep.

original: kun bri ba ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe'i 'du byed kyang mjug bsdus pas 'chi ba'i dus la mngon du bltas pa'o //
analyzed: kun bri ba ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe'i 'du byed kyang mjug bsdus pas 'chi ba'i dus la mngon du bltas pa'o //
translated: Complete diminution is when the life-force impelled by previous karma is exhausted and one is facing death.

original: gong du bshad pa de dag bsdus nas /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa de dag bsdus nas /
translated: These are summarized in the above explanation.

original: don rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: don rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: There are eleven topics:

original: bcu gcig ni rten rnam par gyur pa dang / sgra rnam par gyur pa dang / ltas rnam par gyur pa dang / gzi dang stobs rnam par gyur pa dang / nad med pa rnam par gyur pa dang / kha dog rnam par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: bcu gcig ni rten rnam par gyur pa dang / sgra rnam par gyur pa dang / ltas rnam par gyur pa dang / gzi dang stobs rnam par gyur pa dang / nad med pa rnam par gyur pa dang / kha dog rnam par gyur pa dang /
translated: the transformation of the basis, the transformation of sound, the transformation of signs, the transformation of luster and strength, the transformation of health, the transformation of complexion,

original: spyod lam rnam par gyur pa dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'i dbang po rnam par gyur pa dang / gzugs can gyi dbang po rnam par gyur pa dang / mthar thug pa dang / tshe'i 'du byed zad pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam rnam par gyur pa dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'i dbang po rnam par gyur pa dang / gzugs can gyi dbang po rnam par gyur pa dang / mthar thug pa dang / tshe'i 'du byed zad pa'o //
translated: the transformation of behavior, the transformation of non-physical faculties, the transformation of physical faculties, the ultimate, and the exhaustion of the life force.

original: de la spyi cer bya bas rten rnam par gyur pa bstan to //🔽skra dkar zhes bya bas skra rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la spyi cer bya bas rten rnam par gyur pa bstan to // skra dkar zhes bya bas skra rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “his body is changed” shows the change in the support.🔽The phrase “his hair has turned gray” shows the change in the hair.

original: gnyer ma mang zhes btags pas rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: gnyer ma mang zhes btags pas rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “his body is covered with wrinkles” shows the change in the skin.

original: 'khogs pa zhes bya bas gzi dang / stobs rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'khogs pa zhes bya bas gzi dang / stobs rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “his body is bent over” shows the change in his strength and vigor.

original: zhom pa zhes bya bas nad med pa rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhom pa zhes bya bas nad med pa rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “his body is wasted” shows the change in his health.

original: khabs nag pos lus khebs zhes bya bas kha dog rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: khabs nag pos lus khebs zhes bya bas kha dog rnam par gyur pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “his body is covered with dark moles” shows the change in his complexion.

original: sgu ba dang shing sgu bo ltar 'khyor ba dang lud pa ngar ngar ba'i lus dang / mdun du sgu ba'i lus dang khar ba la 'ju ba rnams kyis spyod lam gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: sgu ba dang shing sgu bo ltar 'khyor ba dang lud pa ngar ngar ba'i lus dang / mdun du sgu ba'i lus dang khar ba la 'ju ba rnams kyis spyod lam gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “he moves along leaning on a stick” shows the change in his deportment.

original: rmongs pa zhes bya bas gzugs can ma yin pa'i dbang po gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes bya bas gzugs can ma yin pa'i dbang po gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “he has lost his memory” shows the change in his non-material faculties.

original: dbang po kun smin pa dang / nyams pa dang zhig par gyur pa dang / zhan pa dang bri ba rnams kyis gzugs can gyi dbang po gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //
analyzed: dbang po kun smin pa dang / nyams pa dang zhig par gyur pa dang / zhan pa dang bri ba rnams kyis gzugs can gyi dbang po gzhan du gyur pa bstan to //
translated: The transformation of the material faculties is taught for those whose faculties have matured, have deteriorated, have been destroyed, have become weak, or have diminished.

original: 'du byed rnams rnyings par mthar thug par bstan to //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rnyings par mthar thug par bstan to //
translated: The finality of the aging of formations is taught.

original: kun bri bas tshe zad pa bstan to //
analyzed: kun bri bas tshe zad pa bstan to //
translated: The exhaustion of life is taught by the complete diminution of the faculties.

original: 'chi ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'chi ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach death, he said:

original: 'chi ba bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the teaching on death?”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: gang sems can de dang de rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang sems can de dang de rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Those sentient beings” refers to

original: lha dang mi dang byol song dang sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sems can de dang de dag go //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang byol song dang sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sems can de dang de dag go //
translated: those sentient beings, gods, humans, animals, hell beings, and so on.

original: sems can gyi @59b ris de dang de las zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i ris mthun pa'i gnas de dang de dag las so //
analyzed: sems can gyi @59b ris de dang de las zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i ris mthun pa'i gnas de dang de dag las so //
translated: “From those realms of sentient beings” refers to those realms of gods, humans, and so on.

original: de la 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid ni nam drod dang tshe dang rnam par shes pas bor ba de ni shi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid ni nam drod dang tshe dang rnam par shes pas bor ba de ni shi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of death is when heat, life, and consciousness are abandoned, then that is called death.

original: de bas na mdo gzhan dag las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na mdo gzhan dag las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in other sūtras it is said:

original: tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis //
analyzed: tshe dang drod dang rnam shes kyis //
translated: By life, heat, and consciousness,

original: gang tshe lus 'di bor ba na /
analyzed: gang tshe lus 'di bor ba na /
translated: when this body is abandoned,

original: dper na sems med shing bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na sems med shing bzhin du //
translated: like a senseless log,

original: sa la 'gyel nas nyal bar gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽de la sems can gang dag nang du sdug bsngal myong ba med par dus byas pa ni shi 'phos pa'o //
analyzed: sa la 'gyel nas nyal bar gyur // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // de la sems can gang dag nang du sdug bsngal myong ba med par dus byas pa ni shi 'phos pa'o //
translated: it falls to the ground and lies there.🔽Among sentient beings, those who die without experiencing inner suffering are those who die without inner suffering.

original: gang sems can nang du sdug bsngal myong ba dang bcas pas dus byas pa ni shi 'phos par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems can nang du sdug bsngal myong ba dang bcas pas dus byas pa ni shi 'phos par gyur pa'o //
translated: Those who die with inner suffering are those who die with inner suffering.

original: rnam par shes pas lus btang ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas lus btang ste /
translated: When consciousness abandons the body,

original: lus dang rnam par shes pa bye bar gyur pa ni bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang rnam par shes pa bye bar gyur pa ni bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: the separation of body and consciousness is called disjunction.

original: mig la sogs pa gzugs can gyi dbang po 'gags pa ni mi snang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gzugs can gyi dbang po 'gags pa ni mi snang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The cessation of the physical sense faculties such as the eyes is called invisibility.

original: gang dus ma yin par shi ba rnams ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: gang dus ma yin par shi ba rnams ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: Those who die at the wrong time are those who die.

original: bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams gnod pa'am sdug bsngal dang ring du mi 'grogs par myur du 'chi ba'i dus byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams gnod pa'am sdug bsngal dang ring du mi 'grogs par myur du 'chi ba'i dus byed pa'o //
translated: Those who possess merit do not remain long in a state of harm or suffering, but quickly die.

original: gang 'chi ba'i tshe dbugs rgyu zhing skyigs bu 'byin pa'i dus la ni tshe zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'chi ba'i tshe dbugs rgyu zhing skyigs bu 'byin pa'i dus la ni tshe zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is dying, breathing and making gurgling sounds, that is called the exhaustion of life.

original: gang dus su shi ba rnams ni /
analyzed: gang dus su shi ba rnams ni /
translated: Those who die at the right time

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po 'gags pa dang phung po rnams 'dor ba dang / skye mched kun 'jig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po 'gags pa dang phung po rnams 'dor ba dang / skye mched kun 'jig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to have the cessation of the life faculty, the abandonment of the aggregates, and the destruction of all the sense bases.

original: yang na tshe'i 'du byed zad pa ni tshe'i dbang po 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshe'i 'du byed zad pa ni tshe'i dbang po 'gog pa'o //
translated: Or, the exhaustion of the life-forming forces is the cessation of the life faculty.

original: sngon gyi phung po dang bral ba ni phung po rnams 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi phung po dang bral ba ni phung po rnams 'dor ba'o //
translated: Being separated from the previous aggregates is the abandonment of the aggregates.

original: phung po snga ma'i mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyis lta ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mi byed pa ni skye mched kun 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: phung po snga ma'i mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyis lta ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mi byed pa ni skye mched kun 'jig pa'o //
translated: The previous aggregates, such as the eye sense base, not performing the functions of seeing and so on is the destruction of all the sense bases.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis rgyas par bshad pa'i rnams mjug bsdu bar bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis rgyas par bshad pa'i rnams mjug bsdu bar bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the conclusion of the extensive explanation of the twelve factors of dependent origination, it is said:

original: dge slong dag 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'o na ci'i phyir /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'o na ci'i phyir /
translated: “Monks, this is the origin of the world,” etc.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis rnams rim pa 'di ltar bkod /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis rnams rim pa 'di ltar bkod /
translated: Why are the twelve members of the chain of dependent origination arranged in this order?

original: smras pa dang po nyid du zhes bya ba la rmongs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: smras pa dang po nyid du zhes bya ba la rmongs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Because delusion arises first,

original: de bas na ma rig pa sngar bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa sngar bshad do //
translated: so ignorance is explained first.

original: rmongs par gyur na de nyid la phyin ci log gi las mngon par 'du byed pas de'i 'og tu 'du byed do //
analyzed: rmongs par gyur na de nyid la phyin ci log gi las mngon par 'du byed pas de'i 'og tu 'du byed do //
translated: When one is deluded, one accumulates actions that are the sources of suffering, so after delusion comes the member of volition.

original: phyin ci log gi las mngon par 'dus byas na de'i rgyus sems kyang kyang phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi las mngon par 'dus byas na de'i rgyus sems kyang kyang phyin ci log tu 'gyur te /
translated: When one has accumulated actions that are the sources of suffering, then the mind becomes perverted.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, after the member of volition comes the member of consciousness.

original: @60a * // sems phyin ci log tu gyur na de las mtshams sbyor bar byed de /🔽de'i 'og tu ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: @60a * // sems phyin ci log tu gyur na de las mtshams sbyor bar byed de / de'i 'og tu ming dang gzugs so //
translated: When the mind is perverted, then one becomes attached to the self and what belongs to the self.🔽Therefore, after consciousness comes the member of name and form.

original: ming dang gzugs las dbang po yongs su rdzogs par 'byung ste de bas na de'i 'og tu skye mched drug go //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs las dbang po yongs su rdzogs par 'byung ste de bas na de'i 'og tu skye mched drug go //
translated: From name and form, the faculties are perfected, so after name and form comes the member of the six sense bases.

original: dbang po yongs su rdzogs nas yul la dbang po kun longs spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su rdzogs nas yul la dbang po kun longs spyod par byed cing /
translated: When the faculties are fully developed, one experiences objects with the faculties.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu reg pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu reg pa'o //
translated: Therefore, contact comes next.

original: yul la longs spyod pas bde ba'i tshor ba la chags pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'dor bar 'dod pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: yul la longs spyod pas bde ba'i tshor ba la chags pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'dor bar 'dod pa 'byung ste /
translated: Since one experiences objects, one becomes attached to pleasant feelings and wishes to avoid painful feelings.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu tshor ba'o //
translated: Therefore, feeling comes next.

original: chags pa las tshor ba bde ba dang / rgyun tu 'grogs par smon pa skye ste /
analyzed: chags pa las tshor ba bde ba dang / rgyun tu 'grogs par smon pa skye ste /
translated: From attachment, one wishes for the continuity of pleasant feelings.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu srid pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu srid pa'o //
translated: Therefore, craving comes next.

original: smon pa las de tshol ba la brtson pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: smon pa las de tshol ba la brtson pa 'byung ste /
translated: From wishing, one strives to obtain the object.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu len pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu len pa'o //
translated: Therefore, grasping comes next.

original: len pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa 'phel la /
analyzed: len pa'i dus na nyon mongs pa 'phel la /
translated: At the time of grasping, the afflictions increase.

original: nyon mongs pa 'phel ba la yang srid pa'i las byed de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'phel ba la yang srid pa'i las byed de /
translated: When the afflictions increase, one performs the karma of existence.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu srid pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu srid pa'o //
translated: Therefore, existence comes next.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa 'du byas na lam rgyud lngar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa 'du byas na lam rgyud lngar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When karma and afflictions are formed, one will be born in the five realms.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu skye ba'o //
translated: Therefore, birth comes next.

original: skye nas sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bas na de'i 'og tu rga shi'o //
analyzed: skye nas sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bas na de'i 'og tu rga shi'o //
translated: Since various kinds of suffering arise after birth, aging and death follow.

original: de'i phyir na rim pa de ltar bkod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rim pa de ltar bkod do //
translated: Therefore, they are arranged in this order.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After teaching dependent origination,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi smos pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi smos pas /
translated: the four noble truths are mentioned.

original: ji ltar smos pa bzhin bshad par 'dod nas dris pa //
analyzed: ji ltar smos pa bzhin bshad par 'dod nas dris pa //
translated: Desiring to explain them as they are mentioned, he asks,

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: What are the four noble truths? and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dgar ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dgar ba'i tshig ste /
translated: There is a particle of separation.

original: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa las kyang /
analyzed: dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa las kyang /
translated: Even from the twenty-two faculties and so on,

original: bden pa bzhis je bkar te bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden pa bzhis je bkar te bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is explained that the four truths are taught in order.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gsungs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gsungs she na /
translated: Why did the Blessed One teach the four noble truths?

original: 'di ltar ston par khas 'ches pas kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu ba dang / mi'i thod pa can dang / gzhung med pa la sogs pa rang rang gi chos kyi khyad par sgrogs shing ston pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar ston par khas 'ches pas kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu ba dang / mi'i thod pa can dang / gzhung med pa la sogs pa rang rang gi chos kyi khyad par sgrogs shing ston pa na /
translated: Thus, when the tirthikas, the naked ones, the skull-bearers, the ones without scripture, and so on, proclaim and teach their own special Dharmas,

original: bdag gi chos ni yang dag pa'i bden pa phyin ci ma log pa yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin zhes phyin ci log la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par gzigs nas /
analyzed: bdag gi chos ni yang dag pa'i bden pa phyin ci ma log pa yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin zhes phyin ci log la mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par gzigs nas /
translated: they see that they have the wrong pride that thinks, “My Dharma is the unmistaken, true reality, but the others are not.”

original: bde ba la rmongs pa de dag la don dam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba la rmongs pa de dag la don dam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach them the ultimate, he said, “What are the four noble truths?”

original: yang na gsung rab 'dir zhugs nas khyim na gnas pa'i mtshan @60b ma ni yongs su btang /
analyzed: yang na gsung rab 'dir zhugs nas khyim na gnas pa'i mtshan @60b ma ni yongs su btang /
translated: Or, having entered this teaching, they give up the signs of householders

original: dge sbyong gi mtshan ma ni bzung /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi mtshan ma ni bzung /
translated: and take up the signs of ascetics.

original: dgon par gnas pas ni dge sbyor ngo zhes /
analyzed: dgon par gnas pas ni dge sbyor ngo zhes /
translated: They think, “By staying in isolated places, I will practice virtue.”

original: tshul khrims kyi yon tan ni yang dag par 'dzin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi yon tan ni yang dag par 'dzin /
translated: They perfectly uphold the qualities of ethical discipline.

original: yo byad rnying pa la ni gnas /
analyzed: yo byad rnying pa la ni gnas /
translated: He dwells in old possessions.

original: ngo tsha dang khrel yod pas ni bsdams /
analyzed: ngo tsha dang khrel yod pas ni bsdams /
translated: He is restrained by shame and embarrassment.

original: dbang po rnams yul la 'jug pa'i sgo ni bkag kyang thos pa'i shes rab dang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: dbang po rnams yul la 'jug pa'i sgo ni bkag kyang thos pa'i shes rab dang mi ldan pas /
translated: He has blocked the door through which the faculties engage objects, but he is not endowed with the wisdom of learning.

original: bdag ni dge sbyong ngo zhes nges pa skyes pa rnams kyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal spangs shing don dam pa'i dge sbyong bsten par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni dge sbyong ngo zhes nges pa skyes pa rnams kyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal spangs shing don dam pa'i dge sbyong bsten par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who have generated the certainty that he is an ascetic should abandon manifest pride and rely on the ultimate ascetic.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What are the four noble truths?

original: gsung rab 'di las bden pa khong du chud pa nyid don dam pa'i dge sbyong yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gsung rab 'di las bden pa khong du chud pa nyid don dam pa'i dge sbyong yin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is intended that in this scripture, the one who has understood the truths is the ultimate ascetic.

original: yang na mi khom brgyad po yongs su spangs pa dang / sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i me tog gi dris rgyud yongs su bsgos pas /
analyzed: yang na mi khom brgyad po yongs su spangs pa dang / sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i me tog gi dris rgyud yongs su bsgos pas /
translated: Or else, he has completely abandoned the eight inopportune states and has perfumed his continuum with the fragrance of the flower of the roots of virtue of serving the former tathāgatas.

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i tshogs yang dag par bsags shing bsam pa dang sbyor ba rab tu dag pa 'phags pa'i bden pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can rnams kyi don du /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i tshogs yang dag par bsags shing bsam pa dang sbyor ba rab tu dag pa 'phags pa'i bden pa khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can rnams kyi don du /
translated: It is for the sake of those who have gathered the accumulations for attaining the result, who have pure intention and application and who are fortunate enough to comprehend the noble truths.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhig ce na zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhig ce na zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān taught this sūtra, “What are the four noble truths?” for the sake of those who have gathered the accumulations for attaining the result, whose intentions and practices are completely pure, and who are fortunate to comprehend the noble truths.

original: yang na ngan song rnams kyi sdug bsngal mi bzad pa thob pas /
analyzed: yang na ngan song rnams kyi sdug bsngal mi bzad pa thob pas /
translated: Or, those who have attained the unbearable suffering of the lower realms

original: yid kyi skrag par 'gyur ba rnams la /
analyzed: yid kyi skrag par 'gyur ba rnams la /
translated: and are mentally terrified

original: de mi 'gro bar rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi 'gro bar rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: are taught the cause of not going there.

original: bden pa bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi gsungs te /
translated: The four truths are taught.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mnar med pa dang / rab tu 'joms pa dang / 'o dod 'bod pa dang / 'o dod cher 'bod pa dang / tsha ba dang rab tu tsha ba la sogs pa'i sems can dmyal bar skyes pa rnams /
analyzed: 'di ltar mnar med pa dang / rab tu 'joms pa dang / 'o dod 'bod pa dang / 'o dod cher 'bod pa dang / tsha ba dang rab tu tsha ba la sogs pa'i sems can dmyal bar skyes pa rnams /
translated: Thus, those born in the hells such as Avīci, Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghata, Tapana, and Pratāpana

original: dbang med par lcags kyi skam pas kha phye nas /
analyzed: dbang med par lcags kyi skam pas kha phye nas /
translated: are powerless, their mouths are opened with iron hooks,🔽and molten copper is poured in.

original: lcags kyi gong bu dang / lcags kyi khu ba blud pa'i dus na sna dang spyi po la sogs par me lce rab tu 'bar ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba dang / gzhan yang yi dgas su skyes pa rnams skom pa dang / bkres pa'i sdug bsngal gyis non pas rgyun mi chad par zos shing 'thungs kyang /
analyzed: lcags kyi gong bu dang / lcags kyi khu ba blud pa'i dus na sna dang spyi po la sogs par me lce rab tu 'bar ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba dang / gzhan yang yi dgas su skyes pa rnams skom pa dang / bkres pa'i sdug bsngal gyis non pas rgyun mi chad par zos shing 'thungs kyang /
translated: Moreover, hungry ghosts are oppressed by the suffering of hunger and thirst. Even if they eat and drink continuously,

original: chog pa'i dus med na zlog pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: chog pa'i dus med na zlog pa lta ci smos /
translated: they never have enough. What need is there to mention their being cured?

original: de dag sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pas mnar ba'i phyir /🔽chu 'dod pa'i don du song ba las kyang chu rnams bskam par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de dag sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pas mnar ba'i phyir / chu 'dod pa'i don du song ba las kyang chu rnams bskam par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Because they are tormented by the ripening of their past karma,🔽even if they go in search of water, the water dries up.

original: rnag dang chu ser la sogs pa mi gtsang ba rab @61a * //
analyzed: rnag dang chu ser la sogs pa mi gtsang ba rab @61a * //
translated: Or, if they find water, it turns into pus, serum, and so forth, which are impure.

original: tu dri mi zhim pa rnams kyis gang bar 'gyur ba dang / me tog gi shing rnams kyang me tog med par 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu'i shang rnams kyang 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dpag tu med par myong bar 'gyur pa dang /
analyzed: tu dri mi zhim pa rnams kyis gang bar 'gyur ba dang / me tog gi shing rnams kyang me tog med par 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu'i shang rnams kyang 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dpag tu med par myong bar 'gyur pa dang /
translated: They will experience immeasurable suffering, such as the appearance of foul-smelling flowers and fruit trees, the disappearance of fragrant flowers and fruit trees, and the appearance of foul-smelling flowers and fruit trees.

original: gang dag byol song du skye ba rnams bcings pa dang / bsad pa dang gcig la gcig phan tshun za ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar dogs pas rtag tu yid mi bde bar gnas pa rnams la ngan song gsum du mi 'gro ba'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag byol song du skye ba rnams bcings pa dang / bsad pa dang gcig la gcig phan tshun za ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar dogs pas rtag tu yid mi bde bar gnas pa rnams la ngan song gsum du mi 'gro ba'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the cause for not going to the three lower realms to those who are born as animals and who constantly live in a state of mental unease, fearing the suffering of being bound, killed, and mutually devouring each other,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gsungs te /
translated: the four noble truths were taught.

original: bden pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud nas /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud nas /
translated: If one perfectly understands the four noble truths,

original: de dag thams cad ngan song gi sdug bsngal las thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ngan song gi sdug bsngal las thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all of them will be liberated from the suffering of the lower realms.

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the four noble truths?

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term noble refers to

original: gang bdag la dbang du gyur pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gang bdag la dbang du gyur pa la bya ste /
translated: those who have mastery over themselves.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang 'phags pa nyan thos chen po la sogs pa ni sems la dbang thob pas 'phags pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang 'phags pa nyan thos chen po la sogs pa ni sems la dbang thob pas 'phags pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the noble great disciples, and so on are called noble because they have attained mastery over their minds.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pas 'phags pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pas 'phags pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Ordinary beings are called non-noble because they are under the power of afflictions.

original: bden pa ni phyin ci ma log pa 'am /🔽ma nor ba'am /
analyzed: bden pa ni phyin ci ma log pa 'am / ma nor ba'am /
translated: Truth means unmistaken or non-erroneous,

original: yang dag pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don te /
translated: or the meaning of reality.

original: 'phags par 'gyur pa'i bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags par 'gyur pa'i bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the noble ones is the truth of the noble ones.

original: yang na 'phags pa rnams kyis bshad pa'i bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa rnams kyis bshad pa'i bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the truth explained by the noble ones is the truth of the noble ones.

original: 'o na so so'i skye bo rnams kyis bshad pa 'phags pa'i bden par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na so so'i skye bo rnams kyis bshad pa 'phags pa'i bden par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If that is so, would the truth explained by ordinary beings not be the truth of the noble ones?

original: lan du de dag thams cad kyang 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'chad pa dang / 'phags par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ston pas na 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang na 'di dag 'phags pa rnams la bden pas na /
analyzed: lan du de dag thams cad kyang 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'chad pa dang / 'phags par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ston pas na 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o // yang na 'di dag 'phags pa rnams la bden pas na /
translated: Reply: All of these are called “noble truths” because they are taught by the noble ones, such as the Tathāgata, and because they reveal the causes of becoming a noble one.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Again, these are called “noble truths” because they are true for the noble ones.

original: brgal ba / so so'i skye bo rnams la 'di dag brdzun pa yin nam zhes na /🔽smras pa 'di dag 'phags pa yin yang rung /
analyzed: brgal ba / so so'i skye bo rnams la 'di dag brdzun pa yin nam zhes na / smras pa 'di dag 'phags pa yin yang rung /
translated: Objection: Are they false for ordinary beings?

original: byis pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: byis pa yang rung ste /
translated: Reply: Whether they are for the noble ones or for ordinary beings,

original: thams cad la sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du phyin ci ma log pas /
analyzed: thams cad la sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du phyin ci ma log pas /
translated: since they are all unmistakenly characterized as suffering and so on,

original: kun la yang 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun la yang 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they are all called “noble truths.”

original: de ste kun la yang bden na /
analyzed: de ste kun la yang bden na /
translated: If they are true for all,

original: ci'i phyir / 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa zhes brjod ce na /
translated: why are they called “noble truths”?

original: @61b smras pa /
analyzed: @61b smras pa /
translated: Reply:

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa yin par yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du gzigs kyi /🔽so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa yin par yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du gzigs kyi / so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni /
translated: The noble ones see them as they are in reality, as suffering, etc.

original: yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du mi mthong bas /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji ltar ba bzhin du mi mthong bas /
translated: But ordinary beings do not see them as they are in reality.

original: 'phags pa rnams la bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the noble ones are said to have the truth.

original: de bas na mdo dag las bshad pa /
analyzed: de bas na mdo dag las bshad pa /
translated: Thus, it is said in the sutras:

original: 'phags pa bden par gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'phags pa bden par gang gsungs pa //
translated: What the noble ones call truth,🔽others know as suffering and pain.

original: sdug cing bsngal bar gzhan gyis rig / gzhan gyis bden par gang smras pa //
analyzed: sdug cing bsngal bar gzhan gyis rig / gzhan gyis bden par gang smras pa //
translated: What others call truth,🔽the noble ones know as suffering and pain.

original: sdug cing bsngal bar 'phags pas rig / ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sdug cing bsngal bar 'phags pas rig / ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: yang / spu yi nyag ma ji ltar lag pa'i mthil du mi tshor ba //
analyzed: yang / spu yi nyag ma ji ltar lag pa'i mthil du mi tshor ba //
translated: Just as a hair on the palm of the hand is not felt,

original: de nyid mig tu song bar gyur na mi dga' gnod pa skye //
analyzed: de nyid mig tu song bar gyur na mi dga' gnod pa skye //
translated: but when it enters the eye, it causes discomfort and harm.

original: lag pa'i mthil 'dra byis pas 'du byed sdug bsngal nyag mi tshor //
analyzed: lag pa'i mthil 'dra byis pas 'du byed sdug bsngal nyag mi tshor //
translated: In the same way, the hair of the suffering of conditioned states on the palm of the hand of the childish is not felt,

original: mig dang mtshungs pa'i mkhas pa de nyid kyis ni yid 'byung za ba //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: mig dang mtshungs pa'i mkhas pa de nyid kyis ni yid 'byung za ba //🔽ces gsungs te /
translated: but the wise one with eyes like reality is disgusted and rejects it.

original: de ltar na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba yin par 'phags pa rnams kyis gzigs kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa sdug bsngal ba yin par 'phags pa rnams kyis gzigs kyi /
translated: Thus, the noble ones see the five appropriated aggregates and so on as suffering,

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni de ltar mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni de ltar mi mthong ngo //
translated: but ordinary beings do not see them in that way.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi kho nar nges she nas /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi kho nar nges she nas /
translated: Why are there definitely only four noble truths?

original: lta ba phyin ci log rnam par bzhi yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log rnam par bzhi yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there are four kinds of wrong views.

original: de'i gnyen por bden pa yang bzhi kho nar bshad de /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por bden pa yang bzhi kho nar bshad de /
translated: The four truths are explained as their antidotes.

original: lta bu phyin ci log bzhi ni /
analyzed: lta bu phyin ci log bzhi ni /
translated: The four kinds of wrong views are:

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / ther zug tu lta ba dang / bya ba med par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba dang / chad par lta ba dang / ther zug tu lta ba dang / bya ba med par lta ba'o //
translated: the view of the transitory collection, the view of annihilation, the view of permanence, and the view of nonaction.

original: de la phung po lnga rnams la bdag tu lta ste /
analyzed: de la phung po lnga rnams la bdag tu lta ste /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the view that the five aggregates are a self.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i gnyen por sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i gnyen por sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bshad do //
translated: The truth of suffering is explained as the antidote to that view.

original: 'dir phung po zhig nas tshe rabs gzhan du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes chad par lta ba'i gnyen por /
analyzed: 'dir phung po zhig nas tshe rabs gzhan du skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes chad par lta ba'i gnyen por /
translated: The view of annihilation is the view that after the aggregates are destroyed, one will not be reborn in another life.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa bshad de /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa bshad de /
translated: The truth of the origin of suffering🔽

original: ji srid du las dang nyon mongs pa yod kyi bar du phung po rgyun mi chad par ston pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du las dang nyon mongs pa yod kyi bar du phung po rgyun mi chad par ston pa'o //
translated: The truth of origination is explained in order to show that as long as karma and the afflictions exist, the aggregates will not be interrupted.

original: phung po lnga rtag par ther zug tu gnas so zhes lta ba'i gnyen por 'gog pa'i bden pa bshad de /
analyzed: phung po lnga rtag par ther zug tu gnas so zhes lta ba'i gnyen por 'gog pa'i bden pa bshad de /
