translated: The truth of cessation is explained as the antidote to the view that the five aggregates are permanent and stable.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa spangs na phung po skye ba rgyun chad pas ther zug ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa spangs na phung po skye ba rgyun chad pas ther zug ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: It is taught that if karma and the afflictions are abandoned, the arising of the aggregates will be interrupted and therefore they are not stable.

original: dge ba gzhan gyis byas kyang 'bras bu gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur ro zhes ma byas par /
analyzed: dge ba gzhan gyis byas kyang 'bras bu gzhan gyis myong bar 'gyur ro zhes ma byas par /
translated: Even though one person performs virtuous actions, another person experiences the result.

original: lta ba'i gnyen por lam gyi bden pa bshad do /🔽gang gis lam bsgoms pa de nyid rnam par thar par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis lam bsgoms pas @62a * //
analyzed: lta ba'i gnyen por lam gyi bden pa bshad do / gang gis lam bsgoms pa de nyid rnam par thar par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyis lam bsgoms pas @62a * //
translated: The truth of the path is explained as the antidote to that view.

original: gzhan thar par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan thar par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: The one who cultivates the path will be liberated, but another person will not be liberated by cultivating the path of someone else.

original: gal te de ltar gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur na ni /
translated: If that were the case,

original: lhas byin gyis las byas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu mchod sbyin gyis myong ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas byin gyis las byas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu mchod sbyin gyis myong ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: the error would ensue that Devadatta would experience the results of actions performed by Yajñadatta.

original: yang na phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por /
analyzed: yang na phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por /
translated: Alternatively, they are antidotes to the four kinds of misunderstanding.

original: bden pa bzhi kho nar bshad de /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi kho nar bshad de /
translated: Or else, the four noble truths are explained as antidotes to the four kinds of misunderstanding.

original: phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi ni 'bras bu phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa dang / rgyu phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa dang / thar pa phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa dang / de'i thabs phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi ni 'bras bu phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa dang / rgyu phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa dang / thar pa phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa dang / de'i thabs phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The four kinds of misunderstanding are misunderstanding the result, misunderstanding the cause, misunderstanding liberation, and misunderstanding the means to attain liberation.

original: de la 'bras bu phyin ci log tu khong tu chud pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu phyin ci log tu khong tu chud pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Misunderstanding the result is as follows.

original: sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / las kyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams mi gtsang ba'i snod ltar mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin can /
analyzed: sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / las kyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams mi gtsang ba'i snod ltar mi gtsang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin can /
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases, which are the results of craving, pride, and karma, are by nature various kinds of impurities, like a filthy vessel.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi mes rtag tu bsreg pa mi rtag pa'i rdo rjes rgyun du bcom pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi mes rtag tu bsreg pa mi rtag pa'i rdo rjes rgyun du bcom pa /
translated: It is constantly burned by the fires of the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of pervasive conditioning, and is constantly destroyed by the vajra of impermanence.

original: bdag dang bdag gir byed pa po dang / tshor ba po la sogs pa dang bral ba la /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir byed pa po dang / tshor ba po la sogs pa dang bral ba la /
translated: It is devoid of a self, a being, a life force, an individual soul, a human, a human being, a human person, an agent, and a knower.

original: gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / de bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / de bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the grasping at purity, happiness, permanence, and a self, and to reverse that,

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa gsungs so //
translated: the noble ones taught the truth of suffering.

original: rgyu phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The understanding of causes as mistaken is as follows.

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po 'di dag thams cad tshangs pa dang / dbang phyug dang / skyes bu dang / rang bzhin dang / dus dang rgyu med pa la sogs pa las skye bo zhes mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rgyu med par smra ba bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po 'di dag thams cad tshangs pa dang / dbang phyug dang / skyes bu dang / rang bzhin dang / dus dang rgyu med pa la sogs pa las skye bo zhes mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rgyu med par smra ba bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to reverse the claims of non-Buddhists that all outer and inner things are produced by Īśvara, Brahmā, Puruṣa, Prakriti, time, or no cause,

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa gsungs so //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa gsungs so //
translated: the noble ones taught the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: thar pa phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽gtogs 'dod kyi lugs dang bdag dang / rdul dang mun pa dang / sems can gsum cha mnyam na gtso bo zhes bya ba mthong bar gyur pa'am /🔽dbang phyug chen po mnyes par byas nas /
analyzed: thar pa phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni / gtogs 'dod kyi lugs dang bdag dang / rdul dang mun pa dang / sems can gsum cha mnyam na gtso bo zhes bya ba mthong bar gyur pa'am / dbang phyug chen po mnyes par byas nas /
translated: The phrase they have a distorted understanding of liberation means

original: thar pa dang mtho ris 'thob po zhes smra ba ste /
analyzed: thar pa dang mtho ris 'thob po zhes smra ba ste /
translated: that they are followers of the Lokāyata school, who believe that liberation and rebirth in heaven are attained by seeing the so-called primal substance, which is a balance of the three constituents of sattva, rajas, and tamas, or by pleasing the great lord.

original: de bzlog par bya ba'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzlog par bya ba'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa gsungs so //
translated: To refute that, the noble ones taught the truth of cessation.

original: de'i thabs phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dang / sdong po la sogs pa kha zas rtsub po za zhing /
analyzed: de'i thabs phyin ci log tu khong du chud pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dang / sdong po la sogs pa kha zas rtsub po za zhing /
translated: The phrase they have a distorted understanding of the means to achieve that refers to those who eat coarse food such as flowers, fruits, roots, and tree bark.

original: rtsva dang 'dab ma dang / shing leb dang tsher ma dang / thal ba la sogs pa nyal bar @62b gnas bcas pas thar bar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba dang / me lnga'i dka' thub dang / zas bcad pa dang / brag kha nas mchongs pa la sogs pas thar par 'gyur ro zhes smra ba ste /
analyzed: rtsva dang 'dab ma dang / shing leb dang tsher ma dang / thal ba la sogs pa nyal bar @62b gnas bcas pas thar bar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba dang / me lnga'i dka' thub dang / zas bcad pa dang / brag kha nas mchongs pa la sogs pas thar par 'gyur ro zhes smra ba ste /
translated: They are the ones who say that one is liberated by the asceticism of the five fires, by fasting, by jumping from a cliff, etc.

original: de bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute them,

original: lam gyi bden pa bshad do //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa bshad do //
translated: the truth of the path is taught.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, in order to teach the effect and the cause of defilement and of purification without error.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi kho nar bshad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi kho nar bshad de /
translated: Only the four noble truths are taught.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu phyin ci ma log par bstan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu phyin ci ma log par bstan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of suffering is taught as the effect of defilement without error.

original: de ni ji snyed du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'bras bu ni sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ji snyed du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'bras bu ni sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because suffering is the effect of all the dharmas of defilement, to whatever extent there are.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the causes of the phenomena of complete affliction without error,🔽

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa bshad de /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa bshad de /
translated: The truth of origination is taught in order to correctly teach the cause of all defiled things.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu phyin ci ma log par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu phyin ci ma log par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Karma and the afflictions are the cause of all defiled things.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa bshad de /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa bshad de /
translated: The truth of cessation is taught in order to correctly teach the result of purified things.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro // rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Nirvana is the result of the factors of enlightenment.

original: lam gyi bden pa bshad de /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa bshad de /
translated: The truth of the path is taught in order to correctly teach the cause of purified things.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eightfold noble path is the cause of nirvana.

original: yang na mngon pa'i chos las 'khor ba la nyes pa dang bcas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su bsngags pa dang bcas par mthong ba rnams /
analyzed: yang na mngon pa'i chos las 'khor ba la nyes pa dang bcas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su bsngags pa dang bcas par mthong ba rnams /
translated: One who sees samsara as having faults and nirvana as having praise

original: 'khor ba las yang dag par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom mo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'khor ba las yang dag par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom mo zhes bshad de /
translated: strives with perseverance in order to transcend samsara.

original: de la 'khor ba la nyes pa dang bcas pa mthong ba 'grub par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'khor ba la nyes pa dang bcas pa mthong ba 'grub par byed pa ni /
translated: Here, the establishment of the seeing of samsara as having faults is

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong ba ste /
translated: the seeing of the truth of suffering.

original: khams gsum pa rnams sdug bsngal rnam par brgyad dang ldan par mthong na 'khor ba'i chos rnams la nyes pa dang bcas par lta'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa rnams sdug bsngal rnam par brgyad dang ldan par mthong na 'khor ba'i chos rnams la nyes pa dang bcas par lta'o //
translated: When one sees the three realms as having eight types of suffering, one sees the phenomena of samsara as having faults.

original: 'khor ba'i nyes pa rnams skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyes pa rnams skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: The cause that generates the faults of samsara is

original: srid pa'i mtshan nyid kun 'byung ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i mtshan nyid kun 'byung ste /
translated: the origin that is characterized by existence.

original: sred pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sufferings of samsara arise through the power of craving.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su bsngags pa dang bcas par mthong ba 'grub par byed pa ni /🔽'gog pa'i bden @63a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su bsngags pa dang bcas par mthong ba 'grub par byed pa ni / 'gog pa'i bden @63a * //
translated: The establishment of the seeing of nirvana together with its praise is🔽the truth of cessation.🔽

original: pa mthong ba ste /🔽'gog pa la zhi ba dang / gya nom pa la sogs par mthong nas mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du blta'o //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa de thob par byed pa'i rgyu ni lam gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: pa mthong ba ste / 'gog pa la zhi ba dang / gya nom pa la sogs par mthong nas mya ngan las 'das pa la yon tan du blta'o // mya ngan las 'das pa de thob par byed pa'i rgyu ni lam gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of the path is the cause for attaining nirvana.

original: lam bsgoms pa'i mthus mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: lam bsgoms pa'i mthus mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du 'gyur bas so //
translated: The truth of the path is the cause for attaining nirvana, because nirvana is realized through the power of cultivating the path.

original: yang na 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bden pa bzhi nyid du bshad do //🔽de la 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bden pa bzhi nyid du bshad do // de la 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu ni /
translated: Or else, the four truths are explained in order to present the results and causes that are mundane and supramundane.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The result of mundane dharmas is the truth of suffering.

original: de'i rgyu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o // 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi 'bras bu ni /
translated: Its cause is the truth of origination.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The result of supramundane dharmas is the truth of cessation.

original: de'i rgyu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Its cause is the truth of the path.

original: yang na mngon par chud pa'i dbang du byas na yang /
analyzed: yang na mngon par chud pa'i dbang du byas na yang /
translated: Or else, from the point of view of direct realization,

original: mdo las bden bzhi kho nar bshad de /
analyzed: mdo las bden bzhi kho nar bshad de /
translated: the Sūtra explains only four truths.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: phung po rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs par yang dag par reg pas reg par byed pa ni /
analyzed: phung po rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs par yang dag par reg pas reg par byed pa ni /
translated: “One who touches the aggregates as impermanent, etc.🔽does not produce craving that has not yet arisen and abandons that which has arisen.”

original: sred pa ma bskyed pa rnams ni mi bskyed la mi bskyed pa rnams ni spang ngo zhes gsungs pa la phung po ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa ma bskyed pa rnams ni mi bskyed la mi bskyed pa rnams ni spang ngo zhes gsungs pa la phung po ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The aggregates are the truth of suffering.

original: sred pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Craving is the truth of origin.

original: ma bskyed pa ni mi bskyed pa dang bskyed pa spong ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: ma bskyed pa ni mi bskyed pa dang bskyed pa spong ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The non-production of what has not yet arisen and the abandonment of what has arisen is the truth of cessation.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs par yang dag par reg par byed pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs par yang dag par reg par byed pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Touching the aggregates as impermanent, etc. is the truth of the path.

original: yang na kun nas sbyor bar byed pa'i chos rnams la nyes pa dang bcas par rjes su lta ba rnams sred pa ma lus par 'gog go zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yang na kun nas sbyor bar byed pa'i chos rnams la nyes pa dang bcas par rjes su lta ba rnams sred pa ma lus par 'gog go zhes gsungs te /
translated: Or else, “one who sees the dharmas that bind as faulty abandons all craving.”

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kun la sbyor ba'i chos rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kun la sbyor ba'i chos rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The factors that are associated with the entire mass of afflictions are the truth of suffering.

original: sred pa kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Craving is the truth of origination.

original: sred pa ma lus par 'gags pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa ma lus par 'gags pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The complete cessation of craving is the truth of cessation.

original: nyes pa dang bcas pas rjes su lta ba ni lam gyi bden pa'o //🔽yang na shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon par bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i chos rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa dang bcas pas rjes su lta ba ni lam gyi bden pa'o // yang na shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon par bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i chos rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The view that is associated with faults is the truth of the path.

original: bden pa bzhi nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi nyid du bshad do //
translated: Alternatively, the four truths are explained in order to teach the phenomena that are to be known, abandoned, manifested, and cultivated.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni shes par bya ba'o //🔽kun 'byung gi bden pa ni spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni shes par bya ba'o // kun 'byung gi bden pa ni spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Among them, the truth of suffering is to be known.🔽The truth of origination is to be abandoned.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is to be manifested.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: The truth of the path is to be cultivated.

original: yang na nye bar len pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin mngon par shes pa dang / kun shes pa na chags pa gtong bar byed de zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yang na nye bar len pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin mngon par shes pa dang / kun shes pa na chags pa gtong bar byed de zhes gsungs te /
translated: Or else, when one fully knows the nature of the appropriated aggregates and is free of attachment, one abandons attachment.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Here, the appropriated aggregates are the truth of suffering.

original: chags pa ni kun 'byung gi bden @63b pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni kun 'byung gi bden @63b pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the truth of origin.

original: chags pa gtong ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa gtong ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Abandoning attachment is the truth of cessation.

original: mngon par shes pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi phung po mi rtag pa la sogs pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi phung po mi rtag pa la sogs pa shes pa'o //
translated: Fully knowing is the aggregate of the path of seeing that knows impermanence and so on.

original: kun tu shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi rtag pa la sogs par shes pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi rtag pa la sogs par shes pa ste /
translated: Fully understanding is the aggregate of the path of meditation that knows impermanence and so on.

original: de ni lam gyi bden pa'o //🔽'o na ci'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni lam gyi bden pa'o // 'o na ci'i phyir /
translated: That is the truth of the path.🔽Why are the truths of the āryas set forth in this order?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa 'di rnams dang por sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa bshad la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa 'di rnams dang por sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa bshad la /
translated: Why is the truth of suffering of the āryas explained first,

original: de'i 'og tu kun 'byung gi bden pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kun 'byung gi bden pa /
translated: followed by the truth of origin,

original: de nas 'gog pa'i bden pa /
analyzed: de nas 'gog pa'i bden pa /
translated: then the truth of cessation

original: de nas lam ste /
analyzed: de nas lam ste /
translated: and then the truth of the path?

original: rim pa 'di ltar ci'i phyir bkod ce na /
analyzed: rim pa 'di ltar ci'i phyir bkod ce na /
translated: Why are they set forth in this order?

original: lan du bsgom pa dang rags pa'i rim pas rim par bkod de /
analyzed: lan du bsgom pa dang rags pa'i rim pas rim par bkod de /
translated: The order of the truths is established by way of meditation and by way of grossness.

original: phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas su gyur par /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas su gyur par /
translated: The five aggregates are the basis of various kinds of suffering.

original: kun la yang mngon sum ste /
analyzed: kun la yang mngon sum ste /
translated: They are all directly perceived.

original: gsal bas na dang por sdug bsngal gyi bden par bshad do //
analyzed: gsal bas na dang por sdug bsngal gyi bden par bshad do //
translated: Since they are clear, the truth of suffering is explained first.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal bar mthong na /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal bar mthong na /
translated: When one sees that they are suffering,

original: de nas de'i rgyu gang zhes rtogs pas na /
analyzed: de nas de'i rgyu gang zhes rtogs pas na /
translated: one then realizes, “What is the cause of that?”

original: de'i 'og tu kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the truth of origination is explained next.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po de dag gang du 'gag par 'gyur zhes rtog pa la mya ngan las 'das na /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po de dag gang du 'gag par 'gyur zhes rtog pa la mya ngan las 'das na /
translated: When one thinks, “Where will those aggregates of suffering cease?”

original: sdug bsngal 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that suffering ceases in nirvana,

original: de'i 'og tu 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: the truth of cessation is explained next.

original: 'gog pa de ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gog pa de ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the thought, “How will that cessation be attained?”

original: de'i 'og tu lam gyi bden pa bshad do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lam gyi bden pa bshad do //
translated: the truth of the path is explained next.

original: yang na 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas /
analyzed: yang na 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas /
translated: Or, from beginningless samsara,

original: skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa don med pa'i tshogs ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa don med pa'i tshogs ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The collection of useless things such as birth, old age, etc. is the truth of suffering.

original: don med pa'i tshogs kyi rtsa ba ni //
analyzed: don med pa'i tshogs kyi rtsa ba ni //
translated: The root of the collection of useless things is

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: the truth of origination.

original: don med pa'i tshogs bcom pa ni /
analyzed: don med pa'i tshogs bcom pa ni /
translated: The destruction of the collection of useless things is

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: the truth of cessation.

original: don med pa'i tshogs kyi rtsa ba 'joms pa ni /
analyzed: don med pa'i tshogs kyi rtsa ba 'joms pa ni /
translated: The destruction of the root of the collection of useless things is

original: lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: the truth of the path.

original: yang na khur lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //🔽khur len pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na khur lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o // khur len pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Again, the truth of suffering is like a burden.🔽The truth of origination is the taking up of the burden.

original: khur bor ba ni 'og pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: khur bor ba ni 'og pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is the laying down of the burden.

original: khur len pa bor ba ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: khur len pa bor ba ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the path is the means of laying down the burden.

original: yang na kun tu sbyor bar byed pa'i chos kyi phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //🔽'dod chags la sogs pa kun tu sbyor bar byed pa ni ;
analyzed: yang na kun tu sbyor bar byed pa'i chos kyi phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o // 'dod chags la sogs pa kun tu sbyor bar byed pa ni ;
translated: Again, the truth of suffering is the mass of dharmas that bind one completely.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of origination is the binding together of passion, etc.

original: kun tu sbyor bar zad par byed pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor bar zad par byed pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is the exhaustion of the binding together.

original: phung po la nyes dmigs su mthong ba ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la nyes dmigs su mthong ba ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The seeing of the aggregates as a fault is the truth of the path.

original: yang na 'gro ba lnga rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba lnga rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Or again, the five destinies are the truth of suffering.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //🔽'gro ba med pa ni 'gog @64a * //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o // 'gro ba med pa ni 'gog @64a * //
translated: Karma and the afflictions are the truth of origin.

original: pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The absence of destiny is the truth of cessation.

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa 'joms pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa 'joms pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the causes of destiny, karma and the afflictions, is the truth of the path.

original: yang na 'brog dgon par zhugs pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa na ngan song gsum la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'brog dgon par zhugs pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa na ngan song gsum la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Or again, like entering a wilderness, the fear of the three lower rebirths and so on in the wilderness of samsara is the truth of suffering.

original: 'jigs pa tshogs kyi rgyu las la chags pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa tshogs kyi rgyu las la chags pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The attachment to karma, the cause of the accumulation of fear, is the truth of origin.

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i grong khyer mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i grong khyer mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The city of nirvana, which is free from fear, is the truth of cessation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin par byed pa'i rgyu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin par byed pa'i rgyu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The cause for arriving at the city of nirvana is the truth of the path.

original: yang na 'bras bu'i chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu'i chos thams cad ni /
translated: Or again, all resultant phenomena are the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o /
translated: The truth of suffering.

original: rgyu'i chos thams cad ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i chos thams cad ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: All dharmas that are causes are the truth of origin.

original: 'bras bu'i chos bcom pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos bcom pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The destruction of resultant dharmas is the truth of cessation.

original: rgyu'i chos 'joms par byed pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i chos 'joms par byed pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The destruction of causal dharmas is the truth of the path.

original: yang na myu gu lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na myu gu lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, a sprout, for example, is the truth of suffering.

original: sa bon lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: A seed, for example, is the truth of origin.

original: myu gu'i chos dang bral ba'i gnas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: myu gu'i chos dang bral ba'i gnas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The state free from the dharmas of a sprout is the truth of cessation.

original: sa bon gyi chos 'jig par byed pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos 'jig par byed pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the dharmas of a seed is the truth of the path.

original: yang na nad lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na nad lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, an illness, for example, is the truth of suffering.

original: bad kan dang mkhris pa la sogs pa nad kyi rgyu lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: bad kan dang mkhris pa la sogs pa nad kyi rgyu lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The causes of an illness, such as phlegm and bile, are the truth of origin.

original: nad med pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: nad med pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The absence of illness is the truth of cessation.

original: sman lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sman lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Medicine is the truth of the path.

original: yang na me bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gdung ba sna tshogs dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na me bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi gdung ba sna tshogs dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Or, like a fire, it is the truth of suffering, since it is associated with various torments of suffering.

original: me skyed pa'i rgyu shing lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: me skyed pa'i rgyu shing lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Like fuel that generates a fire, it is the truth of origin.

original: me zhi bar gyur pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: me zhi bar gyur pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Like a fire that has gone out, it is the truth of cessation.

original: me zhi bar byed pa'i rgyu chu lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: me zhi bar byed pa'i rgyu chu lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Like water that extinguishes a fire, it is the truth of the path.

original: yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni 'dis dgra bzhin du sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs skyed pas dgra lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni 'dis dgra bzhin du sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs skyed pas dgra lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the truth of suffering is like an enemy, since it generates various sufferings, like an enemy.

original: sngon gyi kho na lta bur gyur pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi kho na lta bur gyur pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Like a former enemy, it is the truth of origin.

original: khams gsum gyi gnod pa kun dang bral bas /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi gnod pa kun dang bral bas /
translated: Since it is free from all harm in the three realms,

original: dgra'i gnod pa dang bral ba lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: dgra'i gnod pa dang bral ba lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: it is like being free from the harm of an enemy, it is the truth of cessation.

original: kho na sbyangs pa lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: kho na sbyangs pa lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Like a former enemy who has been subdued, it is the truth of the path.

original: yang na nyes pa kun gyi gzhir gyur pas ras lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na nyes pa kun gyi gzhir gyur pas ras lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Or, since it is the basis of all faults, the cloth-like is the truth of suffering.

original: dri ma lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The stain-like is the truth of origin.

original: dri ma dag par gyur pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma dag par gyur pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The purified stain-like is the truth of cessation.

original: dri ma dag par byed pa'i rgyu chu dang khrus rtsi @64b lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma dag par byed pa'i rgyu chu dang khrus rtsi @64b lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The cause that purifies the stain-like, like water and soap, is the truth of the path.

original: yang na bu lan chags pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bu lan chags pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Or, the suffering of a son who has a debt is like the truth of suffering.

original: dbul ba lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: dbul ba lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Poverty is like the truth of origin.

original: bu lon sbyangs pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: bu lon sbyangs pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The repayment of a debt is like the truth of cessation.

original: gter rnyed pa lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: gter rnyed pa lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The discovery of a treasure is like the truth of the path.

original: yang na tsha ba'i gdung bas phongs pa lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tsha ba'i gdung bas phongs pa lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Or, the suffering of being tormented by heat is like the truth of suffering.

original: tsha ba'i gdung bskyed par byed pa'i rgyu me lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: tsha ba'i gdung bskyed par byed pa'i rgyu me lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The cause that produces the torment of heat, like fire, is the truth of origin.

original: gdung ba dang bral ba lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: gdung ba dang bral ba lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is like the absence of that burning.

original: gdung ba sel bar byed pa'i sman tsandan dang ga bur la sogs pa lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: gdung ba sel bar byed pa'i sman tsandan dang ga bur la sogs pa lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the path is like the medicine that removes the burning.

original: yang na dug zos pa'i skyes bu dug g-yos pa'i sdug bsngal myong ba lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //🔽dug lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dug zos pa'i skyes bu dug g-yos pa'i sdug bsngal myong ba lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o // dug lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Or, the truth of suffering is like the experience of the suffering of a person who has eaten poison.🔽The truth of origin is like the poison.

original: dug bcom pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: dug bcom pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is like the destruction of the poison.

original: dug sman lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: dug sman lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the path is like the medicine for the poison.

original: yang na sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or, there are two kinds of suffering:

original: mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: meeting with what is unpleasant and separation from what is pleasant.

original: des kyang gnas gnyis la gnod par byed de /
analyzed: des kyang gnas gnyis la gnod par byed de /
translated: Those two also harm two things:

original: lus kyi gnas dang / sems kyi gnas so //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas dang / sems kyi gnas so //
translated: the body and the mind.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The truth of origin is also threefold:

original: sred pa dang lta ba dang las so //
analyzed: sred pa dang lta ba dang las so //
translated: craving, view, and karma.

original: de la sred pa dang lta bas ni khams gsum du skye ba'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: de la sred pa dang lta bas ni khams gsum du skye ba'i rgyu byed do //
translated: Among those, craving and view are the cause of birth in the three realms.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge bas ni der bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge bas ni der bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu byed do //
translated: The causes of happiness and suffering in that realm are virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: 'gog pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Cessation is also threefold:🔽The cessation of the afflictions that is the result of abandoning the view of self and so on that is, the view of the perishable collection and so on.

original: lta ba la gnas pa rnams kyis bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i 'gog pa dang / 'dod pa la gnas pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: lta ba la gnas pa rnams kyis bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i 'gog pa dang / 'dod pa la gnas pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa dang /
translated: The cessation that is the result of abandoning attachment to the five sense objects of the desire realm that is, the desire realm.

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags la gnas pa rnams kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags la gnas pa rnams kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation that is the result of abandoning the afflictions of the form and formless realms that is, the form and formless realms.

original: lam rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: lam rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The path is fourfold:

original: sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / byas pa rig pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / byas pa rig pa'i lam mo //
translated: the path of preparation, the path of seeing, the path of meditation, and the path of no further learning.

original: de la sbyor ba'i lam ni so so'i skye bo'i dus na tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa dang / kha zas la tshod rig pa dang / nyan pa dang / bsam pa @65a * //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i lam ni so so'i skye bo'i dus na tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa dang / kha zas la tshod rig pa dang / nyan pa dang / bsam pa @65a * //
translated: The path of preparation is the time of an ordinary being, abiding in ethics,🔽being austere, knowing the measure of food, listening, reflecting,🔽

original: la sogs pa la brtson pa'i tshogs sbyor ba dang / drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog ste /
analyzed: la sogs pa la brtson pa'i tshogs sbyor ba dang / drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog ste /
translated: The path of preparation is the four aids to penetration: heat, peak, acceptance, and supreme mundane quality.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i chos bzhi po 'di dag ni sbyor ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i chos bzhi po 'di dag ni sbyor ba'i lam mo //
translated: These four are the path of preparation.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i dus na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi phyin ci ma log par mthong ba ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i dus na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi phyin ci ma log par mthong ba ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of seeing is the unmistaken seeing of the four noble truths at the time of attaining the result of stream enterer.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i dus na bden pa mthong ba de nyid la goms par byed pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i dus na bden pa mthong ba de nyid la goms par byed pa ni bsgom pa'i lam mo /
translated: The path of meditation is the cultivation of the seeing of the truths at the time of the results of once returner and nonreturner.🔽The path of no more learning is the result of arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i dus na ngas bya ba ni byas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i dus na ngas bya ba ni byas /
translated: At the time of the result of arhat, one thinks, “What was to be done is done.

original: khur ni bor //
analyzed: khur ni bor //
translated: The burden is laid down.

original: skye ba ni zad //
analyzed: skye ba ni zad //
translated: Birth is exhausted.

original: srid pa ni 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes khong du chud pa ni byas pa rig pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: srid pa ni 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes khong du chud pa ni byas pa rig pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of gratitude is the understanding that “there is no other world than this.”

original: yang na 'phags pa'i bden pa rim pa 'di ltar bkod pa yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa ji ltar rtog pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rim pa 'di ltar bshad de /
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa'i bden pa rim pa 'di ltar bkod pa yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa ji ltar rtog pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rim pa 'di ltar bshad de /
translated: Or else, the order of the noble truths is presented in this way because the Blessed One explained them in the same order in which the yogis and yoginis understand the noble truths.

original: bden pa gang la dang por rtog pa de nyid thog mar bshad do //
analyzed: bden pa gang la dang por rtog pa de nyid thog mar bshad do //
translated: The truth that is first understood is explained first.

original: de la rnal 'byor pas dang por las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzhi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rtog ste /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor pas dang por las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzhi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rtog ste /
translated: In this regard, the yogis and yoginis first understand the truth of suffering, the basis of the various kinds of suffering that are the results of karma and the afflictions.

original: rtog pa'i tshul yang sdug bsngal gang la chags pa dang / gang gis sdug bsngal ba dang ; sdug bsngal la gang las thar bar smon pa skye ste /
analyzed: rtog pa'i tshul yang sdug bsngal gang la chags pa dang / gang gis sdug bsngal ba dang ; sdug bsngal la gang las thar bar smon pa skye ste /
translated: The way in which they understand it is that suffering is that which one is attached to, that which is suffering, and that from which one wishes to be liberated.

original: gang sdug bsngal zhe na /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal zhe na /
translated: What is suffering?

original: phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: phung po lnga sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The five aggregates are suffering.

original: gang gis sdug bsngal zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis sdug bsngal zhe na /
translated: By what is there suffering?

original: phung po lnga nyid kyis gnod cing sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga nyid kyis gnod cing sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: By the five aggregates themselves, which are harmful and painful.

original: gang las thar par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gang las thar par 'dod ce na /
translated: From what does one seek liberation?

original: sdug bsngal nyid las thar bar 'dod de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid las thar bar 'dod de /
translated: From suffering itself.

original: de'i phyir dang por sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the truth of suffering is explained first.

original: sdug bsngal de las byung zhes brtags na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de las byung zhes brtags na /
translated: When one investigates, “From what does this suffering arise? ”

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung bar mthong ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung bar mthong ste /
translated: One sees that it arises from the cause of karma and the afflictions.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu kun 'byung gi bden pa bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu kun 'byung gi bden pa bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the truth of the origin is explained next.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal de gang du 'gag par 'gyur zhes brtags na /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal de gang du 'gag par 'gyur zhes brtags na /
translated: When one investigates, “Where does this suffering cease? ”

original: nam mya ngan 'das pa'i gnas thob pa'i tshe 'gag par mthong ste /
analyzed: nam mya ngan 'das pa'i gnas thob pa'i tshe 'gag par mthong ste /
translated: One sees that it ceases when one attains the state of nirvana.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu 'gog pa'i bden pa bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu 'gog pa'i bden pa bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the truth of cessation is explained next.

original: de bas na 'gog pa de rgyu gang gis 'thob ces brtags na /
analyzed: de bas na 'gog pa de rgyu gang gis 'thob ces brtags na /
translated: When one investigates, “By what means does one attain that cessation? ”

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgrubs pas thob par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgrubs pas thob par mthong ste /
translated: One sees that it is attained by practicing the eightfold noble path.

original: de bas na de'i @65b 'og tu lam gyi bden pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de'i @65b 'og tu lam gyi bden pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the truth of the path is taught immediately after that.

original: de yang dper na sman pas nad pa'i nad sbyong ba la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: de yang dper na sman pas nad pa'i nad sbyong ba la zhugs pa na /
translated: Moreover, it is like a doctor who has begun to treat a patient’s illness.

original: nad dang nad kyi gzhi dang / nad med pa dang sman gang yin tshol ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nad dang nad kyi gzhi dang / nad med pa dang sman gang yin tshol ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: He seeks out the illness, the basis of the illness, health, and the medicine.

original: sman pa dang por nad sbyong bar zhugs pa na /
analyzed: sman pa dang por nad sbyong bar zhugs pa na /
translated: First, when the doctor has begun to treat the illness,

original: nad nyid gang yin pa la rtog go //
analyzed: nad nyid gang yin pa la rtog go //
translated: he examines the illness itself.

original: de'i 'og tu kha zas la sogs pa nad kyi rgyu gang las byung ba'i nad kyi gzhi la rtog go //🔽de nas nad de gsor rung mi rung zhes nad med pa la rtog go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kha zas la sogs pa nad kyi rgyu gang las byung ba'i nad kyi gzhi la rtog go // de nas nad de gsor rung mi rung zhes nad med pa la rtog go //
translated: After that, he examines the basis of the illness, which is the food, etc., from which the illness arose.🔽Then, he examines health to determine whether the illness can be cured.

original: de'i 'og tu nad de'i sman gang yin zhes sman la rtog go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nad de'i sman gang yin zhes sman la rtog go //
translated: After that, he examines the medicine for that illness.

original: de bzhin du mdo sde 'di las kyang bden pa rnams kyi rim pa 'di dang sbyar nas bshad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo sde 'di las kyang bden pa rnams kyi rim pa 'di dang sbyar nas bshad de /
translated: In the same way, in this Sutra, the order of the truths is explained in accordance with this example.

original: ji ltar zhe na dper na yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i sman pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na dper na yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i sman pa ni /
translated: How so? For example, a doctor who has the four branches

original: zug rngu thams cad 'byin pa'i rgyal po la 'os pa /
analyzed: zug rngu thams cad 'byin pa'i rgyal po la 'os pa /
translated: is fit to be a king who removes all afflictions.

original: rgyal po'i rkyen du gyur pa /
analyzed: rgyal po'i rkyen du gyur pa /
translated: The Tathāgata is the king of physicians.

original: sman pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sman pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba ste /
translated: He is called the king of physicians.

original: yan lag bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: gnod pa la mkhas pa yin /🔽gnod pa'i rgyu la mkhas pa yin //
analyzed: gnod pa la mkhas pa yin / gnod pa'i rgyu la mkhas pa yin //
translated: He is skilled in the afflictions.🔽He is skilled in the causes of the afflictions.

original: gnod pa spang ba la mkhas pa yin //
analyzed: gnod pa spang ba la mkhas pa yin //
translated: He is skilled in eliminating the afflictions.

original: gnod pa spangs pa yang phyis mi skye ba ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa spangs pa yang phyis mi skye ba ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: He is skilled in preventing the afflictions from arising again in the future.

original: de ltar de bzhin du yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sman pa bla na med pa zug rngu thams cad 'byin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin du yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sman pa bla na med pa zug rngu thams cad 'byin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, who possesses the four, is called the unsurpassed physician who removes all the arrows of suffering.

original: yan lag bzhi po gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di la dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: Here, bhikṣus, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One,

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: knows as it truly is: 'This is the truth of suffering.'

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: This is the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: This is the truth of the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi bden pa zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi bden pa zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught in accordance with reality.

original: de ltar bden pa bzhi mdo tsam du bstan pa nyid rgyas par bshad par bya ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de ltar bden pa bzhi mdo tsam du bstan pa nyid rgyas par bshad par bya ba'i phyir ro /
translated: In order to explain in detail just the brief teaching of the four truths,

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “What is the noble truth of suffering?” and so on.

original: de la smras pa ci'i phyir mdo tsam du bstan nas rgyas par bshad ce na /
analyzed: de la smras pa ci'i phyir mdo tsam du bstan nas rgyas par bshad ce na /
translated: Here, one might ask, “Why, after teaching in brief, is it explained in detail?”

original: slob ma rnam pa gnyis te /🔽mdo tsam du bstan pa la dga' ba dang rgyas par @66a * //
analyzed: slob ma rnam pa gnyis te / mdo tsam du bstan pa la dga' ba dang rgyas par @66a * //
translated: There are two types of disciples:

original: bshad pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: those who delight in brief teachings and those who delight in detailed explanations.

original: de la 'phags pa sh'a ri'i sras po lta bu mdo tsam du bstan pa la dga' ba rnams kyi ched du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa sh'a ri'i sras po lta bu mdo tsam du bstan pa la dga' ba rnams kyi ched du 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: For the sake of those who delight in brief teachings, such as the noble son Śāriputra, it is said, “What is the noble truth of suffering?” and so on.

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and so on up to:

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du mdor bsdus nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du mdor bsdus nas /
translated: The noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bka' stsal to //
translated: This is what he said in brief.

original: gang 'phags pa dga' ba can la sogs pa lta bu rgyas par bshad pa la dga' ba rnams kyi don du sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa dga' ba can la sogs pa lta bu rgyas par bshad pa la dga' ba rnams kyi don du sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: For the sake of those who delight in an extensive explanation, such as the noble Nandaka, he elaborated and said, “What is the noble truth of suffering?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa spros te gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa spros te gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: yang na 'dul ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na 'dul ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or, there are two kinds of disciples:

original: rgyu'i stobs can dang / rkyen gyi stobs can ni 'phags pa 'od srungs lta bu ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs can dang / rkyen gyi stobs can ni 'phags pa 'od srungs lta bu ste /
translated: those who are powerful through the cause and those who are powerful through the condition.🔽The noble Kāśyapa is like the first.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la dge ba'i rtsa ba phal cher bsags pa rgyud yongs su smin par gyur ba ste /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la dge ba'i rtsa ba phal cher bsags pa rgyud yongs su smin par gyur ba ste /
translated: In previous lives, he accumulated roots of virtue, and his continuum became fully ripened.

original: de dag la ming tsam smos pas kyang don rgya cher khong du chud par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de dag la ming tsam smos pas kyang don rgya cher khong du chud par 'gyur bas na /
translated: For them, just by mentioning the name, the extensive meaning is comprehended.

original: de'i rgyu'i stobs can rnams kyi ched du mdo tsam bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i stobs can rnams kyi ched du mdo tsam bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the sūtras were taught for the sake of those who are powerful through the cause.

original: rkyen gyi stobs can ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan dgos pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen gyi stobs can ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan dgos pa ste /
translated: The one with the power of conditions is one who must be taught by a spiritual friend.

original: de dag la rgya cher bshad pa med na /
analyzed: de dag la rgya cher bshad pa med na /
translated: If those are not explained extensively,

original: khong du chud par mi nus pa'i phyir spros te bshad do //
analyzed: khong du chud par mi nus pa'i phyir spros te bshad do //
translated: they cannot be understood, so they are explained elaborately.

original: yang na dbang po rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na dbang po rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or, there are two types of faculties:

original: dbang po rnon po dang / rtul po'o //🔽de la dbang po rnon po rnams kyi don du mdo tsam du bstan to //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po dang / rtul po'o // de la dbang po rnon po rnams kyi don du mdo tsam du bstan to //
translated: sharp faculties and dull faculties.🔽For those with sharp faculties, it is taught just briefly.

original: dbang po rtul po rnams kyi don du spros te bshad do //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po rnams kyi don du spros te bshad do //
translated: For those with dull faculties, it is explained elaborately.

original: yang nyan thos rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang nyan thos rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of śrāvakas:

original: thos pa mang po dang / thos pa nyung ngu'o //🔽thos pa mang po rnams la ni mdo tsam du bstan to //
analyzed: thos pa mang po dang / thos pa nyung ngu'o // thos pa mang po rnams la ni mdo tsam du bstan to //
translated: those with much learning and those with little learning.🔽For those with much learning, it is taught just briefly.

original: thos pa nyung ngu rnams la ni spros te bshad do //
analyzed: thos pa nyung ngu rnams la ni spros te bshad do //
translated: For those with little learning, it is explained elaborately.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la sogs pa'i don bsdus te bstan pa dang / spros te bshad pa'i skabs su yang lan 'dis glan no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la sogs pa'i don bsdus te bstan pa dang / spros te bshad pa'i skabs su yang lan 'dis glan no //
translated: This answer also applies to the occasion of the brief and elaborate explanations of the meaning of dependent arising and so on.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the statement “The noble truth of suffering,”

original: sdug bsngal bar 'phags pa rnams kyi thugs su chud pas /🔽sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar 'phags pa rnams kyi thugs su chud pas / sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'am /
translated: Since the noble ones understand it as suffering,🔽it is the noble truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'khor bar khong du chud na 'phags par 'gyur bas sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'khor bar khong du chud na 'phags par 'gyur bas sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: Or, if one understands suffering to be samsara, then one becomes a noble one.

original: bden pa ni sdug bsngal bar ma nor /
analyzed: bden pa ni sdug bsngal bar ma nor /
translated: Thus, it is the noble truth of suffering because suffering is not mistaken.

original: sdug bsngal bar yang dag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar yang dag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: It is the noble truth of suffering because it is suffering in reality.

original: de yang sdug bsngal skye ba la sogs pas @66b sdug bsngal brgyad las skye ba ci'i phyir dang por bshad ce na /
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal skye ba la sogs pas @66b sdug bsngal brgyad las skye ba ci'i phyir dang por bshad ce na /
translated: Why is birth explained first among the eight sufferings of birth and so on?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad kyis dang po skye ba'i gzhi byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad kyis dang po skye ba'i gzhi byed pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as ethics is the basis for generating all mundane and transcendent qualities,

original: skye ba yang rga ba dang na ba la sogs ba sdug bsngal lhag ma rnams kyi dang po skye ba'i rgyu byed pas na thog mar bshad do //
analyzed: skye ba yang rga ba dang na ba la sogs ba sdug bsngal lhag ma rnams kyi dang po skye ba'i rgyu byed pas na thog mar bshad do //
translated: so too birth is the cause for generating the remaining sufferings of aging, sickness and so on.

original: yang na sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Alternatively, there are two types of suffering:

original: rtsa ba'i sdug bsngal dang yal ga la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sdug bsngal dang yal ga la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Suffering is like a root and the rest of the members are like branches, etc.

original: de la rtsa ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba ste dga' ba la sogs par sdug bsngal lhag ma rnams kyi rtsa bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽yal ga la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa'i sdug bsngal ni /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba ste dga' ba la sogs par sdug bsngal lhag ma rnams kyi rtsa bar gyur ba'i phyir ro // yal ga la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa'i sdug bsngal ni /
translated: The root of suffering is birth, because it is the root of the remaining sufferings, such as old age, etc.🔽The rest of the members are like branches, etc.

original: rga ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa lhag ma rnams te /
analyzed: rga ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa lhag ma rnams te /
translated: The rest of the sufferings, such as the suffering of old age, etc.

original: de dag ni skye ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni skye ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: are like branches, etc., because they arise from the cause of birth.

original: de la skye ba gang zhe na /🔽gang gong du rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i skabs su yang sems can de dang de rnams /
analyzed: de la skye ba gang zhe na / gang gong du rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i skabs su yang sems can de dang de rnams /
translated: What is birth?

original: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu skye ba dang / kun skye ba dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni skye ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu skye ba dang / kun skye ba dang / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni skye ba yin no //
translated: It is that which was mentioned in the context of dependent origination, namely, the birth of such and such sentient beings in such and such classes of sentient beings, their complete birth, their origination, their manifestation, their appearance of the aggregates, their appearance of the components, their appearance of the sense-spheres.

original: yang na las dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i khyad par sred pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang 'grogs pa nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i shugs kyis sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu phung po dang khams dang skye🔽mched rab tu rnyed pa ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na las dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i khyad par sred pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang 'grogs pa nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i shugs kyis sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched rab tu rnyed pa ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, birth is the acquisition of aggregates, elements, and sense bases in this or that class of sentient beings, by the power of the latent impressions of the afflictions such as craving, which are the cause of linking with a new existence.

original: yang na skye ba rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang na skye ba rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Or else, birth is of five kinds:

original: 'phags pa'i chos khong du chud pa las skyes pa dang / mngal gyi gnas su skyes pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs par skyes pa dang / ris mthun pa'i mtshan nyid du skyes pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i mtshan nyid du skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos khong du chud pa las skyes pa dang / mngal gyi gnas su skyes pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs par skyes pa dang / ris mthun pa'i mtshan nyid du skyes pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i mtshan nyid du skyes pa'o //
translated: birth from understanding the teachings of the noble ones, birth in the womb, birth in a good family, birth in a class of beings, and birth as a renunciate.

original: de la 'phags pa'i chos khong du chud pa las skye ba ni /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi don rtogs pa las /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i chos khong du chud pa las skye ba ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi don rtogs pa las /
translated: Birth from understanding the teachings of the noble ones is

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras su skye ba skyes pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras su skye ba skyes pa ste /
translated: birth as a child of the Buddha from understanding the meaning of the Tathagata's scriptures.

original: mdo dag las thugs las skyes pa zhal nas skyes pa 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba las skyes pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo dag las thugs las skyes pa zhal nas skyes pa 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba las skyes pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The sūtras say, “Born from the mind, born from the mouth, born from the noble Dharma and Vinaya.”

original: mngal gyi gnas su skyes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang po nyid du mngal du zhugs nas mngal nas phyir ma byung gi bar du /
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas su skyes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang po nyid du mngal du zhugs nas mngal nas phyir ma byung gi bar du /
translated: Born in the womb is the first mental consciousness that enters the womb and remains there until it leaves the womb.

original: mer mer po las nur nur po byung ba dang / nur nur po las ltar ltar por gyur pa la sogs pa'o //🔽rigs phun sum tshogs par skyes pa ni /
analyzed: mer mer po las nur nur po byung ba dang / nur nur po las ltar ltar por gyur pa la sogs pa'o // rigs phun sum tshogs par skyes pa ni /
translated: From the stage of kalala, it becomes arbuda, from arbuda it becomes peśin, and so on.

original: @67a * // nor bu rin po che'i rigs aindra n'i lar gyur pa dang / aindra n'i la chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: @67a * // nor bu rin po che'i rigs aindra n'i lar gyur pa dang / aindra n'i la chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Born in a perfect family is like a precious jewel born in the family of a precious jewel, or becoming a great sapphire.

original: sems can gyi ris mthun pa'i skyes pa ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris mthun pa'i skyes pa ni /
translated: Born in a class of sentient beings is

original: gang lus kyi yan lag 'dra bar gyur ba ste /🔽ba lang yang ba lang du ris mthun /
analyzed: gang lus kyi yan lag 'dra bar gyur ba ste / ba lang yang ba lang du ris mthun /
translated: when the limbs of the body are similar.🔽Cows are born in the class of cows,

original: rta yang rtar ris mthun par gyur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rta yang rtar ris mthun par gyur pa lta bu'o //
translated: horses are born in the class of horses.

original: rab tu byung bar skyes pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu byung bar skyes pa ni /
translated: Born as a renunciate is

original: ma'i mngal nas skyes nas phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs par so sor rdzogs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ma'i mngal nas skyes nas phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs par so sor rdzogs par gyur pa ste /
translated: After being born from the mother's womb, the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc. are individually completed.

original: skye ba lnga las 'dir mngal gyi gnas su skyes pa dang / rab tu byung bar skyes pa gnyis su blta'o //
analyzed: skye ba lnga las 'dir mngal gyi gnas su skyes pa dang / rab tu byung bar skyes pa gnyis su blta'o //
translated: From the five kinds of birth, here one should see two: birth in the womb and birth as a renunciate.

original: ci'i phyir na skye ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba skye na /🔽smras pa khams gsum gyi skye ba thams cad la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na skye ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba skye na / smras pa khams gsum gyi skye ba thams cad la /
translated: Why is birth called suffering?

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis rtag tu sreg pas na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis rtag tu sreg pas na /
translated: It is said: All births in the three realms are constantly burned by the three kinds of suffering.

original: skye ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, birth is called suffering.

original: ji lta zhe na bsod nams ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung ba ngan song gsum la sogs pa'i ris su skyes pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na bsod nams ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung ba ngan song gsum la sogs pa'i ris su skyes pa rnams la ni /
translated: How is that? Those born in the realms of the three lower realms, which arise from unmeritorious causes,

original: sreg pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi yang sdug bsngal gyi mes rtag tu sreg par byed do //
analyzed: sreg pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi yang sdug bsngal gyi mes rtag tu sreg par byed do //
translated: are constantly burned by the fire of the suffering of suffering.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung ba /
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung ba /
translated: Those born in the realms of gods and humans, which arise from the causes of meritorious and meritorious-conducive formations,

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi dang lha la sogs par ris mthun par skyes pa rnams la ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi dang lha la sogs par ris mthun par skyes pa rnams la ni //
translated: Those born in the desire realm as humans, gods and so on who are of similar class🔽

original: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi mes rtag tu sreg par byed do //🔽bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed las gzhan pa bsam gtan gyi mtshan nyid mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung ba dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i lha rnams kyi ris su skyes pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi mes rtag tu sreg par byed do // bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed las gzhan pa bsam gtan gyi mtshan nyid mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyi rgyu las byung ba dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i lha rnams kyi ris su skyes pa rnams la ni /
translated: Those born in the same realm of desire, such as humans and gods, are constantly burned by the fire of the suffering of change.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi mes rtag tu sreg par byed do /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi mes rtag tu sreg par byed do /
translated: Those born in the realms of the gods of the form and formless realms, who are the effect of the cause of the formation of non-fluctuating merit and demerit, are constantly burned by the fire of the suffering of formation.

original: de dag kyang mi rtag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi rtag pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they also possess impermanent phenomena.

original: yang na shing skyes pa dang nag sa mes tshig cing tshal chus khyer ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi shing ma skyes na ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na shing skyes pa dang nag sa mes tshig cing tshal chus khyer ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi shing ma skyes na ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Or, just as a tree that has grown is burned by fire, a field is carried away by water, and so on, but if the tree has not grown, it is not so.

original: skye ba yod par gyur na /
analyzed: skye ba yod par gyur na /
translated: If birth exists,

original: bcad pa dang gshegs pa dang bcing ba dang bsad pa dang / bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bcad pa dang gshegs pa dang bcing ba dang bsad pa dang / bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: and the sufferings of being cut, gashed, bound, killed, hungry, thirsty, and so on.

original: skye ba med na de dag mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba med na de dag mi 'byung ste /
translated: If there were no birth, these would not occur.

original: de'i phyir yang skye ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang skye ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, birth is also called suffering.

original: yang na skye ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mang po'i 'byung khungs /
analyzed: yang na skye ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mang po'i 'byung khungs /
translated: Alternatively, birth is the source of many sufferings,

original: mya ngan sna tshogs kyi 'byung gnas /
analyzed: mya ngan sna tshogs kyi 'byung gnas /
translated: the origin of various kinds of grief,

original: don med pa rnams kyi rtsa ba /
analyzed: don med pa rnams kyi rtsa ba /
translated: the root of all that is meaningless,

original: dga' ba'i rgyu 'ching ba'i @67b gleng gzhi ni nad sna tshogs kyi skye mched /
analyzed: dga' ba'i rgyu 'ching ba'i @67b gleng gzhi ni nad sna tshogs kyi skye mched /
translated: the basis for the fetters that are the cause of attachment,

original: nyes pa du ma'i gter chen po /
analyzed: nyes pa du ma'i gter chen po /
translated: the great treasure of many faults,

original: nyams pa dang brlag par 'gyur ba'i gzhi /
analyzed: nyams pa dang brlag par 'gyur ba'i gzhi /
translated: the basis for loss and destruction,

original: lus dang sems la sha thang zhing mi bde ba skyed par byed pa'i zhing /
analyzed: lus dang sems la sha thang zhing mi bde ba skyed par byed pa'i zhing /
translated: the field that produces physical and mental fatigue and discomfort,

original: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi rgyu mthun par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi rgyu mthun par 'gyur ba /
translated: the concordant cause of various afflictions,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa /
translated: despised by the noble ones,

original: byis pa rnams kyis rjes su bsngags pa /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis rjes su bsngags pa /
translated: and praised by the childish.

original: srid pa la dga' ba rnams mngon par dga' ba smon par byed pa'i gnas /
analyzed: srid pa la dga' ba rnams mngon par dga' ba smon par byed pa'i gnas /
translated: It is the place where those who delight in existence delight in and long for manifest existence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis thugs brtse bar byas pa'i yul yin pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis thugs brtse bar byas pa'i yul yin pas na /
translated: It is the object of the compassion of the Tathagatas.

original: de'i phyir yang skye ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang skye ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: For these reasons also birth is suffering.

original: yang na mngal gyi gnas nas brtsams te /
analyzed: yang na mngal gyi gnas nas brtsams te /
translated: Or else, beginning with the womb,

original: 'chi ba'i rgya mtsho la thug gi bar du sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang rgyun du 'grogs pa'i phyir yang skye ba sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i rgya mtsho la thug gi bar du sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang rgyun du 'grogs pa'i phyir yang skye ba sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
translated: birth is suffering because it is always accompanied by various kinds of suffering up to the ocean of death.

original: de yang ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dang po pha dang ma mi tshangs par kun tu spyod pa'i rgyu las /
analyzed: dang po pha dang ma mi tshangs par kun tu spyod pa'i rgyu las /
translated: First, from the cause of the impure conduct of the father and mother,

original: khrag dang khu ba'i mi gtsang ba 'dres pa'i nang du rnam par shes pa zhugs nas brgyal ba'i tshe /
analyzed: khrag dang khu ba'i mi gtsang ba 'dres pa'i nang du rnam par shes pa zhugs nas brgyal ba'i tshe /
translated: the consciousness enters the womb and is stunned by the mixture of the impure blood and semen.

original: g-yang sa chen po nas ltung ste /
analyzed: g-yang sa chen po nas ltung ste /
translated: Then, like falling into a great abyss,

original: mun nag gi nang du zhugs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mun nag gi nang du zhugs pa bzhin du /
translated: like entering a very dark place,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / pha ma'i khrag dang khu ba las mer mer po dang / nur nur po dang / ltar ltar po la sogs pa rim gyis 'gyur zhing smin pa na yang 'bras smin pa bzhin du sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / dka' ba las yan lag dang nying lag so sor dod pa'i tshe yang phan tshun nas rkang lag brgyangs pa bzhin du sdug bsngal skyes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / pha ma'i khrag dang khu ba las mer mer po dang / nur nur po dang / ltar ltar po la sogs pa rim gyis 'gyur zhing smin pa na yang 'bras smin pa bzhin du sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / dka' ba las yan lag dang nying lag so sor dod pa'i tshe yang phan tshun nas rkang lag brgyangs pa bzhin du sdug bsngal skyes pa dang /
