translated: When the major and minor limbs are formed from the hardships, it is painful, like the stretching of limbs.🔽When the embryo is in the womb, it is painful, like being sandwiched between two mountains, when it is in the state of being digested and not digested.

original: mngal gyi gnas na zhu ba dang / ma zhu ba'i bar na gnas pa'i tshe na yang ri gnyis kyi tham par bcug pa bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang / nam mas kha zas drod bag za ba dang / grang ba la sogs pa za ba dang /
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas na zhu ba dang / ma zhu ba'i bar na gnas pa'i tshe na yang ri gnyis kyi tham par bcug pa bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang / nam mas kha zas drod bag za ba dang / grang ba la sogs pa za ba dang /
translated: When the mother eats hot and cold food,

original: rgyug pa dang / mchong pa dang / rkang lag brkyang ba dang / bskum pa la sogs pa'i g-yo ba byed pa'i dus na yang sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong ste /
analyzed: rgyug pa dang / mchong pa dang / rkang lag brkyang ba dang / bskum pa la sogs pa'i g-yo ba byed pa'i dus na yang sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs myong ste /
translated: and when she runs, jumps, stretches her arms and legs, and so on, it experiences various kinds of pain.

original: mas kha zas tsha ba zos na ni /
analyzed: mas kha zas tsha ba zos na ni /
translated: If the mother eats hot food,

original: mes bskor ba dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal /
analyzed: mes bskor ba dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal /
translated: it is as if one is being tormented by fire.

original: grang ba za ba'i dus su ni gangs kyi ltongs su bor ba dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal /
analyzed: grang ba za ba'i dus su ni gangs kyi ltongs su bor ba dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal /
translated: When she eats cold food, it is as if one is being thrown into the snow.🔽When she jumps, it is as if a strong man were to pick one up and violently throw one down to the ground.

original: mchong pa'i dus na ni skyes bu stobs po ches bteg nas sa la drag tu brdabs pa dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal ba dang / nam ma'i mngal nas phyir byung ba'i tshe na yang 'khrul 'khor gyi bar nas drangs pa bzhin du /🔽shin tu btsir @68a * //
analyzed: mchong pa'i dus na ni skyes bu stobs po ches bteg nas sa la drag tu brdabs pa dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal ba dang / nam ma'i mngal nas phyir byung ba'i tshe na yang 'khrul 'khor gyi bar nas drangs pa bzhin du / shin tu btsir @68a * //
translated: When one comes out of the womb, it is as if one were being pulled through a machine.

original: nas phyir 'byin pas rab tu sdug bsngal che ba'i phyir 'byung ba na yang /
analyzed: nas phyir 'byin pas rab tu sdug bsngal che ba'i phyir 'byung ba na yang /
translated: Because of the great pain of being squeezed and pulled out,

original: shin tu gzhon pa'i lus khrag dang / snabs la sogs pa'i nang du 'jam por btsa' btsa' ba /
analyzed: shin tu gzhon pa'i lus khrag dang / snabs la sogs pa'i nang du 'jam por btsa' btsa' ba /
translated: one is born into a very tender body, which is wiped with a cloth soaked in blood and mucus.

original: lag pa dang chu la sogs pas reg pa'i tshe /
analyzed: lag pa dang chu la sogs pas reg pa'i tshe /
translated: When one is touched by hands, water, and so forth,🔽unbearable pain arises, as if hot water were being poured into a wound.

original: rma'i gseb tu tsha chu blugs pa dang 'dra bar mi bzad pa skye ba'i phyir skye ba'i sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: rma'i gseb tu tsha chu blugs pa dang 'dra bar mi bzad pa skye ba'i phyir skye ba'i sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: This is the suffering of birth.

original: rga ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la rga ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rga ba'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la rga ba gang zhe na /
translated: The suffering of old age. What is old age?

original: gang gong du spyi cer dang / skra dkar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: gang gong du spyi cer dang / skra dkar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de ni rga ba'o //
translated: It is what the Buddha had in mind when he said, “Wrinkles, grey hair, etc.”

original: yang na rga ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽lang tsho med par gyur pa dang / gzhon nu'i mthu rtsa la nyams pa dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams bri ba dang / 'du byed rnams rnyings par gyur ba dang / yan lag dang nying lag gzhig pa dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs mi mdzes par byas pa dang /
analyzed: yang na rga ba zhes bya ba ni / lang tsho med par gyur pa dang / gzhon nu'i mthu rtsa la nyams pa dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams bri ba dang / 'du byed rnams rnyings par gyur ba dang / yan lag dang nying lag gzhig pa dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs mi mdzes par byas pa dang /
translated: Or, old age is

original: dbang po rnams nyam chung ba dang / dran pa dang / blo bri ba dang / 'chi ba la mngon du lta ba ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams nyam chung ba dang / dran pa dang / blo bri ba dang / 'chi ba la mngon du lta ba ni rga ba'o //
translated: the loss of youth, the loss of strength, the loss of the great elements, the loss of the formative forces, the loss of the major and minor body parts, the loss of beauty, the loss of memory, the loss of understanding, the loss of life, the loss of power, the loss of freedom, the loss of happiness, the loss of health, the loss of wealth, the loss of relatives, the loss of friends, the loss of attendants, the loss of servants, the loss of sons, the loss of daughters, the loss of wife, the loss of life, the loss of all that is good.

original: yang na rga ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyis non na dngos po thams cad gzhan du 'gyur bar byed de /
analyzed: yang na rga ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyis non na dngos po thams cad gzhan du 'gyur bar byed de /
translated: Or, old age is the state of being overcome by the dharma called old age, which causes all things to change.

original: des kha gdong la non na ni gnyer ma mang ba dang / khabs nag pos khebs par byed do //
analyzed: des kha gdong la non na ni gnyer ma mang ba dang / khabs nag pos khebs par byed do //
translated: When it overcomes the face, it causes wrinkles and grey hair.

original: des skra la non na ni skra dkar dang spyi cer du gyur par byed do //
analyzed: des skra la non na ni skra dkar dang spyi cer du gyur par byed do //
translated: If it affects the hair, it causes graying and baldness.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams la non na ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams la non na ni /
translated: If it affects the great elements,

original: yan lag rnams lci ba dang zhig par byed do //
analyzed: yan lag rnams lci ba dang zhig par byed do //
translated: it causes the limbs to become heavy and to break down.

original: skye mched rnams la non na ni dbang po rnams nyams chung bar byed de mi gsal bar mthong ba dang thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched rnams la non na ni dbang po rnams nyams chung bar byed de mi gsal bar mthong ba dang thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it affects the sense spheres, it causes the faculties to weaken, so that one sees and hears unclearly.

original: lus la non na ni lus 'dar ba dang ldem ldem por byed do //
analyzed: lus la non na ni lus 'dar ba dang ldem ldem por byed do //
translated: If it affects the body, it causes the body to tremble and to become flabby.

original: sems la non na ni dran pa dang blo gros med par byed de /
analyzed: sems la non na ni dran pa dang blo gros med par byed de /
translated: If it affects the mind, it causes the loss of memory and understanding.

original: sngon smras pa dang byas pa rnams kyang brjed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon smras pa dang byas pa rnams kyang brjed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One forgets what was said and done in the past.

original: rgyab kyi tshigs su zhugs na ni des lus sgur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyab kyi tshigs su zhugs na ni des lus sgur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it enters the vertebrae, it causes the body to become bent over.

original: rkang lag gi tshigs su zhugs na ni shing 'khyog po bzhin du ldem ldem por byed do //
analyzed: rkang lag gi tshigs su zhugs na ni shing 'khyog po bzhin du ldem ldem por byed do //
translated: If it enters the joints of the arms and legs, it causes them to become flabby, like crooked trees.

original: lang tsho'i lus gzhon nu dang bral bas 'du byed rnams rnying bar yang ston par byed de de ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: lang tsho'i lus gzhon nu dang bral bas 'du byed rnams rnying bar yang ston par byed de de ni rga ba'o //
translated: It also shows the aging of formations, as youthfulness of the body in the prime of life is lost. This is aging.

original: yang na rga ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na rga ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of aging:

original: rten nyams pa'i mtshan nyid dang / brtan pa nyams pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rten nyams pa'i mtshan nyid dang / brtan pa nyams pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the decline of the basis and the characteristic of the decline of firmness.

original: de la rten nyams pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la rten nyams pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the decline of the basis is

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur ba'i sha dang khrag dang tshil dang / rus pa dang rkang la sogs pa bris pas /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur ba'i sha dang khrag dang tshil dang / rus pa dang rkang la sogs pa bris pas /
translated: the flesh, blood, fat, bones, marrow, and so on that are derived from the four great elements.

original: de'i rgyu las rgyug pa dang / mchong ba dang / brkyang @68b ba dang / bskum pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mi nus shing /🔽lus kyi brtson 'grus dang stobs med par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las rgyug pa dang / mchong ba dang / brkyang @68b ba dang / bskum pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba mi nus shing / lus kyi brtson 'grus dang stobs med par gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of that, one is unable to perform actions such as running, jumping, stretching, bending, coming, and going.

original: brten pa nyams pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po nyams pas /
analyzed: brten pa nyams pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po nyams pas /
translated: The decline of firmness is the decline of the faculties such as the eyes.

original: mig gsal bar mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / snom pa dang / myong ba 'gyur la /
analyzed: mig gsal bar mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / snom pa dang / myong ba 'gyur la /
translated: Because of that, the eyes do not see clearly, the ears do not hear, the nose does not smell, and the tongue does not experience taste.

original: de'i rgyu las dran pa dang blo gros bri ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las dran pa dang blo gros bri ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of that, memory and intelligence decline.

original: sngon smras pa dang byas pa rnams kyang brjed cing sems kyi brtson 'grus dang mthu med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngon smras pa dang byas pa rnams kyang brjed cing sems kyi brtson 'grus dang mthu med par byed pa'o //
translated: It causes one to forget what was said and done in the past and it weakens the mind’s diligence and power.

original: ci'i phyir rga ba dang sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rga ba dang sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba /
translated: Why is it called “aging and suffering”?

original: smras pa rga ba 'di zin par gyur na lus kyi yan lag la mi mdzes pa skyed par byed cing mdzes pa dang / stobs dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpa' ba dang / bstan pa dang / blo dang shes rab nyams par byas nas 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su 'khrid par byed de /
analyzed: smras pa rga ba 'di zin par gyur na lus kyi yan lag la mi mdzes pa skyed par byed cing mdzes pa dang / stobs dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpa' ba dang / bstan pa dang / blo dang shes rab nyams par byas nas 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su 'khrid par byed de /
translated: It is said that when this aging occurs, it produces ugliness in the body’s limbs and it destroys beauty, strength, diligence, courage, discipline, intelligence, and wisdom, and it leads to the state of death.

original: dper na gshed po rnams kyis gsad par bya ba'i skyes bu kha sna tshogs pa bcad cing bral nas gzugs la mi mdzes pa skyed cing bsad pa'i gnas su 'khrid par byed pa bzhin pas na /
analyzed: dper na gshed po rnams kyis gsad par bya ba'i skyes bu kha sna tshogs pa bcad cing bral nas gzugs la mi mdzes pa skyed cing bsad pa'i gnas su 'khrid par byed pa bzhin pas na /
translated: For example, it is like when a person is to be executed by executioners, they cut off their nose and ears, and having separated them from their body, they produce ugliness in their form and lead them to the place of execution.

original: rga ba dang sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rga ba dang sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “aging and suffering.”

original: yang na sngon lang tsho'i dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: yang na sngon lang tsho'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: Or, in the past, during the time of youth,

original: nye du gnyen bshes la sogs pa'i yid dga' bar byed pa 'gro ba bzang mo'i sems dang yid kyi rjes su mthun par byed cing /🔽de dag gi yid 'phrog pas 'gro ba mang po'i yid du 'ong bas kha dog dang dbyibs mdzes pa shin tu gzhon nu'i gzugs /🔽padmo ltar gyur pa de rga ba'i ser ba dang / sad kyis phog na zhum pa dang / 'khums pa dang / zhig pa dang / mi mdzes par gyur pas nye du gnyen bshes rnams kyang mi dga' bar gyur cing 'gro ba bzang mo rnams kyis kyang gtong bar byed pas na /
analyzed: nye du gnyen bshes la sogs pa'i yid dga' bar byed pa 'gro ba bzang mo'i sems dang yid kyi rjes su mthun par byed cing / de dag gi yid 'phrog pas 'gro ba mang po'i yid du 'ong bas kha dog dang dbyibs mdzes pa shin tu gzhon nu'i gzugs / padmo ltar gyur pa de rga ba'i ser ba dang / sad kyis phog na zhum pa dang / 'khums pa dang / zhig pa dang / mi mdzes par gyur pas nye du gnyen bshes rnams kyang mi dga' bar gyur cing 'gro ba bzang mo rnams kyis kyang gtong bar byed pas na /
translated: It is the cause of the loss of the beauty of youth, the cause of the loss of the beauty of the body, the cause of the loss of the beauty of strength, the cause of the loss of the beauty of life, and the cause of the loss of the beauty of happiness.🔽It is the cause of the loss of the beauty of youth, the cause of the loss of the beauty of the body, the cause of the loss of the beauty of strength, the cause of the loss of the beauty of life, and the cause of the loss of the beauty of happiness.🔽It is the cause of the loss of the beauty of youth, the cause of the loss of the beauty of the body, the cause of the loss of the beauty of strength, the cause of the loss of the beauty of life, and the cause of the loss of the beauty of happiness.

original: de'i phyir yang rga ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rga ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: It is the cause of the loss of the beauty of youth, the cause of the loss of the beauty of the body, the cause of the loss of the beauty of strength, the cause of the loss of the beauty of life, and the cause of the loss of the beauty of happiness.

original: yang na rga ba 'di ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang mdzes pa med par byad pa dar la babs pa dang / nad med pa 'joms par byed pa /🔽stobs gang brtson 'grus dang mthu 'phrog pa /
analyzed: yang na rga ba 'di ni kha dog dang dbyibs dang mdzes pa med par byad pa dar la babs pa dang / nad med pa 'joms par byed pa /🔽stobs gang brtson 'grus dang mthu 'phrog pa /
translated: It is the cause of the loss of the beauty of youth, the cause of the loss of the beauty of the body, the cause of the loss of the beauty of strength, the cause of the loss of the beauty of life, and the cause of the loss of the beauty of happiness.🔽It is the cause of the loss of the beauty of youth, the cause of the loss of the beauty of the body, the cause of the loss of the beauty of strength, the cause of the loss of the beauty of life, and the cause of the loss of the beauty of happiness.

original: dran pa dang blo gros dang thos pa dang / ye shes rnams nyams par byed pa'i rgyu dbang po rnams nyam chung bskyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir yang rga ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang blo gros dang thos pa dang / ye shes rnams nyams par byed pa'i rgyu dbang po rnams nyam chung bskyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir yang rga ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is also called suffering because it causes the faculties to weaken, which in turn causes the loss of memory, understanding, learning, and wisdom.

original: nad kyi sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad kyi sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The suffering of sickness.

original: na ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: na ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is sickness?

original: sa la sogs pa'i khams mi mthun zhing shas che chung du gyur pa na na ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khams mi mthun zhing shas che chung du gyur pa na na ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is a disturbance of the elements of earth, etc., in the body, and a preponderance of one over another.

original: @69a * // nam sa la sogs pa'i khams mnyam na nad med pa'o //
analyzed: @69a * // nam sa la sogs pa'i khams mnyam na nad med pa'o //
translated: When the elements are in equilibrium, there is health.

original: yang na na ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na na ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Sickness is of two kinds:

original: lus kyi nad dang sems kyi nad do //
analyzed: lus kyi nad dang sems kyi nad do //
translated: sickness of the body and sickness of the mind.

original: de la lus kyi nad kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la lus kyi nad kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Sickness of the body is of two kinds:

original: nang gi rkyen las byung ba dang / phyi'i rkyen las byung ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi rkyen las byung ba dang / phyi'i rkyen las byung ba'o //
translated: sickness caused by internal conditions and sickness caused by external conditions.

original: de la nang gi rkyen las byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la nang gi rkyen las byung ba ni /
translated: Sickness caused by internal conditions is

original: lus kyis la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams 'khrugs pas gang gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyis la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams 'khrugs pas gang gnod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: a disturbance of the elements of earth, etc., in the body, which causes harm.

original: phyi'i rkyen las byung ba ni dbyig pa dang / rdo ba la sogs pas phog nas gang gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i rkyen las byung ba ni dbyig pa dang / rdo ba la sogs pas phog nas gang gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: The external conditions are the blows from sticks, stones, etc. that cause harm.

original: lus kyi nad de yang ming dang rgyu rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam pa du mar gzhag ste /
analyzed: lus kyi nad de yang ming dang rgyu rkyen tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam pa du mar gzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, the illness of the body is established in many ways by means of name, cause, and condition.

original: de la ming ni shu ba dang sgong po dang / mdze dang / 'brum bu dang / 'bras dang rims dang / skyigs bu la sogs pa nad kyi ming rnam pa du mar btags pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni shu ba dang sgong po dang / mdze dang / 'brum bu dang / 'bras dang rims dang / skyigs bu la sogs pa nad kyi ming rnam pa du mar btags pa'o //
translated: The name is the many names of illnesses such as abscess, boil, leprosy, smallpox, tumor, fever, hiccup, etc.

original: rgyu ni bad kan las byung ba dang / mkhris pa las byung ba dang / rlung las byung ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni bad kan las byung ba dang / mkhris pa las byung ba dang / rlung las byung ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause is that which arises from phlegm, bile, wind, etc.

original: rten ni klad pa na ba dang / mig na ba dang / mgrin pa na ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'di ni lus kyi nad do //
analyzed: rten ni klad pa na ba dang / mig na ba dang / mgrin pa na ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste 'di ni lus kyi nad do //
translated: The support is the head, eyes, throat, etc. This is the illness of the body.

original: de la rgyas par dbye na nad kyi rnam grangs bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la rgyas par dbye na nad kyi rnam grangs bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: If it is classified in detail, there are four hundred and four types of illness.

original: yid kyi nad ni rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs las skyes pa'i sems las gnod pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi nad ni rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs las skyes pa'i sems las gnod pa ste /
translated: Mental illness is the harm to the mind that arises from various kinds of discursive thought.

original: de yang nang gi dngos po la dmigs pa las byung ba dang / phyi'i dngos po la dmigs pa las byung ba ste rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang nang gi dngos po la dmigs pa las byung ba dang / phyi'i dngos po la dmigs pa las byung ba ste rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: It is of two kinds: that which arises from focusing on internal things and that which arises from focusing on external things.

original: de la nang gi dngos po la dmigs pa las byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la nang gi dngos po la dmigs pa las byung ba ni /
translated: Of these, that which arises from focusing on internal things is

original: gang bdag gi lus nyid la dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: gang bdag gi lus nyid la dmigs pa ni /
translated: that which arises from focusing on one’s own body.

original: sems mi bde ba dang / nyon mongs pa skyes par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems mi bde ba dang / nyon mongs pa skyes par gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the arising of mental unhappiness and afflictions.

original: phyi'i dngos po la dmigs pa las byung ba ni /
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po la dmigs pa las byung ba ni /
translated: That which arises from focusing on external things is

original: nye du bshes gnyen dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan la rtog rtog pa las sems mi bde ba dang / nyon mongs pa skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nye du bshes gnyen dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan la rtog rtog pa las sems mi bde ba dang / nyon mongs pa skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: the arising of mental unhappiness and afflictions from thinking about relatives, friends, and the objects of desire.

original: de yang ming dang rgyu dang rten gyi sgo nas rnam pa du mar gzhag ste /
analyzed: de yang ming dang rgyu dang rten gyi sgo nas rnam pa du mar gzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, it is presented in many ways from the point of view of name, cause, and basis.

original: ming ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang khong khro ba dang phrag dog dang / khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug dang khong khro ba dang phrag dog dang / khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The names are desire, hatred, ignorance, anger, jealousy, and resentment.

original: rgyu ni mdzes pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / khong khro ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / de gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni mdzes pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / khong khro ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / de gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: The causes are the causes of beauty, the causes of anger, and the causes of neither.

original: rten ni gzugs la chags pa dang / sgra la chags pa dang / dri la chags pa dang / ro la @69b chags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rten ni gzugs la chags pa dang / sgra la chags pa dang / dri la chags pa dang / ro la @69b chags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The supports are attachment to form, attachment to sound, attachment to smell, attachment to taste, and so on.

original: 'dir ni lus kyi nad la bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni lus kyi nad la bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Here, however, the meaning is intended to be the sickness of the body.

original: ci'i phyir na sdug bsngal zhes bya zhe na 'di ltar nad 'dis zin na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na sdug bsngal zhes bya zhe na 'di ltar nad 'dis zin na /
translated: Why is it called suffering? Because when you are seized by this sickness,

original: bdag gi lus la rnam pa du mar mi bde ba skyed par byed pa dang / tshe'i dbang po'i bar chad du 'gyur ba dang / gnad du gnod pas nyen par byed pas na /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la rnam pa du mar mi bde ba skyed par byed pa dang / tshe'i dbang po'i bar chad du 'gyur ba dang / gnad du gnod pas nyen par byed pas na /
translated: it produces many kinds of discomfort in your body, it interrupts the life faculty, and it afflicts you with pain in your vital organs.

original: me dang dug dang mtshon lta bu yin pa'i phyir na sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: me dang dug dang mtshon lta bu yin pa'i phyir na sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is suffering because it is like fire, poison, or a weapon.

original: yang na nags mes tshig pa'i nang du chud pa'i mi dang dbang po la sogs pa me lce'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phog pa na mi bzod pas phan tshun du 'khyam zhing skad cher phyung nas du ba bzhin du na ba zhes bya ba sdug
analyzed: yang na nags mes tshig pa'i nang du chud pa'i mi dang dbang po la sogs pa me lce'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis phog pa na mi bzod pas phan tshun du 'khyam zhing skad cher phyung nas du ba bzhin du na ba zhes bya ba sdug
translated: Or, it is like a person who has entered a forest fire and is struck by various sufferings of the flames, and who, unable to bear them, wanders about and cries out with loud wails.

original: bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis phog pa na /
analyzed: bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis phog pa na /
translated: It is suffering because it is struck by the suffering of suffering.

original: skye bo rnams kyis mi bzod cing skad cher 'byin pa dang / ngu bar byed pa'i phyir na yang sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: skye bo rnams kyis mi bzod cing skad cher 'byin pa dang / ngu bar byed pa'i phyir na yang sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: It is suffering because people are unable to bear it and cry out with loud wails and weep.

original: 'chi ba sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'chi ba sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Death is suffering.

original: 'chi ba gang zhe na /🔽gang gong du sems can de dang de rnams /
analyzed: 'chi ba gang zhe na / gang gong du sems can de dang de rnams /
translated: What is death?

original: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag las shi 'phos pa dang shi 'phos par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris de dang de dag las shi 'phos pa dang shi 'phos par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the passing away of sentient beings from among the various sentient beings and the various classes of sentient beings.

original: zhes gang gsungs pa ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: This is death.

original: yang na tshe'i dbang po dang drod dang rnam par shes pas lus btang ste /
analyzed: yang na tshe'i dbang po dang drod dang rnam par shes pas lus btang ste /
translated: Or else, the life faculty, heat and consciousness abandon the body.

original: tshe'i dbang po rgyun chad pa ni /
analyzed: tshe'i dbang po rgyun chad pa ni /
translated: The cessation of the life faculty

original: 'chi ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is called death.

original: yang na sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po 'khrugs pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po nyams par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po 'khrugs pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po nyams par gyur pa'o //
translated: Or else, death is the degeneration of the faculties such as the eyes due to the disturbance of the great elements such as earth.

original: dbang po nyams na de la brten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po nyams na de la brten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi 'byung ngo //
translated: When the faculties degenerate, the mind and mental factors that depend on them do not arise.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba ma byung na shi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba ma byung na shi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind and mental factors do not arise, it is called death.

original: yang na 'chi ba rnam pa gnyis te /🔽tshe zad nas shi ba dang / las zad nas shi ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'chi ba rnam pa gnyis te / tshe zad nas shi ba dang / las zad nas shi ba'o //
translated: Or else, death is twofold:

original: de la tshe zad nas shi ba ni /
analyzed: de la tshe zad nas shi ba ni /
translated: death through the exhaustion of life and death through the exhaustion of karma.

original: tshe rabs gzhan na tshe'i 'du byed ji srid gnas par 'gyur ba'i las byas pa'i shugs zad nas shi ba'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan na tshe'i 'du byed ji srid gnas par 'gyur ba'i las byas pa'i shugs zad nas shi ba'o //
translated: Death through the exhaustion of life is death when the force of karma that creates the life-force for a certain period in another life is exhausted.

original: las zad nas shi ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyis las ma byas pas /
analyzed: las zad nas shi ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyis las ma byas pas /
translated: Death through the exhaustion of karma is death when one does not create karma through merit such as generosity.

original: tshe 'dir bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i yo byad dang mi ldan pas shi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'dir bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i yo byad dang mi ldan pas shi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: In this life, one dies because one is not provided with the necessities of life, such as food and drink.

original: yang na 'chi ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na 'chi ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or else, death is of three kinds:

original: skad cig ma re re la 'chi ba dang / rgyu zad nas 'chi ba dang / nye bar bcom nas 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la 'chi ba dang / rgyu zad nas 'chi ba dang / nye bar bcom nas 'chi ba'o //
translated: death at every moment, death through the exhaustion of causes, and death through the destruction of the proximate.

original: de la skad cig ma re re la 'chi ba ni /
analyzed: de la skad cig ma re re la 'chi ba ni /
translated: Death at every moment is the characteristic of the cessation of the previous moment and the arising of the subsequent moment,

original: dang po mngal du zhugs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dang po mngal du zhugs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning from the first moment of entering the womb,

original: ris mthun @70a * //🔽pa'i tshe'i 'du byed rgyun ma chad kyi bar du /🔽skad cig ma snga ma 'gags nas phyi ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ris mthun @70a * // pa'i tshe'i 'du byed rgyun ma chad kyi bar du / skad cig ma snga ma 'gags nas phyi ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: until the end of the class.

original: rgyu zad nas shi ba ni tshe'i 'du byed zad pas ris mthun pa'i phung po rnams kyi rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'o //🔽nye bar bcom nas shi ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu zad nas shi ba ni tshe'i 'du byed zad pas ris mthun pa'i phung po rnams kyi rgyun chad par 'gyur ba'o // nye bar bcom nas shi ba ni /
translated: Death through the exhaustion of causes is the cessation of the continuum of the aggregates of the same class due to the exhaustion of the formative forces of life.

original: dug dang me dang mtshon la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad nas shi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dug dang me dang mtshon la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad nas shi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Death through the destruction of the proximate is death through the destruction of the proximate by the conditions of poison, fire, weapons, etc.

original: ci'i phyir 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba /
translated: Why is death suffering?

original: 'di ltar la la zhig 'bru dang gter rin po che dang / yo byad dang nye du gnyen bshes la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar la la zhig 'bru dang gter rin po che dang / yo byad dang nye du gnyen bshes la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa las /
translated: In the same way, some people are endowed with a wealth of grain, treasures, jewels, possessions, relatives, friends, and so on.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa dbang yod pa rnams kyis 'phrog nas ci yang med par byas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa dbang yod pa rnams kyis 'phrog nas ci yang med par byas pa bzhin du /
translated: But then the powerful, such as the king, take it all away and leave them with nothing.

original: 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe nye du gnyen bshes bral bar dga' ba rnams kyis mtha' bskor nas mig mchi mas bkang zhing dud mos skad 'gag par 'gyur ba dang / nor dang gter la sogs pa'i yo byad thams cad bor nas gcig pu mi dga' ba ma mos bzhin du dbang med par 'gro dgos pa'i phyir yang 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe nye du gnyen bshes bral bar dga' ba rnams kyis mtha' bskor nas mig mchi mas bkang zhing dud mos skad 'gag par 'gyur ba dang / nor dang gter la sogs pa'i yo byad thams cad bor nas gcig pu mi dga' ba ma mos bzhin du dbang med par 'gro dgos pa'i phyir yang 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: In the same way, when the time of death arrives, one is surrounded by one’s weeping relatives and friends, whose eyes are full of tears and voices choked with sobs. One must leave behind all one’s possessions, such as wealth and treasures, and go alone, against one’s will, in a state of misery and despair.

original: yang na bsod nams ma yin pa byas pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga 'gag pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa myong la /
analyzed: yang na bsod nams ma yin pa byas pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga 'gag pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa myong la /
translated: Or else, those who have committed nonvirtuous actions experience the unbearable suffering of the five senses being shut down.

original: gshin rje'i srin po dang / yi dags la sogs pas mtha' bskor te /🔽tshe'i dbang po ma chad par yang bcing ba dang / bsdigs pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: gshin rje'i srin po dang / yi dags la sogs pas mtha' bskor te / tshe'i dbang po ma chad par yang bcing ba dang / bsdigs pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal skyed par byed cing /
translated: Yama's demons, hungry ghosts, and so forth surround you.🔽Even though your life force is not severed, they bind you, threaten you, and so forth, producing suffering.

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po chad nas kyang dbang med par sems can dmyal ba'i gnas su 'khrid par byed pa'i phyir yang 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po chad nas kyang dbang med par sems can dmyal ba'i gnas su 'khrid par byed pa'i phyir yang 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: And when your life force is severed, they lead you helplessly to the place of the hell beings.

original: yang na 'chi ba zhes bya ba 'di ri rab bzhin du rlung gis kyang mi bskyod pa /
analyzed: yang na 'chi ba zhes bya ba 'di ri rab bzhin du rlung gis kyang mi bskyod pa /
translated: Or, death is like Mount Meru, unshaken even by the wind.

original: me bzhin du thams cad zad par byed pa /
analyzed: me bzhin du thams cad zad par byed pa /
translated: Like fire, it consumes everything.

original: zhe sdang can gyis skyes bu bzhin du rtag tu 'gro ba rnams la gnod pas gdung bar byed pa /
analyzed: zhe sdang can gyis skyes bu bzhin du rtag tu 'gro ba rnams la gnod pas gdung bar byed pa /
translated: Like a hateful person, it always torments beings with harm.

original: rgya mtsho'i rlabs bzhin du dus las mi 'da' ba /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i rlabs bzhin du dus las mi 'da' ba /
translated: Like the waves of the ocean, it does not pass beyond the proper time.

original: rdo rje bzhin du phung po'i ri bo 'joms par byed pa /
analyzed: rdo rje bzhin du phung po'i ri bo 'joms par byed pa /
translated: Like a diamond, it destroys the mountain of the aggregates.

original: rlung lta bur spungs pa rnams snyil bar byed pa /
analyzed: rlung lta bur spungs pa rnams snyil bar byed pa /
translated: Like the wind, it disperses the heaps.

original: ser ba bzhin du tshe'i 'du byed 'jig par byed pa /
analyzed: ser ba bzhin du tshe'i 'du byed 'jig par byed pa /
translated: It destroys the life force like hail.

original: sdig can bzhin du snying rje med pa /
analyzed: sdig can bzhin du snying rje med pa /
translated: It is merciless like a criminal.

original: glang po che bzhin du rgyal bar dka' ba /
analyzed: glang po che bzhin du rgyal bar dka' ba /
translated: It is difficult to conquer like an elephant.

original: dpa' bo bzhin du gzhan 'joms pa /
analyzed: dpa' bo bzhin du gzhan 'joms pa /
translated: It destroys others like a hero.

original: dus bzhin @70b du gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dus bzhin @70b du gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ste /
translated: It certainly occurs like time.

original: de'i phyir 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, death is suffering.

original: mdo gzhan dag las skye ba'i rkyen gyis 'chi ba dang / bag med pas 'chi ba dang / tshul khrims ngan pas 'chi ba zhes gsungs pa de dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /🔽smras pa / shes rab kyi dbang po 'chal bas na /
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las skye ba'i rkyen gyis 'chi ba dang / bag med pas 'chi ba dang / tshul khrims ngan pas 'chi ba zhes gsungs pa de dag la khyad par ci yod ce na / smras pa / shes rab kyi dbang po 'chal bas na /
translated: What is the difference between the death that is taught in other sūtras as having the conditions of birth, the death that is heedless, and the death that is immoral?🔽It is said:

original: bag med pas 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: bag med pas 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death that is heedless is due to the impairment of the faculty of wisdom.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang bral ba'i phyir tshul khrims ngan pas shi ba'o //🔽tshe'i dbang po rgyun chad pas na /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang bral ba'i phyir tshul khrims ngan pas shi ba'o // tshe'i dbang po rgyun chad pas na /
translated: Death that is immoral is due to the absence of pure morality.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis shi ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis shi ba'o //
translated: Death that has the condition of birth is due to the interruption of the life faculty.

original: yang na dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / sgom pa mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / sgom pa mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: or because one does not listen to, reflect on, and cultivate the holy Dharma.

original: bag med pas 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: bag med pas 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death through negligence.

original: dge slong gi dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dge slong gi dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Death through the loss of the state of a monk.

original: tshul khrims ngan pas shi ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pas shi ba'o //
translated: Death through bad morality.

original: ris mthun pa dang skal ba gcig pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ris mthun pa dang skal ba gcig pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Death through the loss of a life-stream of the same type and the same destiny.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis shi ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis shi ba'o //
translated: Death through the condition of birth.

original: mdza' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdza' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The suffering of being separated from what one loves.

original: gang sems can gyi grangs sam sems can ma yin pa'i grangs su gtogs pa'i yul yid du 'ong ba rnams dang bral bar gyur ba ni mdza' ba dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems can gyi grangs sam sems can ma yin pa'i grangs su gtogs pa'i yul yid du 'ong ba rnams dang bral bar gyur ba ni mdza' ba dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one is separated from the pleasant objects that are included in the class of sentient beings or the class of insentient things, that is called being separated from what one loves.

original: yang na bdag nyid kyi lang tsho dang / nad med pa dang tshe ring ba dang / rigs dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / phyug pa dang / longs spyod dang bral bar gyur ba dang / nye du gnyen bshes rnams dang bye ba gyur ba ni /
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid kyi lang tsho dang / nad med pa dang tshe ring ba dang / rigs dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / phyug pa dang / longs spyod dang bral bar gyur ba dang / nye du gnyen bshes rnams dang bye ba gyur ba ni /
translated: Or else, when one is separated from one's own youth, health, long life, good family, good appearance, wealth, and enjoyments, and when one is separated from one's relatives and friends,

original: mdza' ba dang bral bar gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdza' ba dang bral bar gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “Separation from what is dear” means to be separated from what is dear.

original: yang na tshul khrims can rnams dge ba'i las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni mdza' ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims can rnams dge ba'i las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni mdza' ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Or, for those who have moral discipline, it means to lose the wholesome action that is dear.

original: yang na tshor ba rnam pa gsum las bde ba'i tshor ba dang bral bar gyur pa ni mdza' ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yang na tshor ba rnam pa gsum las bde ba'i tshor ba dang bral bar gyur pa ni mdza' ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Or, among the three kinds of feeling, it means to be separated from the feeling of pleasure that is dear.

original: yang na lha dang mi la sogs pa bde 'gro'i gnas nas nyams nas /
analyzed: yang na lha dang mi la sogs pa bde 'gro'i gnas nas nyams nas /
translated: Or, it means to fall from the happy realms of gods and humans,

original: ngan song du ltung bar gyur ba ni mdza' ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ngan song du ltung bar gyur ba ni mdza' ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: and to fall into the lower realms.

original: ci'i phyir / mdza' ba dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / mdza' ba dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba zhe na /
translated: Why is separation from what is dear suffering?

original: 'di ltar mdza' ba dang bral ba'i rgyus srog chags rnams nags mes tshig pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdza' ba dang bral ba'i rgyus srog chags rnams nags mes tshig pa bzhin du /
translated: Because, when separated from what is dear, beings are like those burned by a forest fire.

original: rtag tu mya ngan chen po'i mes yid kyi sreg par byed cing skad cher 'byin cing ngu bas na /
analyzed: rtag tu mya ngan chen po'i mes yid kyi sreg par byed cing skad cher 'byin cing ngu bas na /
translated: The fire of great grief always burns their minds, and they cry out and weep.

original: mdza' ba dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mdza' ba dang bral ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, separation from what is dear is suffering.

original: yang na mtho ris la sogs pa bde ba'i gnas nas 'phos te /🔽dmyal @71a * //
analyzed: yang na mtho ris la sogs pa bde ba'i gnas nas 'phos te / dmyal @71a * //
translated: Or, having fallen from a happy state, such as a higher realm,

original: ba la sogs ngan song gi gnas na skyes pas na /
analyzed: ba la sogs ngan song gi gnas na skyes pas na /
translated: one is born in a miserable realm, such as a hell realm.

original: sdug bsngal sna tshogs myong bar 'gyur pa'i phyir mdza' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs myong bar 'gyur pa'i phyir mdza' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Thus, one experiences various kinds of suffering.

original: yang na mdza' ba dang bral bar dogs pa'am /
analyzed: yang na mdza' ba dang bral bar dogs pa'am /
translated: Or, one is afraid of being separated from one’s loved ones,

original: thos pa'am / mthong ba'am /
analyzed: thos pa'am / mthong ba'am /
translated: or one hears about, sees,🔽or remembers the separation from one’s loved ones.

original: rjes su dran na yang mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dran na yang mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, one experiences grief, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and anxiety.

original: yang mdza' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: yang mdza' ba dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Thus, there is the suffering of being separated from one’s loved ones.

original: yang na pha dang phu nu la sogs pa nye du dang bral ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i gdon gyis gnod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na pha dang phu nu la sogs pa nye du dang bral ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i gdon gyis gnod pa bzhin du /
translated: Or, like being afflicted by a demon, one is separated from one’s relatives, such as one’s father, brothers, and so on.

original: tshig rnam pa sna tshogs bla ba dang brgyal ba bzhin du dran pa med par gyur pa dang / bdog pa thams cad 'phog pa bzhin du /
analyzed: tshig rnam pa sna tshogs bla ba dang brgyal ba bzhin du dran pa med par gyur pa dang / bdog pa thams cad 'phog pa bzhin du /
translated: Thus, one is confused, one faints, one loses one’s memory, and one is as if robbed of everything one has.

original: sems can rnam pa thams cad du 'khrug par gyur cing bya ba dang mi bya ba thams cad mi dran pas lus sa la glebs tsam du zad pa'i phyir yang mdza' ba dang bral ba'i phyir yang sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnam pa thams cad du 'khrug par gyur cing bya ba dang mi bya ba thams cad mi dran pas lus sa la glebs tsam du zad pa'i phyir yang mdza' ba dang bral ba'i phyir yang sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: It is suffering to be separated from what is dear because of the suffering of being separated from what is dear, and because of the suffering of being separated from the Dharma.

original: mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba la mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu /🔽sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa dang phrad par gyur pa ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'o //
analyzed: mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba la mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu / sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa dang phrad par gyur pa ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'o //
translated: The suffering of encountering what is not dear is the suffering of encountering the hells, etc., which are the results of the evolution of unwholesome actions.

original: sems can thams cad bde ba 'dod la sdug bsngal dang bral bar mos pa las sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skyes par byed pa'i yo byad nye bar gyur ba'i rgyur tshor ba sdug bsngal ba myong ba ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'o //🔽yang na 'gro ba mi bgrungs pa dang 'grogs par gyur ba ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde ba 'dod la sdug bsngal dang bral bar mos pa las sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skyes par byed pa'i yo byad nye bar gyur ba'i rgyur tshor ba sdug bsngal ba myong ba ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'o //🔽yang na 'gro ba mi bgrungs pa dang 'grogs par gyur ba ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'o //
translated: The suffering of not obtaining what one longs for is the experience of painful feelings, which is the cause for the occurrence of the suffering of the feelings in all sentient beings who are intent on the cessation of suffering and the attainment of happiness, but who are subject to the occurrence of painful feelings.🔽Or, the suffering of not obtaining what one longs for is the suffering of encountering the wicked, who are the cause for the occurrence of the suffering of the feelings in all sentient beings who are intent on the cessation of suffering and the attainment of happiness, but who are subject to the occurrence of painful feelings.🔽The suffering of the five aggregates is the suffering of the five aggregates of clinging, because they are the basis of suffering.

original: yang na tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la /
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams la /
translated: Or else, it is the meeting with those who are immoral.

original: ngan ba'i ngang tshul byung bar gyur ba ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa ste /
analyzed: ngan ba'i ngang tshul byung bar gyur ba ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa ste /
translated: The meeting with those who are immoral is suffering because it is the meeting with those who are not friends.

original: kha na ma tho ba phra mo la yang 'jigs par lta ba rnams nyes pa des sems gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba phra mo la yang 'jigs par lta ba rnams nyes pa des sems gdung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who see danger in even the slightest fault are tormented by that fault.

original: ci'i phyir mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa sdug bsngal zhes bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa sdug bsngal zhes bya /
translated: Why is the meeting with those who are not friends suffering?

original: 'di khyim mtshes mi bgrungs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di khyim mtshes mi bgrungs pa bzhin du /
translated: Because it is like having an unvirtuous neighbor.

original: rtag tu gnod pa skyed pa dang / 'gro ba mi srun pa bzhin du zhe sdang skye ba'i gnas su gyur pa dang / sems la mi dga' ba'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir mi mdza' ba dang phrad par sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu gnod pa skyed pa dang / 'gro ba mi srun pa bzhin du zhe sdang skye ba'i gnas su gyur pa dang / sems la mi dga' ba'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir mi mdza' ba dang phrad par sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The meeting with those who are not friends is suffering because it is the cause of the arising of hostility, like meeting with a wicked person, and because it is the cause of the arising of thoughts that are unpleasant to the mind.

original: yang na mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'i rgyu las nags mes tshig pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'i rgyu las nags mes tshig pa bzhin du /
translated: Or else, the meeting with those who are not friends is suffering because it is the cause of the meeting with those who are not friends, like a forest that is burned by a forest fire.

original: zhe sdang gi @71b mes sems tshig par byed cing de dang bral ba smon pa mang du skye ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi @71b mes sems tshig par byed cing de dang bral ba smon pa mang du skye ste /
translated: The fire of hatred burns the mind and one frequently wishes to be separated from it.

original: gang smos pa mang du skyed pa de nyid sdug bsngal ba yin pas de bas na ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang smos pa mang du skyed pa de nyid sdug bsngal ba yin pas de bas na ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Since that which is frequently wished for arises, it is suffering. Therefore, meeting with what is unpleasant is suffering.

original: gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which is sought after and not obtained is also suffering.

original: gang 'dod pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang ma bral zhing slar mi phrod pa dang / bde ba dang phrad cing slar mi bral bar 'dod de de ltar ma gyur ba nyid gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa ni sdug bsngal ba dang ma bral zhing slar mi phrod pa dang / bde ba dang phrad cing slar mi bral bar 'dod de de ltar ma gyur ba nyid gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa'o //
translated: That which is sought after is not being separated from suffering and not being united with happiness, but it is just the opposite. That which is sought after and not obtained is not being united with happiness.

original: yang na skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa dang mi phrad par 'dod de /
analyzed: yang na skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa dang mi phrad par 'dod de /
translated: Or, one seeks to not meet with birth, old age, sickness, death, and so on.

original: 'dod pa de dang mi ldan par gyur pa ni gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa de dang mi ldan par gyur pa ni gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-possession of that which is sought after is called that which is sought after and not obtained.

original: yang na mi mdza' ba dang mi phrad pa dang / mdza' ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod de /
analyzed: yang na mi mdza' ba dang mi phrad pa dang / mdza' ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod de /
translated: Or else, one desires not to encounter what is not agreeable and to encounter what is agreeable.

original: de ltar ma grub pa ni gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma grub pa ni gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When this does not happen, it is called “the search for what one desires and not finding it.”

original: yang na dge ba byed pa rnams 'phel bar ni 'dod la /
analyzed: yang na dge ba byed pa rnams 'phel bar ni 'dod la /
translated: Or else, one desires that the virtuous should prosper🔽and that the non-virtuous should be obscured.

original: mi dge ba sgrib par 'dod pa las dge ba sgrib pa dang / mi dge ba 'phel bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba sgrib par 'dod pa las dge ba sgrib pa dang / mi dge ba 'phel bar gyur pa ni /
translated: When the virtuous are obscured and the non-virtuous prosper,

original: gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “the search for what one desires and not finding it.”

original: yang na ngan song gsum du mi skye ba dang / mtho ris su skye bar 'dod pa las /
analyzed: yang na ngan song gsum du mi skye ba dang / mtho ris su skye bar 'dod pa las /
translated: Or else, one desires not to be born in the three unfortunate realms and to be born in the fortunate realms.

original: ngan song gsum du ltung bar gyur la /
analyzed: ngan song gsum du ltung bar gyur la /
translated: When one falls into the three unfortunate realms

original: mtho ris su ma skyes par gyur pa ni gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtho ris su ma skyes par gyur pa ni gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and is not born in the fortunate realms, it is called “the search for what one desires and not finding it.”

original: ci'i phyir gang 'dod pa de btsal nas ma rnyed pa de sdug bsngal zhes bya ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang 'dod pa de btsal nas ma rnyed pa de sdug bsngal zhes bya ba zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the search for what one desires and not finding it is suffering?

original: ae ma'o // 'di ltar 'dod pa'i dngos po de ltar sngon yang rnyed par ma gyur to //
analyzed: ae ma'o // 'di ltar 'dod pa'i dngos po de ltar sngon yang rnyed par ma gyur to //
translated: Alas! In this way, one did not obtain in the past the desired thing.

original: da ltar yang ma rnyed do //
analyzed: da ltar yang ma rnyed do //
translated: It is not found now.🔽It will not be found in the future.

original: phyis kyang rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes dus gsum du yang gnod pa skyes pa'i phyir gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa de sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: phyis kyang rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes dus gsum du yang gnod pa skyes pa'i phyir gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa de sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is suffering when one seeks and does not find what one desires, because of the occurrence of harm in the three times.

original: yang na yid la bsam pa 'joms par byed pa dang / yid 'byung ba'i rten du gyur pa dang / de'i rgyu sems rtag tu gdung bar byed pas na yang gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: yang na yid la bsam pa 'joms par byed pa dang / yid 'byung ba'i rten du gyur pa dang / de'i rgyu sems rtag tu gdung bar byed pas na yang gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is suffering when one seeks and does not find what one desires, because it destroys what is thought in the mind, it is the basis for the occurrence of distress, and it constantly torments the mind, which is the cause of that distress.

original: mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni sdug bsngal ba ste /🔽zhes bya ba la len pa'i phung po lnga ni /🔽gzugs len pa'i phung po nas /
analyzed: mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni sdug bsngal ba ste / zhes bya ba la len pa'i phung po lnga ni / gzugs len pa'i phung po nas /
translated: In brief, the five appropriated aggregates are suffering.

original: rnam par shes pa len pa'i phung po'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa len pa'i phung po'i bar du'o //
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are the appropriated aggregate of form, up to the appropriated aggregate of consciousness.

original: mdor na zhes bya ba'i don du phung po lnga por sdug bsngal ba thams cad @72a * //🔽bsdus par ston pa ste /
analyzed: mdor na zhes bya ba'i don du phung po lnga por sdug bsngal ba thams cad @72a * //🔽bsdus par ston pa ste /
translated: In brief, the five aggregates are taught to include all suffering.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ni dang po'i sdug bsngal dang / dbus kyi sdug bsngal dang / mtha'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ni dang po'i sdug bsngal dang / dbus kyi sdug bsngal dang / mtha'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: All suffering is suffering of the first kind, suffering of the second kind, and suffering of the third kind.

original: de la dang po'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba'o //🔽bar gyi sdug bsngal ni rga ba dang / na ba dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba dang mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang / gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la dang po'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba'o // bar gyi sdug bsngal ni rga ba dang / na ba dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba dang mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang / gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa rnams so //
translated: The suffering of the first kind is birth.🔽The suffering of the second kind is aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish.

original: tha ma'i sdug bsngal ni 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: tha ma'i sdug bsngal ni 'chi ba ste /
translated: The suffering of the third kind is the suffering of the five aggregates of clinging.

original: sdug bsngal de gsum phung po lngar 'dus pa na mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de gsum phung po lngar 'dus pa na mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When these three kinds of suffering are included in the five aggregates, in brief, the five aggregates of clinging are called suffering.

original: yang na rab tu gnas pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa'i sdug bsngal rnams su phung po lnga 'dus pas na /
analyzed: yang na rab tu gnas pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa'i sdug bsngal rnams su phung po lnga 'dus pas na /
translated: Or else, the five aggregates of clinging are called suffering because the five aggregates are included in the suffering of the five aggregates of clinging, which are the suffering of the present and the suffering of the future.

original: mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: In brief, the five aggregates of clinging are called suffering.

original: rab tu gnas pa'i sdug bsngal ni rga ba dang / na ba dang 'chi ba dang mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang / gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa'i sdug bsngal ni rga ba dang / na ba dang 'chi ba dang mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang / gang 'dod pa btsal nas ma rnyed pa'o //
translated: The suffering of change is aging, sickness, death, separation from what is pleasant, association with what is unpleasant, and not obtaining what is desired despite seeking it.

original: rjes su 'brel ba'i sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel ba'i sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba ste /
translated: The suffering of the formative forces is the suffering of birth.

original: tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu srid pa'i yan lag mtshams sbyor ba rnams dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu srid pa'i yan lag mtshams sbyor ba rnams dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the suffering of birth that connects the various stages of existence from one life to another.

original: yang na sdug bsngal gyi khyad par ni tshad med pa bskal ba'i mthar brjod kyang zad par mi nus te /
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal gyi khyad par ni tshad med pa bskal ba'i mthar brjod kyang zad par mi nus te /
translated: Or else, the specific forms of suffering are immeasurable, and it would be impossible to describe them all even in the course of many eons.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i sdug bsngal mtha' med pa rnams spyi'i mtshan nyid du bsdu bar bya ba'i don du mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i sdug bsngal mtha' med pa rnams spyi'i mtshan nyid du bsdu bar bya ba'i don du mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in order to include the limitless forms of suffering that have different characteristics within a general characteristic, it is stated in brief: “The five acquired aggregates are suffering.

original: yang na me lta bur gyur pa ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams so //
analyzed: yang na me lta bur gyur pa ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams so //
translated: Or else, the suffering of birth, etc. are like a fire.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i rgyu shing lta bur gyur pa ni len pa'i phung po lnga yin te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i rgyu shing lta bur gyur pa ni len pa'i phung po lnga yin te /
translated: The five aggregates of grasping are the cause of suffering such as birth, like a tree.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu byed pa'i phyir na yang mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni sdug bsngal zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu byed pa'i phyir na yang mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga rnams ni sdug bsngal zhes gsungs so //
translated: In brief, the five aggregates of grasping are suffering because they are the cause of all suffering.

original: yang na skye ba la sogs pa ni sa bon gyi dngos po lta bu la len pa'i phung po lnga ni zhing lta bu yin par gyur pas de'i phyir yang mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na skye ba la sogs pa ni sa bon gyi dngos po lta bu la len pa'i phung po lnga ni zhing lta bu yin par gyur pas de'i phyir yang mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Alternatively, birth, etc., are like the entity of a seed, and the five aggregates of grasping are like a field. Therefore, in brief, the five aggregates of grasping are called suffering, etc.

original: ji lta zhe na phung po 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na phung po 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba'o //
translated: How so? The suffering of the arising of the aggregates is birth.

original: phung po yongs su smin pa'i sdug bsngal ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: phung po yongs su smin pa'i sdug bsngal ni rga ba'o //
translated: The suffering of the ripening of the aggregates is aging.

original: phung po la gnod pa'i sdug bsngal ni na @72b ba'o //
analyzed: phung po la gnod pa'i sdug bsngal ni na @72b ba'o //
translated: The suffering of harm to the aggregates is sickness.

original: phung po zhig pa'i sdug bsngal ni shi ba'o //
analyzed: phung po zhig pa'i sdug bsngal ni shi ba'o //
translated: The suffering of the disintegration of the aggregates is death.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba'i phung po dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'o //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba'i phung po dang phrad pa'i sdug bsngal ni mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'o //
translated: The suffering of encountering what is unpleasant is encountering what is not dear.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i phung po dang bye ba'i sdug bsngal ni mdza' ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i phung po dang bye ba'i sdug bsngal ni mdza' ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: The suffering of separation from what is pleasant is separation from what is dear.

original: 'dod pa'i phung po dang ma phrad pa'i sdug bsngal ni gang 'dod pa brtsal nas ma rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phung po dang ma phrad pa'i sdug bsngal ni gang 'dod pa brtsal nas ma rnyed pa'o //
translated: The suffering of not obtaining what one longs for is not obtaining what one longs for even though one seeks it.

original: ci'i phyir na len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba /
translated: Why are the five appropriated aggregates called suffering?

original: smras pa ji srid du las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i phung po lnga yid kyi bar du /
analyzed: smras pa ji srid du las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i phung po lnga yid kyi bar du /
translated: It is said: As long as the five aggregates generated by karma and afflictions, up to the mind,

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang / gang 'dod pa brtsal nas ma rnyed pa dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa dang / gang 'dod pa brtsal nas ma rnyed pa dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang /
translated: arise, so long do birth, aging, sickness, death, separation from the dear, encountering the undear, not obtaining what one longs for even though one seeks it, sorrow, lamentation,

original: yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: mental dissatisfaction, and disturbance occur.

original: len pa'i phung po lnga rnams sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: len pa'i phung po lnga rnams sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The five aggregates appropriated are suffering.

original: brgal ba bcom ldan 'das kyis tshor ba rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: brgal ba bcom ldan 'das kyis tshor ba rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: Objection: The Fortunate One has said that there are three types of sensation,

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gsungs te /
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i phung po rnams sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin ma yin na /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i phung po rnams sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin ma yin na /
translated: Now, the aggregates of pleasant and neither unpleasant nor pleasant sensation are not suffering by nature.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga rnams sdug bsngal zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga rnams sdug bsngal zhes gsungs /
translated: Why did the Fortunate One say: In brief, the five aggregates of attachment are suffering?

original: lan du sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis 'dus byas thams cad la khyab pas na /
analyzed: lan du sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis 'dus byas thams cad la khyab pas na /
translated: Reply: Because all conditioned things are pervaded by the three types of suffering.

original: len pa'i phung po thams cad sdug bsngal bar bshad do //
analyzed: len pa'i phung po thams cad sdug bsngal bar bshad do //
translated: All the aggregates of attachment are suffering.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab pa'o //
translated: The aggregates associated with unpleasant sensation are suffering as suffering.

original: tshor ba bde ba dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba dang ldan pa'i phung po rnams la ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab pa'o //
translated: The aggregates associated with pleasant feeling are pervaded by the suffering of change.

original: tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin mi bde ba yang ma yin pa'i phung po rnams la ni rgyu rkyen gyis bskyed cing mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid 'du byed sdug bsngal gyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba yang ma yin mi bde ba yang ma yin pa'i phung po rnams la ni rgyu rkyen gyis bskyed cing mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid 'du byed sdug bsngal gyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates associated with neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling are pervaded by the suffering of the formative forces, since they are generated by causes and conditions and are impermanent.

original: yang na dper na sran ma sha'i phung po'i nang na mungga cung zad yod kyang /
analyzed: yang na dper na sran ma sha'i phung po'i nang na mungga cung zad yod kyang /
translated: Or, just as a small amount of mung bean in a pile of kidney beans is called “kidney beans,”

original: sran ma sha zhes bya ba bzhin du phung po 'di dag la bde ba cung zad yod kyang /
analyzed: sran ma sha zhes bya ba bzhin du phung po 'di dag la bde ba cung zad yod kyang /
translated: so too, although there is a small amount of pleasure in these aggregates,

original: sdug bsngal mang po'i phyir phung po thams cad sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //🔽gzhan @73a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po'i phyir phung po thams cad sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o // gzhan @73a * //
translated: because of the great amount of suffering, all the aggregates are called “suffering.”🔽Moreover, what wise person would consider a grain of rice to be pleasant because of a small amount of pleasure, which is like the oil in a mustard seed or the water in a rock,

original: yang mkhas pa su zhig 'bras byung ba'i sdug bsngal chen po yungs mar gyis bsdu ba dang phug pa tsam gyis bde bas 'bras bde zhes brtsi ste /
analyzed: yang mkhas pa su zhig 'bras byung ba'i sdug bsngal chen po yungs mar gyis bsdu ba dang phug pa tsam gyis bde bas 'bras bde zhes brtsi ste /
translated: when it is pervaded by the great suffering of its origin?

original: de dang 'dra bar lnga phung sdug bsngal gyi phung po la bde ba cung zad kyang yod pas mkhas pa su zhig bde bar lta /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar lnga phung sdug bsngal gyi phung po la bde ba cung zad kyang yod pas mkhas pa su zhig bde bar lta /
translated: Likewise, since there is not the slightest pleasure in the suffering aggregate of the five aggregates, what wise person would view it as pleasure?

original: mdo gzhan dag las sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum du bshad la /
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum du bshad la /
translated: In other sūtras, three types of suffering are explained.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad du gsungs na /🔽ci gsum gyis brgyad bsdu bar blta ba'am /
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad du gsungs na / ci gsum gyis brgyad bsdu bar blta ba'am /
translated: Here, eight types of suffering are mentioned.🔽Should the three be viewed as subsumed within the eight,

original: brgyad kyis gsum bsdu bar blta ba'am /
analyzed: brgyad kyis gsum bsdu bar blta ba'am /
translated: or should the eight be viewed as subsumed within the three?

original: smras pa gsum gyis brgyad bsdu bar blta ste /
analyzed: smras pa gsum gyis brgyad bsdu bar blta ste /
translated: It is said that the three should be viewed as subsumed within the eight.

original: gang skye ba sdug bsngal ba dang / rga ba sdug bsngal ba dang / na ba sdug bsngal ba dang / 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal bar bsdu'o //
analyzed: gang skye ba sdug bsngal ba dang / rga ba sdug bsngal ba dang / na ba sdug bsngal ba dang / 'chi ba sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa sdug bsngal ba rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal bar bsdu'o //
translated: Birth is suffering, aging is suffering, sickness is suffering, death is suffering, and encountering what is unpleasant is suffering. These are subsumed within the suffering of suffering.

original: gang mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa gnyis ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal du bsdu'o //
analyzed: gang mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa btsal te ma rnyed pa gnyis ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal du bsdu'o //
translated: Separation from what is pleasant and not obtaining what one desires are subsumed within the suffering of change.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bas /
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bas /
translated: In brief, the five appropriated aggregates are suffering.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal bstan to //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal bstan to //
translated: This teaches the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the truth of origin,

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: it says, “What is the truth of the origin of suffering?”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so forth.

original: ci'i phyir na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rjes la kun 'byung gi bden pa bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rjes la kun 'byung gi bden pa bshad ce na /
translated: Why is the truth of origin taught after the truth of suffering?

original: 'khor ba'i 'bras bu'i chos khong du ma chud pa rnams la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'bras bu'i chos khong du ma chud pa rnams la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan nas /
translated: Those who have not understood the phenomena that are the effects of cyclic existence are taught the truth of suffering.

original: rgyu khong du ma chud pa rnams la rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu khong du ma chud pa rnams la rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach its cause to those who have not understood it,

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'og tu kun 'byung gi bden pa bshad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'og tu kun 'byung gi bden pa bshad do //
translated: the truth of origin is taught after the truth of suffering.

original: yang na 'jig rten pa'i 'di dag ni srid pa'i bcing ba dam pos dam du bcings pa dang / 'khor ba'i brtson ra las thar bar ma gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten pa'i 'di dag ni srid pa'i bcing ba dam pos dam du bcings pa dang / 'khor ba'i brtson ra las thar bar ma gyur pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, worldly beings are tightly bound by the tight fetters of existence and have not been liberated from the prison of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i brtson ra'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi 'og tu kun 'byung gi bden pa gsungs so /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i brtson ra'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi 'og tu kun 'byung gi bden pa gsungs so /
translated: The truth of origination is taught after the truth of suffering in order to show the cause of the prison of cyclic existence.

original: sred pa'i phung po gang las sdug bsngal gyi phung po kun 'byung zhing skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid sred pa la sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i phung po gang las sdug bsngal gyi phung po kun 'byung zhing skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid sred pa la sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The truth of origination is craving, which has the characteristic of attachment, because the mass of suffering originates and arises from the mass of craving.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sred pa de sdug bsngal @73b gyi rgyu yin par 'phags pa rnams kyi thugs su chud pa'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to // sred pa de sdug bsngal @73b gyi rgyu yin par 'phags pa rnams kyi thugs su chud pa'am /
translated: It is the cause of suffering.🔽The noble ones understand that craving is the cause of suffering.

original: sred pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin zhes khong du chud nas 'phags par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sred pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin zhes khong du chud nas 'phags par 'gyur la /
translated: Or, having understood that craving is the cause of suffering, one becomes an ārya.

original: sred pa de yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin par ma nor ba'i phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa de yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin par ma nor ba'i phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because that craving is the cause of suffering, it is unmistaken and nonerroneous, and therefore it is called the noble truth of the origin of suffering.

original: sred pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that craving?

original: de'i phyir / gang yang 'byung ba can gyi sred pa dag pa'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de yang der mngon par dga' ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang yang 'byung ba can gyi sred pa dag pa'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa de yang der mngon par dga' ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, craving that is accompanied by attachment to arising is called delighting in that.

original: dper na skyes bu la la zhig dpyid kyi dus kyi tshe nyi ma phyed pa'i tshe na rab tu skom pas gdungs te /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu la la zhig dpyid kyi dus kyi tshe nyi ma phyed pa'i tshe na rab tu skom pas gdungs te /
translated: For example, a certain man, tormented by intense thirst in the heat of summer,

original: chu 'dod pa des tsha chu la rgyun du 'thungs kyang ngoms pa med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: chu 'dod pa des tsha chu la rgyun du 'thungs kyang ngoms pa med pa bzhin du /
translated: drinks continuously salty water but is not satisfied.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags can rnams lus dang longs spyod yon tan du blta bas srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad la rgyun du spyod kyang ngoms pa med pa ni srid pa'o //🔽yang 'byung ba can dang dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i tshig rnams ni sred pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags can rnams lus dang longs spyod yon tan du blta bas srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad la rgyun du spyod kyang ngoms pa med pa ni srid pa'o // yang 'byung ba can dang dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang de dang der mngon par dga' ba'i tshig rnams ni sred pa /
translated: Similarly, those who are attached to sense objects are not satisfied by continuously using existence and the necessities of existence, because they view the body and possessions as virtues.🔽Craving is accompanied by arising, is associated with attachment to delight, and delights in this and that.

original: de'i khyad par ram sred pa'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ram sred pa'i ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: These terms are synonyms for craving.

original: de la yang 'byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i tshe rabs la bya ste /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i tshe rabs bsgrub pa'i ngang tshul can nam //
analyzed: de la yang 'byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i tshe rabs la bya ste / ma 'ongs pa'i tshe rabs bsgrub pa'i ngang tshul can nam //
translated: The future is called arising because it is the future birth.🔽Or it is the nature of establishing the future birth.
