original: de skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nam rgyur gyur pa la yang 'byung ba zhes bya'o //🔽dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i lus dang longs spyod la chags shing /
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin nam rgyur gyur pa la yang 'byung ba zhes bya'o // dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni / ma 'ongs pa'i lus dang longs spyod la chags shing /
translated: Or it is the cause that generates it.🔽Possessed of attachment to pleasure means that it is the nature of attachment to future bodies and enjoyments.

original: zhen pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhen pa'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it is the nature of attachment to future bodies and enjoyments.

original: de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyis gnas rnam pa mang po la bdag lhar gyur cig mir gyur cig / tshangs par gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i smon lam 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyis gnas rnam pa mang po la bdag lhar gyur cig mir gyur cig / tshangs par gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i smon lam 'debs pa'o //
translated: Delighting in this and that means that sentient beings of the future make aspirations such as, May I become a god, may I become a human, may I become Brahma and so on, aspiring to many different states of existence.

original: yang na ma rnyed pa'i yul tshol ba dang sogs pa'i rgyu gyur pa'i sred pa ni yang 'byung ba can gyis sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ma rnyed pa'i yul tshol ba dang sogs pa'i rgyu gyur pa'i sred pa ni yang 'byung ba can gyis sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or craving that is the cause of seeking for a not yet obtained object and so on is called craving for future existence.

original: rnyed cing phrad pa'i yul la lhag par dmigs shing /🔽mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'i phyir bsrung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnyed cing phrad pa'i yul la lhag par dmigs shing / mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'i phyir bsrung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa ni /
translated: It is called “attachment to joy” because one desires not to be separated from the object that is presently being experienced.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //🔽phrad pa'i yul rnams dang bral bas sdug bsngal bar gyur cing smon lam 'debs @74a * //🔽pa ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya'o // phrad pa'i yul rnams dang bral bas sdug bsngal bar gyur cing smon lam 'debs @74a * // pa ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “attachment to pleasure” because one desires to be united with the object that is not presently being experienced.🔽It is called “attachment to non-separation” because one desires not to be separated from the object that is presently being experienced.🔽It is called “attachment to non-separation” because one desires not to be separated from the object that is presently being experienced.🔽It is called “attachment to non-separation” because one desires not to be separated from the object that is presently being experienced.

original: yang na bde ba'i tshor ba dang phrad cing mi bral bar chags pa ni yang 'byung ba can gyi sred pa zhes bya'o //🔽sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mi phrad cing bral bar 'dod pa ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bde ba'i tshor ba dang phrad cing mi bral bar chags pa ni yang 'byung ba can gyi sred pa zhes bya'o // sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mi phrad cing bral bar 'dod pa ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “attachment to non-separation” because one desires not to be separated from the object that is presently being experienced.🔽It is called “attachment to non-separation” because one desires not to be separated from the object that is presently being experienced.🔽It is called “attachment to non-separation” because one desires not to be separated from the object that is presently being experienced.🔽It is called “attachment to non-separation” because one desires not to be separated from the object that is presently being experienced.

original: bsam gtan gyi tshor ba btang snyoms bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la chags pa ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi tshor ba btang snyoms bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa la chags pa ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “attachment to non-separation” because one desires not to be separated from the object that is presently being experienced.

original: yang na ma rnyed pa'i dngos po rnams dang phrad par smon lam 'debs pa ni yid 'byung ba can gyi sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ma rnyed pa'i dngos po rnams dang phrad par smon lam 'debs pa ni yid 'byung ba can gyi sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the prayer for the acquisition of things not yet acquired is called craving with aversion.

original: smon lam btab pa'i dngos po rnams la tshol bar zhugs pa ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smon lam btab pa'i dngos po rnams la tshol bar zhugs pa ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The pursuit of things that are the object of the prayer is called craving with delight.

original: btsal ba rnams ni 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btsal ba rnams ni 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The pursuit of the increase of things that are sought is called craving with delight in that and that.

original: yang na rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa'i bdag gi yul dang dbang du byas nas sred pa rnam pa bzhir gsungs te /
analyzed: yang na rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa'i bdag gi yul dang dbang du byas nas sred pa rnam pa bzhir gsungs te /
translated: Or else, craving is of four kinds, based on the domain of self and the domain of other, in regard to acquisition and non-acquisition.

original: de la bdag gi lus rnyed pa rnams dang bral bar mi 'dod pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gi lus rnyed pa rnams dang bral bar mi 'dod pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Therein, the desire not to be separated from the body that has been acquired is craving.

original: bdag gi lus ma rnyed pa rnams dang phrad cing ldan par 'dod pa ni yang 'byung ba can no //
analyzed: bdag gi lus ma rnyed pa rnams dang phrad cing ldan par 'dod pa ni yang 'byung ba can no //
translated: The desire to obtain and to possess the body that has not been acquired is craving for renewal of being.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnyed pa rnams dang rtag tu 'grogs par 'dod pa ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnyed pa rnams dang rtag tu 'grogs par 'dod pa ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The desire to always associate with the objects that have been acquired, such as form, is craving accompanied by delight.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul ma rnyed pa rnams dang phrad par 'dod pa ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul ma rnyed pa rnams dang phrad par 'dod pa ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who desire to meet objects such as form that they have not obtained are called those who delight in this and that.

original: brgal ba mngon pa'i chos las rgyur gyur pa'i phung po lnga la kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes bshad pa'am /
analyzed: brgal ba mngon pa'i chos las rgyur gyur pa'i phung po lnga la kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes bshad pa'am /
translated: Objection: The five aggregates that are the cause of manifest phenomena are explained as the truth of origin in the Abhidharma.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa la kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa la kun 'byung gi bden pa zhes bshad de /
translated: Or, karma and affliction are explained as the truth of origin.

original: de yang cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de yang cis mngon zhe na /
translated: How is this known?🔽A sūtra explains:

original: mdo las sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'jig rten dang / lta ba'i gnas dang / sred pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs so //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo las sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'jig rten dang / lta ba'i gnas dang / sred pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs so // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Suffering, origin, the world, the basis of views, and craving are synonyms.

original: 'di'i don yang 'bras bur gyur pa'i phung po ni lnga ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'di'i don yang 'bras bur gyur pa'i phung po ni lnga ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The five aggregates that are the result are suffering.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i phung po lnga ni kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i phung po lnga ni kun 'byung ngo //
translated: The five aggregates that are the cause are origin.

original: phung po lnga nyid 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas 'jig rten no //
analyzed: phung po lnga nyid 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas 'jig rten no //
translated: The five aggregates themselves are the nature of destruction, so they are the world.

original: sems can rnams phung po lnga la bdag tu lta bas na lta ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams phung po lnga la bdag tu lta bas na lta ba'i gnas so //
translated: Sentient beings are the abode of views, because they view the five aggregates as a self.

original: tshe gcig nas gcig tu 'pho zhing skye @74b bar byed pas na sred pa'o //
analyzed: tshe gcig nas gcig tu 'pho zhing skye @74b bar byed pas na sred pa'o //
translated: Craving is the cause of birth, because it causes the transmigration of life from one birth to another.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: The Sūtra says,

original: las dang sred pa ni ma rig pa /🔽'du byed ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu zhes bshad pa la mdo 'di las sred pa nyi tshe la kun 'byung du bshad pas /
analyzed: las dang sred pa ni ma rig pa / 'du byed ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu zhes bshad pa la mdo 'di las sred pa nyi tshe la kun 'byung du bshad pas /
translated: Karma and craving are ignorance.🔽The formation of future existence is explained as the cause of future existence.

original: mdo gzhan dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: mdo gzhan dang 'gal lo //
translated: Since this sūtra explains craving alone as the origin, it contradicts other sūtras.

original: mdo de nyid las bshad pa /
analyzed: mdo de nyid las bshad pa /
translated: The same sūtra explains:

original: dge slong dag sa bon gyi rigs lnga po 'di dag ma grub pa dang / ma zhig pa dang / ma rul ba dang / rlung la sogs pas nyams par ma gyur pa dang / legs par btab pa yang yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag sa bon gyi rigs lnga po 'di dag ma grub pa dang / ma zhig pa dang / ma rul ba dang / rlung la sogs pas nyams par ma gyur pa dang / legs par btab pa yang yin la /
translated: Monks, when these five types of seeds are not damaged, not rotten, not destroyed by wind or heat, and well planted,

original: sa'i khams kyang yod pa de bzhin du chu dang me dang rlung gi khams kyang yod na de lta na ni sa bon de dang 'phel ba dang rab tu 'phel ba dang / rgya chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i khams kyang yod pa de bzhin du chu dang me dang rlung gi khams kyang yod na de lta na ni sa bon de dang 'phel ba dang rab tu 'phel ba dang / rgya chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: if the earth element exists, and likewise the water, fire, and wind elements exist, then the seed will grow, increase, and expand.

original: de dang 'dra bar dge slong dag don 'di khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'di ni dper na gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar dge slong dag don 'di khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'di ni dper na gzhag pa ste /
translated: In the same way, monks, in order to understand this meaning, this is the example:

original: sa bon gyi rigs lnga zhes bya ba 'di ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rigs lnga zhes bya ba 'di ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: “The five types of seeds” is a synonym for “the five appropriating aggregates.”

original: sa'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi'i tshig bla dags te /
analyzed: sa'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi'i tshig bla dags te /
translated: “The earth element” and so on are synonyms for the four abodes of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi'i gzugs su yang nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / tshor bar nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'du shes su nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed du nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi'i gzugs su yang nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / tshor bar nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'du shes su nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed du nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The four abodes of consciousness are consciousness that has gone to form, consciousness that has gone to feeling, consciousness that has gone to perception, and consciousness that has gone to volitional factors.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa gzugs la brten nas gzugs su nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa gzugs la brten nas gzugs su nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the desire realm is called “consciousness that has gone to form” because consciousness depends on form.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi ni rnam par shes pa bde ba'i tshor ba la brten pas na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi ni rnam par shes pa bde ba'i tshor ba la brten pas na /
translated: The four absorptions of the form realm are called the four meditative attainments dhyanacaturthadhyana because they are the basis of the consciousness that experiences the feeling of pleasure sukhavedanabhisamskarana.

original: tshor bar nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor bar nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The four absorptions of the form realm are called consciousnesses that approach feeling because they are based on the feeling of pleasure.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched ni rnam par shes pa nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes so bya ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i 'du shes la brten pas nang du 'du shes su nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched ni rnam par shes pa nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes so bya ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i 'du shes la brten pas nang du 'du shes su nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The formless realm, the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness and the base of nothingness are called consciousnesses that approach internal discrimination because they are based on the discrimination of the objective perceptual state that the consciousness of infinite space is infinite space and so on.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'du shes dang / 'du shes dang med min skye mched na ni /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'du shes dang / 'du shes dang med min skye mched na ni /
translated: In the summit of existence, the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment,

original: rnam par shes pa 'du byed sems dang ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa la brten pas na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'du byed sems dang ldan pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa la brten pas na /
translated: consciousness is based on afflicted mental consciousness and non-afflicted mental consciousness.

original: @75a * // 'du byed du nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @75a * // 'du byed du nye bar song ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called consciousness that approaches formation.

original: sa bon gyi rigs lnga dang / sa bon gyi sa bon dang / rtsa ba'i sa bon dang / sdong bu'i sa bon dang / mgo thog gi sa bon dang / sa bon no //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rigs lnga dang / sa bon gyi sa bon dang / rtsa ba'i sa bon dang / sdong bu'i sa bon dang / mgo thog gi sa bon dang / sa bon no //
translated: the seed of the seed, the root seed, the stem seed, the head seed, and the flower seed.

original: lan du smras pa /
analyzed: lan du smras pa /
translated: The author replies:

original: mdo 'di las kun 'byung gi sred pa 'ba' zhig la kun 'byung gi bden par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mdo 'di las kun 'byung gi sred pa 'ba' zhig la kun 'byung gi bden par bshad pa ni /
translated: In this sūtra, only the craving that is the origin is explained as the truth of origin.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu'i gtso bo dbang du byas nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu'i gtso bo dbang du byas nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the primary cause of all dharmas with outflows.

original: rgyu'i gtso bo ni srid pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i gtso bo ni srid pa yin no //
translated: Because existence is the primary cause.

original: ji ltar gtso bo yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gtso bo yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the primary cause?

original: sred pa'i 'di gnas thams cad du khyab pa dang / dus thams cad du khyab pa dang / khams thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa'i 'di gnas thams cad du khyab pa dang / dus thams cad du khyab pa dang / khams thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because craving pervades all abodes, pervades all times, and pervades all realms.

original: gnas thams cad la khyab pa ni rtag tu tshor ba rnams gsum gyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: gnas thams cad la khyab pa ni rtag tu tshor ba rnams gsum gyi rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: It pervades all abodes because it always follows the three feelings.

original: ji lta zhe na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang phrad pa'i dus na ni //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang phrad pa'i dus na ni //
translated: How is that? When one encounters a feeling of suffering,

original: de dang 'bral bar 'dod pa'i sred pa skye zhing ma phrad pa'i dus na ni yang mi phrad par 'dod pa'i sred pa skye ba dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang phrad pa'i dus na ni yang de dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'i sred pa skye ba dang /
analyzed: de dang 'bral bar 'dod pa'i sred pa skye zhing ma phrad pa'i dus na ni yang mi phrad par 'dod pa'i sred pa skye ba dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang phrad pa'i dus na ni yang de dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'i sred pa skye ba dang /
translated: When one is not in contact with the feeling of pleasure, craving arises, desiring to be in contact with it. When one is in contact with the feeling of pleasure, craving arises, desiring not to be separated from it.

original: de dang bral ba'i dus na ni yang phrad par 'dod pa'i sred pa skye ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i dus na ni /
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i dus na ni yang phrad par 'dod pa'i sred pa skye ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'i dus na ni /
translated: When one is separated from the feeling of pleasure, craving arises, desiring to be in contact with it. When one is in contact with the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant,

original: kun tu gti mug gi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu gti mug gi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: craving arises, due to complete delusion.

original: dus thams cad la khyab pa'i sred pa'i dus gsum gyi rjes su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad la khyab pa'i sred pa'i dus gsum gyi rjes su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Craving is pervasive with regard to time, because it arises in the three times.

original: khams thams cad du khyab pa ni khams gsum longs spyod rnams ni sred par 'dod pa'i sred pa skye ba dang / ma 'ongs ba'i dus dang longs spyod la ni mngon par smon pa'i sred pa skye ba dang / da ltar gyi lus dang longs spyod dang ni rtag tu 'grogs par sred pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams thams cad du khyab pa ni khams gsum longs spyod rnams ni sred par 'dod pa'i sred pa skye ba dang / ma 'ongs ba'i dus dang longs spyod la ni mngon par smon pa'i sred pa skye ba dang / da ltar gyi lus dang longs spyod dang ni rtag tu 'grogs par sred pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It pervades all realms because craving arises for the enjoyments of the three realms, craving arises for the enjoyments of the future, and craving arises for the constant companionship of the present body and enjoyments.

original: khams thams cad du khyab pa ni khams gsum gyi dngos po la zhen par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khams thams cad du khyab pa ni khams gsum gyi dngos po la zhen par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It pervades all realms because it causes attachment to things of the three realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni sred pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags par byed pa dang / gzugs kyi khams na ni srid pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan gyi ro la chags par byed pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na ni sred pa'i dbang gis gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la chags par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni sred pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags par byed pa dang / gzugs kyi khams na ni srid pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan gyi ro la chags par byed pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na ni sred pa'i dbang gis gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la chags par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the desire realm, it causes attachment to the five sense objects through the power of craving. In the form realm, it causes attachment to the taste of concentration through the power of existence. In the formless realm, it causes attachment to formless meditative attainment through the power of craving.

original: @75b 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: @75b 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the truth of cessation,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, “What is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering?”

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal brgyad dang bral zhing de dang mi ldan par gyur ba ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal brgyad dang bral zhing de dang mi ldan par gyur ba ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa ste /
translated: Cessation of suffering is the freedom from and non-possession of the eight sufferings of birth and so on.

original: de ltar khong du chud pa 'phags par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud pa 'phags par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: One who understands it in this way becomes a noble being,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis de ltar thugs su chud pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis de ltar thugs su chud pa'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: or because the noble ones understand it in this way, it is called the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa yin par phyin ci ma log cing ma nor ba'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad spangs pa yin par phyin ci ma log cing ma nor ba'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because nirvana is the unmistaken and correct abandonment of all suffering, it is called the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: 'gog pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'gog pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That cessation is of two kinds:

original: so sor ma brtags te 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags te 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags te 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags te 'gog pa'o //
translated: cessation not attained through analytical meditation and cessation attained through analytical meditation.

original: de la so sor ma brtags te 'gog pa ni rdo gnam du 'phags pa thur du lhung ba dang 'dra bar skad cig ma re re la skye zhing gang gis kyang ma bcom par rang gi ngang gi 'jig pa'o //🔽so sor brtags te 'gog pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi mes nyon mongs pa'i shing bsregs nas /
analyzed: de la so sor ma brtags te 'gog pa ni rdo gnam du 'phags pa thur du lhung ba dang 'dra bar skad cig ma re re la skye zhing gang gis kyang ma bcom par rang gi ngang gi 'jig pa'o // so sor brtags te 'gog pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi mes nyon mongs pa'i shing bsregs nas /
translated: Non-analytical cessation is like a stone thrown into the air that falls to the ground: it arises in each moment and is destroyed by its own nature without being destroyed by anything else.

original: khams gsum du mi skye bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum du mi skye bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Analytical cessation is the non-arising of the three realms due to the fire of the wisdom that realizes the noble truths burning the tree of afflictions.

original: 'dir ni so sor rtog ste 'gog pa bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni so sor rtog ste 'gog pa bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Here, analytical cessation is intended.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa yang don bcu gcig gis bstan te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa yang don bcu gcig gis bstan te /
translated: The truth of cessation is also explained by eleven topics:

original: mtshan nyid dang / zab pa dang / tha snyad dang / don dam pa dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rgyan med pa dang / rgyan dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma yod pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / zab pa dang / tha snyad dang / don dam pa dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rgyan med pa dang / rgyan dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma yod pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang /
translated: definition, profundity, convention, ultimate, incomplete, complete, unadorned, adorned, remainder, no remainder,

original: rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rnam grangs so //
translated: and enumeration.

original: ji ltar mtshan nyid kyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan nyid kyis she na /
translated: How by definition?

original: de bzhin nyid dang / las dang nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ni 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / las dang nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ni 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The non-arising of reality, karma, and afflictions is the characteristic of cessation.

original: de bzhin nyid ni gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
translated: Reality is the selflessness of persons.

original: lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
analyzed: lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
translated: The path is the eightfold noble path.

original: nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa lhan cig spangs nas phyis mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa lhan cig spangs nas phyis mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: The non-arising of afflictions is the abandonment of afflictions such as attachment together with their roots, and their non-occurrence in the future.

original: des gang du 'gags pa dang / gang gis 'gags pa dang / gang 'gags pa mi 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bshad do //
analyzed: des gang du 'gags pa dang / gang gis 'gags pa dang / gang 'gags pa mi 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bshad do //
translated: By that, it is explained that the characteristic of cessation is that which ceases, by what it ceases, and what ceases does not cease.

original: de la gang du 'gags pa ni gang zag la @76a * //
analyzed: de la gang du 'gags pa ni gang zag la @76a * //
translated: Among those, that which ceases is the selflessness of persons.

original: bdag med par khong du chud pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su 'gog go //
analyzed: bdag med par khong du chud pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su 'gog go //
translated: By understanding that, it ceases in the state of nirvana.

original: gang gis 'gags pa ni lam gyi bden pas 'gags so //
analyzed: gang gis 'gags pa ni lam gyi bden pas 'gags so //
translated: By what it ceases is by the truth of the path.

original: gang 'gags pa ni nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'gags so //
analyzed: gang 'gags pa ni nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'gags so //
translated: What ceases is the collection of afflictions.

original: de bas na 'gog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de bas na 'gog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Therefore, with respect to cessation,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: the Bhagavan said:

original: mig dang rna ba de bzhin sna //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba de bzhin sna //
translated: The eye, the ear, and also the nose,

original: lce dang lus yid de bzhin te //
analyzed: lce dang lus yid de bzhin te //
translated: the tongue, the body, and the mind,

original: gang du ming dang gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: gang du ming dang gzugs la sogs //
translated: where name-and-form, etc.

original: ma lus par ni 'gags gyur pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma lus par ni 'gags gyur pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: cease without remainder.

original: ji ltar zab pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zab pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it profound?

original: 'du byed de dag 'gags pa las 'gog pa de dag gzhan zhes kyang brjod du mi rung /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag 'gags pa las 'gog pa de dag gzhan zhes kyang brjod du mi rung /
translated: It is said that cessation is not to be described as other than those formations that have ceased,

original: gzhan ma yin zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: nor is it to be described as non-other than them.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te 'du byed rnams las 'gog pa gzhan du gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams las 'gog pa gzhan du gyur na ni /
translated: If cessation were other than formations,

original: 'du byed 'gag pa'i chos 'gog pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed 'gag pa'i chos 'gog pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: cessation would not be the dharmic cessation of formations.

original: gal te 'du byed rnams las 'gog pa gzhan ma yin pa yang 'gog /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams las 'gog pa gzhan ma yin pa yang 'gog /
translated: If cessation were not other than formations,

original: de nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: cessation would have the characteristic of affliction.

original: de bas na gnyis ka ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis ka ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is not to be described as either.

original: ji ltar tha snyad kyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar tha snyad kyis she na /
translated: How is it conventional?

original: gang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bkag pa rnams thang cig 'gags kyang phyis skye bas na /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bkag pa rnams thang cig 'gags kyang phyis skye bas na /
translated: The cessation that is a simple cessation of the defilements by the mundane path is a cessation that is only temporary, for the defilements will arise again later.

original: de ni tha snyad kyi 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad kyi 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called conventional cessation.

original: ji ltar don dam par zhe na /🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas bcom ste /
analyzed: ji ltar don dam par zhe na / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rtsa ba nas bcom ste /
translated: What is ultimate cessation?🔽The cessation that is the complete destruction of the defilements by the supramundane path is a cessation that is not subject to reversal, for the defilements that have been completely destroyed will not arise again.

original: gang las lan cig bcom pa de phyis mi skyes bas na don dam pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang las lan cig bcom pa de phyis mi skyes bas na don dam pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ultimate cessation.

original: ji ltar yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhe na /
translated: What is incomplete cessation?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa ste /🔽gang gang zag slob pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa ste / gang gang zag slob pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni /
translated: It is the cessation of those defilements that are abandoned by the attainment of the fruit of the path of the stream-enterer, the fruit of the path of the once-returner, and the fruit of the path of the non-returner.

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa ma yin pas /
translated: The cessation of the defilements that are abandoned by the trainee is not the complete abandonment of the defilements.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called incomplete cessation.

original: ji ltar yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su ma rdzogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is incomplete about it?

original: mi slob pa'i gang zag dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i gang zag dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The cessation of those who are not learners, i.e., of those who have attained the fruit of Arhatship.

original: des nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas na /
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas na /
translated: Since they have abandoned all the defilements,

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the cessation without remainder.

original: ji ltar na rgyan @76b med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyan @76b med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it without adornment?

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa rnams kyis 'gog pa ni /🔽mngon par shes pa drug gi khyad par bye brag med pas /
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa rnams kyis 'gog pa ni / mngon par shes pa drug gi khyad par bye brag med pas /
translated: The cessation of the Arhats who are liberated through wisdom

original: rgyan med pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan med pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: is without adornment because it is not distinguished by the six superknowledges.

original: ji ltar rgyan dang bcas pa yin zhe na /🔽bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi cha gnyi ga las /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyan dang bcas pa yin zhe na / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi cha gnyi ga las /
translated: How is it with adornment?

original: rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'gog pa ste /
translated: The cessation of the Arhats who are liberated through both parts

original: de dag rigs pa gsum dang / mngon par shes pa drug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas na rgyan dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rigs pa gsum dang / mngon par shes pa drug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas na rgyan dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is with adornment because they possess the qualities of the three knowledges, the six superknowledges, and so forth.

original: ji ltar lhag ma dang bcas pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lhag ma dang bcas pa zhe na /
translated: How is it with remainder?

original: phung po'i lhag ma ma spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma ma spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Nirvana without remainder is the nirvana of one who has not abandoned the remainder of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i lhag ma da dud yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma da dud yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the remainder of the aggregates still exists.

original: ji ltar lhag ma med pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lhag ma med pa zhe na /
translated: How is it without remainder?

original: phung po lhag ma ma lus par mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma ma lus par mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Nirvana without remainder is the nirvana of one who has abandoned the remainder of the aggregates.

original: phung po tsam yang spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po tsam yang spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even the mere aggregates have been abandoned.

original: ji ltar rnam grangs kyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam grangs kyis she na /
translated: How is it by way of enumeration?🔽Therefore, a sutra declares:

original: de'i phyir mdo las gang de'i yang 'byung ba can gyis srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽gang de'i zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'i 'phags pa dgra bcom pa de'i ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las gang de'i yang 'byung ba can gyis srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // gang de'i zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'i 'phags pa dgra bcom pa de'i ste /
translated: The one who has that is called existence.🔽The one who has that is the arya foe-destroyer who has abandoned all afflictions.

original: de'i yang 'byung ba can gyi sred pa la sogs pa ma lus par spangs pa de ni /
analyzed: de'i yang 'byung ba can gyi sred pa la sogs pa ma lus par spangs pa de ni /
translated: The abandonment of all of the craving, etc. that is the one who has that is

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: the truth of cessation.

original: smras pa / ma lus par spangs pa la sogs pa'i tshig 'di dag la khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: smras pa / ma lus par spangs pa la sogs pa'i tshig 'di dag la khyad par ci yod /
translated: Objection: What is the difference between these terms: abandonment without remainder, etc.?

original: smras pa / 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i ming gi rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i ming gi rnam grangs yin te /
translated: He replied: This is a synonym for nirvana.

original: khyad par med kyang 'dul ba'i snod kyi dbang gis ming de dang de dag tu btags so //
analyzed: khyad par med kyang 'dul ba'i snod kyi dbang gis ming de dang de dag tu btags so //
translated: Although there is no difference, it is designated by those names due to the power of the vessel to be tamed.

original: ma lus par spangs pa ni /
analyzed: ma lus par spangs pa ni /
translated: Complete abandonment is

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi sred pa spangs nas de dang bral ba thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi sred pa spangs nas de dang bral ba thob pa ste /
translated: the attainment of freedom from craving after abandoning craving through the noble path.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān also said:

original: gang 'phags pa'i lam gyi spangs pa ni yang dag pa spangs pa yin no gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i lam gyi spangs pa ni yang dag pa spangs pa yin no gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: What is abandoned by the noble path is right abandonment.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi spangs pa ni bral ba'i rnyed pa thob pa med pas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi spangs pa ni bral ba'i rnyed pa thob pa med pas na /
translated: Abandonment by the mundane path is not the attainment of freedom,

original: phyis skye ba'i phyir ma lus pa spangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyis skye ba'i phyir ma lus pa spangs pa ma yin no //
translated: because it arises again later, it is not complete abandonment.

original: so sor spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa thams cad med par byas pa ste /
analyzed: so sor spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa thams cad med par byas pa ste /
translated: Individual abandonment is the elimination of all the obtainments of afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal spangs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal spangs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning the abandonment of the latent tendencies of afflictions.

original: 'jig par gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa spangs pas /
analyzed: 'jig par gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa spangs pas /
translated: Destruction is the abandonment of the obtainment of afflictions,

original: @77a * // 'khor ba mthar phyin pa ste /
analyzed: @77a * // 'khor ba mthar phyin pa ste /
translated: 1. The end of samsara.

original: 'khor ba'i chos dang mi ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos dang mi ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: That is, one is no longer subject to the phenomena of samsara.

original: zad pa ni 'dod chags la ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni 'dod chags la ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: 2. Exhaustion. This is the elimination of the afflictions other than desire, such as anger, pride, and ignorance.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa ste med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa ste med par byas pa'o //
translated: 3. Freedom from desire. This is the complete elimination of desire, that is, the destruction of desire.

original: 'gog pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zag pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid spangs nas med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zag pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid spangs nas med par byas pa'o //
translated: 4. Cessation. This is the elimination and destruction of the five appropriated aggregates, which have the characteristic of being contaminated.

original: nye bar zhi ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba ni skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad med par byas pa'o //
translated: 5. Quiescence. This is the elimination of all the sufferings of birth, aging, and so forth.

original: nub pa ni tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyun bcad pa ste /
analyzed: nub pa ni tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyun bcad pa ste /
translated: 6. Setting. This is the severing of the continuum that connects one life to another.

original: de ltar gyur pa de sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has attained these is said to have attained the noble being’s truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: yang na 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal thams cad spangs pas ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal thams cad spangs pas ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, because all the latent tendencies of the defilements of the realm of desire are abandoned, it is called ‘completely abandoned’.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal thams cad spangs pas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal thams cad spangs pas /
translated: Because all the latent tendencies of the defilements of the realm of form are abandoned,

original: so sor spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called ‘individually abandoned’.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma lus par spangs pas 'jig par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma lus par spangs pas 'jig par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because all the latent tendencies of the defilements of the formless realm are completely abandoned, it is called ‘destroyed’.

original: nyon mongs pa gang spangs pa rnams phyis skye ba med par zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang spangs pa rnams phyis skye ba med par zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the defilements that have been abandoned do not arise again in the future, it is called ‘exhausted’.

original: slar yang khams gsum gyi dngos po la chags shing zhen pa mi 'byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //🔽da ltar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams kyang 'dor bar 'gyur bas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang khams gsum gyi dngos po la chags shing zhen pa mi 'byung bas 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o // da ltar gyi nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams kyang 'dor bar 'gyur bas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because attachment and clinging to the things of the three realms do not occur again, it is called ‘free from attachment’.🔽Because the present appropriated aggregates are cast off, it is called ‘ceased’.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams bor bas nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams bor bas nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the appropriated aggregates are cast off, it is called ‘quiescent’.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i phung po skye ba med pas nub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i phung po skye ba med pas nub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The future aggregates are called “set” because they are not produced.

original: yang na ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni mdo tsam du bzhag pa ste so sor spangs pa la sogs pa'i tshig lhag ma de'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni mdo tsam du bzhag pa ste so sor spangs pa la sogs pa'i tshig lhag ma de'i bshad pa'o //
translated: Or, “complete abandonment” is a brief presentation, and the remaining words such as “individual abandonment” are its explanation.

original: sred pa'i bag la nyal spangs pas so sor spangs pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i bag la nyal spangs pas so sor spangs pa'o //
translated: “Individual abandonment” is the abandonment of the latent tendencies of craving.

original: bag la nyal spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa mngon du 'byung ba la spyod pa med pas 'jig par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa mngon du 'byung ba la spyod pa med pas 'jig par gyur pa ste /
translated: “Destruction” is the non-occurrence of the manifestation of the afflictions due to the abandonment of the latent tendencies.

original: de bas na zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “exhaustion.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po thams cad la skyon du lta bas /🔽'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po thams cad la skyon du lta bas / 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Freedom from attachment” is the view of all things that are afflictions as faults.

original: nyon mongs pa rgyun du 'byung ba'i rgyun tshad pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rgyun du 'byung ba'i rgyun tshad pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: “Cessation” is the stopping of the continuity of the occurrence of the afflictions.

original: thar @77b pa'i mtshan nyid thob pas nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: thar @77b pa'i mtshan nyid thob pas nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: “Quiescence” is the attainment of the characteristics of liberation.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bral bas nus pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bral bas nus pa'o //
translated: “Power” is freedom from the grasping of self.

original: yang na ma lus par spangs pa ni mdor bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: yang na ma lus par spangs pa ni mdor bzhag pa ste /
translated: Or, “complete abandonment” is a brief presentation, and the remaining words such as “individual abandonment” are its explanation.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de'i bshad pa'o //
translated: The rest are explanations of that.

original: ji ltar ma lus par spangs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma lus par spangs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are abandoned without remainder?

original: so sor spangs pa la sogs pa'i phyir ma lus par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: so sor spangs pa la sogs pa'i phyir ma lus par spangs pa'o //
translated: They are abandoned without remainder because they are abandoned individually, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa mngon du spyod pa rnams mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa mngon du spyod pa rnams mi 'byung zhing /
translated: The manifest activities of the afflictions are not produced,

original: byung ba yang spang bar byed pas na /
analyzed: byung ba yang spang bar byed pas na /
translated: and those that have arisen are abandoned.

original: so sor spangs pa'o //
analyzed: so sor spangs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are abandoned individually.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal rtsa nas phyung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal rtsa nas phyung ste /
translated: The latent afflictions are uprooted

original: cung zad kyang med par byas pas na /
analyzed: cung zad kyang med par byas pas na /
translated: and made to be not even the slightest bit existent.

original: 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, they are destroyed.

original: de yang mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: de yang mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: gnyen po rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas /
translated: Through the two aspects of the antidote,

original: zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes rnam pa gnyis su gzhag go //
analyzed: zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes rnam pa gnyis su gzhag go //
translated: they are posited as the two aspects of elimination and freedom from attachment.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong ba spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong ba spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing by the path of seeing is called elimination.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsgom par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsgom par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation,

original: khams gsum gyi chags pa thams cad dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi chags pa thams cad dang bral ba ni /
translated: one is free from all attachment to the three realms.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “freedom from attachment.”

original: de ltar mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas /
translated: Thus, by abandoning the afflictions of seeing and cultivation,

original: ma 'ongs pa na phung po lnga skye ba'i rgyun med par byas pas na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na phung po lnga skye ba'i rgyun med par byas pas na /
translated: one causes the continuum of the arising of the five aggregates in the future to be nonexistent.

original: 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “cessation.”

original: mthong ba'i chos nyid la yang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa sems la gnod pa thams cad mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos nyid la yang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa sems la gnod pa thams cad mi 'byung bas /
translated: Also, in this very life, all mental afflictions such as mental dissatisfaction do not occur.

original: nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “peace.”

original: tshe rabs snga ma'i shugs kyis 'phangs pa'i phung po sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi gzhir gyur pa 'di yang med par 'gyur bas nub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma'i shugs kyis 'phangs pa'i phung po sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi gzhir gyur pa 'di yang med par 'gyur bas nub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This basis for the aggregates that is projected by the force of previous lives and is the basis for various sufferings will also become nonexistent. This is called “sublime.”

original: lam gyi bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the truth of the path,

original: sdug bsngal la 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: it is said, “What is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering?”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: de la gong du bshad pa'i sdug bsngal brgyad rnams 'gag pa sdug bsngal 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: de la gong du bshad pa'i sdug bsngal brgyad rnams 'gag pa sdug bsngal 'gog pa ste /
translated: The cessation of the eight sufferings explained above is the cessation of suffering.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is nirvana.

original: de thob par byed pa'am der sbyin par byed pa'i lam la /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'am der sbyin par byed pa'i lam la /
translated: The path that causes one to attain that, or that leads to that,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ste /🔽de yang 'og nas yang dag pa'i lta @78a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ste / de yang 'og nas yang dag pa'i lta @78a * //
translated: is called the path of liberation that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: ba la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad yin par bshad do //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad yin par bshad do //
translated: Moreover, it is explained below that it is the eightfold noble path of right view and so on.

original: lam de dge ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na /
analyzed: lam de dge ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na /
translated: Since that path is virtuous by nature,🔽it is called “noble.

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The term noble is used because they have attained the noble path.

original: lam de nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pas na 'phags pa zhes bya ba'am /🔽'phags pa rnams kyis bshad pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam de nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pas na 'phags pa zhes bya ba'am / 'phags pa rnams kyis bshad pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, since that path is the antidote to the afflictions, it is called “noble.🔽”

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Or, it is called “noble” because it is the path explained by the noble ones.

original: lam de la gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lam de la gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Or, it is called “noble” because one becomes noble by abiding in that path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ste /
translated: It is the noble path.

original: lam de nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa ma nor zhing phyin ci ma log cing /
analyzed: lam de nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa ma nor zhing phyin ci ma log cing /
translated: This path is unerring and unmistaken in abandoning the afflictions and in attaining nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam gyi 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called the “noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.”

original: lam gyi don ni tshol ba la yang bya ste /🔽lam 'dis rnal 'byor pa rnams /
analyzed: lam gyi don ni tshol ba la yang bya ste / lam 'dis rnal 'byor pa rnams /
translated: The meaning of “path” is also to seek.🔽Because yogins and yoginis seek nirvana and the results of spiritual practice

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu tshol ba'i phyir lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu tshol ba'i phyir lam zhes bya'o //
translated: through this path, it is called a “path.”

original: yang na lam gyi don ni /
analyzed: yang na lam gyi don ni /
translated: Alternatively, the meaning of “path” is

original: 'gro ba'i don la bya ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don la bya ste /
translated: to go.

original: dper na 'jig rten na lam 'di mtho ris kyi grong khyer du 'gro'o zhes bya ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten na lam 'di mtho ris kyi grong khyer du 'gro'o zhes bya ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, in the world, it is said, “This path goes to the city of the gods.”

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad kyis kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin cing 'gro bar byed pas na lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad kyis kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin cing 'gro bar byed pas na lam zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, because the eightfold noble path goes to and reaches the city of nirvana, it is called a “path.”

original: de dngos gang yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dngos gang yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach what its actual entities are,🔽it is said,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag 'di nyid de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag 'di nyid de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is the very limb of the noble path, right view and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba gnyis las /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba gnyis las /
translated: Right view is twofold: mundane right view and supramundane right view.

original: 'dir 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i tshig smos pas na /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa zhes bya ba'i tshig smos pas na /
translated: Here, since the word “noble” is used,

original: zag pa med pa la bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zag pa med pa la bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it refers to the uncontaminated,

original: 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba la ni mi bya'i /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yang dag pa'i lta ba la ni mi bya'i /
translated: not to mundane right view.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la bya ste /
translated: It refers to supramundane right view.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / ngag la sogs pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / ngag la sogs pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: The word “and so on” includes right thought, right speech, and so on.

original: yan lag ces bya ba ni cha la bya ba'am /
analyzed: yan lag ces bya ba ni cha la bya ba'am /
translated: “Limb” means a part or

original: grogs su gyur pa la bya ste /
analyzed: grogs su gyur pa la bya ste /
translated: an auxiliary.

original: cha brgyad dam mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang / grogs brgyad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cha brgyad dam mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang / grogs brgyad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the eight parts or the eight causes and auxiliaries that bring about the attainment of nirvana.

original: 'di nyid de zhes bya ba ni @78b 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad 'og nas snyegs so //
analyzed: 'di nyid de zhes bya ba ni @78b 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad 'og nas snyegs so //
translated: The phrase “this is that” refers to the eightfold noble path, which will be explained below.

original: brgal ba 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: brgal ba 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan pa'i skabs su /
translated: In the context of the teaching on the truth of cessation, which is the refutation of objections,

original: sred pa ma lus par bkag pa /
analyzed: sred pa ma lus par bkag pa /
translated: the complete cessation of craving

original: 'gog pa yin par bshad la /
analyzed: 'gog pa yin par bshad la /
translated: is explained as being cessation.

original: 'dir lam gyi bden pa bstan pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: 'dir lam gyi bden pa bstan pa'i skabs su /
translated: In the context of the teaching on the truth of the path,

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa yin par bshad pas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa yin par bshad pas /
translated: the truth of the cessation of suffering is explained.

original: snga phyi'i 'gal lo zhes zer ba'i len du smras pa /
analyzed: snga phyi'i 'gal lo zhes zer ba'i len du smras pa /
translated: Therefore, you may object that there is a contradiction between the earlier and later explanations.

original: 'di ltar me bsad na du ba mi 'byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar me bsad na du ba mi 'byung ba bzhin du /
translated: In response to this, we say that just as when a fire is extinguished, smoke no longer occurs,

original: sred pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu bkag na /
analyzed: sred pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu bkag na /
translated: when the cause, which is characterized by craving, is stopped,

original: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal yang 'gag par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal yang 'gag par 'gyur bas /
translated: the result, which is characterized by suffering, will also cease.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe ;
translated: Therefore, when nirvana is attained,

original: sdug bsngal yang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: suffering will no longer exist.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa zhes bya ba bshad pa de nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa zhes bya ba bshad pa de nyes pa med do //
translated: For this reason, there is no error in explaining the cessation of suffering.

original: brgyal ba yan lag gi gtso bo yod na gdod yan lag ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brgyal ba yan lag gi gtso bo yod na gdod yan lag ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: When the main part of the body is present, it is appropriate to speak of limbs.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la /
translated: The eightfold noble path

original: yang lag gi gtso bo gang yin na /
analyzed: yang lag gi gtso bo gang yin na /
translated: What is the most important limb?

original: 'di dag la yan lag ces brjod /
analyzed: 'di dag la yan lag ces brjod /
translated: They are called limbs.

original: smras pa / yang dag pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: smras pa / yang dag pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: It is said: Right view

original: lam gyi yan lag gi gtso bo yang yin la /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag gi gtso bo yang yin la /
translated: is the most important limb of the path

original: yan lag kyang yin pas na /
analyzed: yan lag kyang yin pas na /
translated: and is also a limb.

original: yan lag gi gtso bo dang / yan lag rnam pa gnyis su gzhag go //
analyzed: yan lag gi gtso bo dang / yan lag rnam pa gnyis su gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, it is posited as the most important limb and as a limb.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa lhag ma bdun ni /🔽de'i grogs su gyur pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa lhag ma bdun ni / de'i grogs su gyur pas /
translated: The remaining seven, such as right thought,

original: yan lag 'ba' zhig tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yan lag 'ba' zhig tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: are posited as limbs alone🔽because they are the companions of right view.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad kyi don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad kyi don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of the eightfold noble path,

original: dpe smras pa /
analyzed: dpe smras pa /
translated: an example is given:

original: 'di ltar skyes bu la la zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽skyes bu la la zhig ces bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu la la zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // skyes bu la la zhig ces bya bas ni /
translated: “It is like a man who, having been struck by a virulent fever,” and so on.

original: skyes bu gang yang rung ba 'ba' zhig go //🔽rims kyis btab nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes bu gang yang rung ba 'ba' zhig go // rims kyis btab nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A man” means just any man.🔽“Having been struck by a virulent fever”

original: tsha ba'i nad kyis btab pa'o //
analyzed: tsha ba'i nad kyis btab pa'o //
translated: means having been struck by a hot disease.

original: sman pa mkhas par bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sman pa mkhas par bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one praised as a skilled physician

original: sman dpyad kyi gtsug lag kun la mkhas par 'jig rten du grags pa'o //
analyzed: sman dpyad kyi gtsug lag kun la mkhas par 'jig rten du grags pa'o //
translated: is renowned in the world as skilled in all the treatises on medicine.

original: blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The wise one

original: sman dpyad kyi gtsug lag gi man ngag yod pa'o //
analyzed: sman dpyad kyi gtsug lag gi man ngag yod pa'o //
translated: has the instructions of the treatises on medicine.

original: las mthong ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las mthong ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One who has seen action

original: sngon chad sman byas pa rnams phan par gyur la sman phan tshun sbyor ba las yang mkhas shing sman sbyor ba dang gtong ba'i las kyang phal cher byas pa'o //🔽gtsug @79a * //
analyzed: sngon chad sman byas pa rnams phan par gyur la sman phan tshun sbyor ba las yang mkhas shing sman sbyor ba dang gtong ba'i las kyang phal cher byas pa'o // gtsug @79a * //
translated: has previously practiced medicine that has been helpful, and is also skilled in combining medicines, and has mostly performed the actions of compounding and administering medicines.🔽The one who has heard the treatises

original: lag thos pa ni sman dpyad du bya ba'i gtsug lag kun ma lus par thos pa'o //
analyzed: lag thos pa ni sman dpyad du bya ba'i gtsug lag kun ma lus par thos pa'o //
translated: has heard all the treatises on medicine without exception.🔽Approaching him

original: drung du song ba ni de'i thad du song ba'o //
analyzed: drung du song ba ni de'i thad du song ba'o //
translated: means going into his presence.

original: nad pa de la sman pas kyang nad kyi gzhi brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nad pa de la sman pas kyang nad kyi gzhi brtag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the doctor to examine the basis of the patient's illness,

original: sman pa des kyang de la thog mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sman pa des kyang de la thog mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: that doctor first says that one and so on.

original: nad pas kyang sman pa la nad kyi gzhi smras pa bdag gis zho dang ga gon zos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽sman pas nad kyi gzhi glengs nas sman bsten par smras pa //
analyzed: nad pas kyang sman pa la nad kyi gzhi smras pa bdag gis zho dang ga gon zos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // sman pas nad kyi gzhi glengs nas sman bsten par smras pa //
translated: The patient also tells the doctor the basis of the illness, saying “I ate yogurt and garlic” and so on.🔽The doctor, having discussed the basis of the illness, prescribes medicine.

original: sman pa des dmigs kyis phye ste sman ston to zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sman pa des dmigs kyis phye ste sman ston to zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The doctor prescribes medicine after distinguishing the basis.

original: dmigs kyi phyes te /
analyzed: dmigs kyi phyes te /
translated: Distinguishing the basis

original: sman ston zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sman ston zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means prescribing medicine.

original: khyod kyis zho 'thungs te /
analyzed: khyod kyis zho 'thungs te /
translated: “You drank yogurt,

original: ga gon zos la /
analyzed: ga gon zos la /
translated: ate garlic,

original: sgom du dar ba 'thungs pas bad kan rgyas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgom du dar ba 'thungs pas bad kan rgyas pa'i phyir /
translated: and drank warm beer, so your phlegm has increased.

original: tsha bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: tsha bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: Because of that, you have a fever.

original: de bas na bad kan rgyas pa zhi bar bya dgos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na bad kan rgyas pa zhi bar bya dgos pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to pacify the increase of phlegm,

original: de ring zan ma za cig ces bsgo nas /
analyzed: de ring zan ma za cig ces bsgo nas /
translated: do not eat today.”

original: de'i 'og tu bsil ba'i sman ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsil ba'i sman ston par byed pa'o //
translated: After that, he prescribes cooling medicine.

original: dpe smras nas don nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe smras nas don nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having told the example, in order to teach the meaning itself,

original: de bzhin du bden pa la sogs pa'i rims chen pos gdung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bden pa la sogs pa'i rims chen pos gdung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “Likewise, those tormented by the great fever of the truths” and so on.

original: bden pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa bzhi khong du ma chud pa khong du chud par bya bar 'dod pa nyid /
analyzed: bden pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa bzhi khong du ma chud pa khong du chud par bya bar 'dod pa nyid /
translated: The truth is the four noble truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: bden pa la sogs pa'i rims chen pos gdungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa la sogs pa'i rims chen pos gdungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are afflicted by the great fever of the truths are those who desire to understand what has not been understood.

original: dge ba rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The virtuous ones are those

original: gang zag bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'dod pa de dag tshe rabs gzhan du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshul khrims dang nyan pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams bsags pa dang / tshe 'dir yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa 'dri bar byed pas na dge ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'dod pa de dag tshe rabs gzhan du dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa dang / tshul khrims dang nyan pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams bsags pa dang / tshe 'dir yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir / 'phags pa'i bden pa 'dri bar byed pas na dge ba'o //
translated: who desire to understand the four noble truths. In other lives, they rely on spiritual friends, accumulate merit through moral discipline, listening, etc., and in this life, in order to pacify the afflictions such as desire,🔽they ask about the four noble truths. Thus they are virtuous.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du thugs su chud pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du thugs su chud pas /
translated: The Tathāgata is so called because he has realized the four noble truths just as they are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: Thus he is the Tathāgata, the “one who has gone thus,” or the “one who has seen thus.”

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas /
translated: Just as the Tathagatas of the past, having abandoned all afflictions,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du gshegs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du gshegs pa bzhin du /
translated: have gone to the city of nirvana,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan dag gis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan dag gis kyang /
translated: so too have the other Tathagatas,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs @79b nas ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs @79b nas ;
translated: having abandoned all afflictions,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du gshegs pas nad bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du gshegs pas nad bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: gone to the city of nirvana. Therefore, he is the Tathagata.

original: sems can gyi sman pa chen po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can gyi sman pa chen po zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for being the great physician of sentient beings,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa //
translated: those who possess afflictions such as attachment and aversion,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang bcas pa rnams la sems can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang bcas pa rnams la sems can zhes bya ste /
translated: together with their minds and mental factors, are called sentient beings.🔽In order to pacify the afflictive illnesses of attachment, aversion, delusion, and so on,

original: sems can de dag la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can de dag la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in those sentient beings,

original: mi gtsang ba dang / byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi sman 'chad par mdzad pas na sman pa chen po'o //🔽ci'i phyir sems can la nyon mongs pa'i sman gtong zhe na //🔽de'i phyir thugs rje chen po zhes gsungs te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba dang / byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi sman 'chad par mdzad pas na sman pa chen po'o // ci'i phyir sems can la nyon mongs pa'i sman gtong zhe na // de'i phyir thugs rje chen po zhes gsungs te / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams /
