original: de la rang bzhin ni sems can thams cad la zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni sems can thams cad la zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its nature is that it is not hostile to any sentient being and it is not deluded.

original: rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang / sdug bsngal brgya stong grangs med pa rnams la brtse ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang / sdug bsngal brgya stong grangs med pa rnams la brtse ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its aspect is that it is the aspect of compassion for one, two, three, up to countless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings.

original: dmigs pa ni khams gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni khams gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its object is sentient beings in one, two, three, up to all world systems.

original: sa ni snying rje chen po de bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sar gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa ni snying rje chen po de bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sar gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its level is that it is associated with the level of the fourth concentration.

original: rgyud ni snying rje nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la gnas kyi snying rje chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud ni snying rje nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la gnas kyi snying rje chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its lineage is that compassion is present in the mindstreams of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, but great compassion is present in the mindstreams of tathāgatas.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi snying rjes 'dod pa'i @80a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi snying rjes 'dod pa'i @80a * //
translated: Its freedom from attachment is that it is free from attachment to the desire realm through the compassion of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, but it is free from attachment to all three realms through great compassion.

original: khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bar zad kyi /
analyzed: khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral bar zad kyi /
translated: They are only free from the attachment of the desire realm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen pos ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen pos ni /
translated: But the great compassion of the Tathagatas

original: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is free from all attachment to the three realms.

original: skyob pa dang / mi skyob pa ni /
analyzed: skyob pa dang / mi skyob pa ni /
translated: Protection and non-protection:

original: nyan thos kyi snying rjes sems can 'ga' tsam skyob par zad kyi ;
analyzed: nyan thos kyi snying rjes sems can 'ga' tsam skyob par zad kyi ;
translated: The compassion of the Sravakas only protects some beings,

original: / sems can ma lus par mi skyob la /
analyzed: / sems can ma lus par mi skyob la /
translated: but not all beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen pos ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje chen pos ni /
translated: But the great compassion of the Tathagatas

original: sems can ma lus pa skyob par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa skyob par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: protects all beings.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rims spangs pa'i chos 'dri ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rims spangs pa'i chos 'dri ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Dharma that removes the fever of suffering:

original: sdug bsngal brgyad po nyid lus dang sems la gnod par byed pas rims dang 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal brgyad po nyid lus dang sems la gnod par byed pas rims dang 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: The eight kinds of suffering themselves are like a fever, because they harm the body and mind.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rims te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rims te /
translated: Therefore, they are the fever of suffering.

original: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove that,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po la sogs pa'i chos 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po la sogs pa'i chos 'dri ba'o //
translated: the Dharma of the four noble truths and so forth is asked about.

original: de rnams la bzhi kun 'byung ba gsungs par bstan nas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rims spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir /🔽chos 'dri ba'i gang zag dge ba de dag la sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i rgyu /
analyzed: de rnams la bzhi kun 'byung ba gsungs par bstan nas zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rims spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir / chos 'dri ba'i gang zag dge ba de dag la sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i rgyu /
translated: For the sake of abandoning the disease of suffering,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kun 'byung gi bden pa yin par gang mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa nyid gang yin pa dmigs kyis phye nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kun 'byung gi bden pa yin par gang mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa nyid gang yin pa dmigs kyis phye nas bstan pa'o //
translated: he taught the characteristics of karma and the afflictions, which are the cause that produces suffering, and which are the truth of origin, by distinguishing the karma and the afflictions that are taught in other sūtras.

original: de'i sman gang zhe na //
analyzed: de'i sman gang zhe na //
translated: What is the medicine for that?

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he taught the path of the eightfold noble path, and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa nyid las dang nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i sman no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa nyid las dang nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i sman no //
translated: The eightfold noble path itself is the medicine that abandons karma and the afflictions.

original: lam des nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pas na zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lam des nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pas na zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: Since that path abandons the afflictions, it is the pacifier.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po spong bar byed pas na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po spong bar byed pas na /
translated: Since it abandons the mass of suffering,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: is nirvana.

original: zhi ba'i mchog rnyed do //
analyzed: zhi ba'i mchog rnyed do //
translated: He has attained the highest peace.

original: zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa /
translated: This means that he has abandoned all karma and afflictions,

original: skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal kun dang bral ba /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal kun dang bral ba /
translated: and is free from all the sufferings of birth, aging, and so forth.

original: 'jig rten gyi bde ba thams cad la dam par gyur ba thob pa'i phyir zhi ba'i mchog rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bde ba thams cad la dam par gyur ba thob pa'i phyir zhi ba'i mchog rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has attained the highest of all worldly pleasures, it is said that he has attained the highest peace.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gong du bshad pa rnams kyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi gong du bshad pa rnams kyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to summarize the above explanations of the four noble truths,

original: dge slong dag 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa @80b bzhi zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa @80b bzhi zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Bhikṣus, these are called the four noble truths.”

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do zhes grangs tsam smos pa de dag gang yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do zhes grangs tsam smos pa de dag gang yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The number of the eightfold noble path has been mentioned, but in order to explain what they are,

original: de la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “What is the eightfold noble path?”

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kho nar bshad la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kho nar bshad la /
translated: Why are only eight factors explained as the noble path?

original: dgu dang bdun la sogs par ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: dgu dang bdun la sogs par ma yin zhe na /
translated: It is not nine or seven, and so on.

original: lan du phung po gsum du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad nyid de mi mang mi nyung ngo //
analyzed: lan du phung po gsum du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad nyid de mi mang mi nyung ngo //
translated: The noble path is eightfold, not more or not less, because it is divided into three groups.

original: de la phung po gsum ni /
analyzed: de la phung po gsum ni /
translated: The three groups are

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po'o //
translated: the group of morality, the group of concentration, and the group of wisdom.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba gsum ni /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba gsum ni /
translated: The three right speech, right action, and right livelihood

original: tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin yin pas tshul khrims kyi phung por bsdu'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin yin pas tshul khrims kyi phung por bsdu'o //
translated: are included in the group of morality, because they are essentially morality.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung por bsdus te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung por bsdus te /
translated: The two right mindfulness and right concentration are included in the group of concentration.

original: dran pa dngos su ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo ma yin yang /
analyzed: dran pa dngos su ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo ma yin yang /
translated: Although mindfulness is not actually the essence of concentration,

original: dran pa g-yeng ba rnams la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa med pas /
analyzed: dran pa g-yeng ba rnams la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa med pas /
translated: those whose minds are distracted do not have one-pointed abiding.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are conducive to meditative concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung por gtogs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung por gtogs so //
translated: they are included in the aggregate of meditative concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gsum ni //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gsum ni //
translated: The three right view, right thought and right effort are

original: shes rab kyi phung por bsdu ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung por bsdu ste /
translated: included in the aggregate of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / rtsol ba gnyis rnam par rtog pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / rtsol ba gnyis rnam par rtog pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin pas /
translated: Although both right thought and effort are by nature discursive reflection and effort,

original: dngos su shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dngos su shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin mod kyi /
translated: they are not actually the nature of wisdom.

original: phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa dang / dge ba bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus kyi rgyu las shes rab 'byung bas na /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa dang / dge ba bsgrub pa'i brtson 'grus kyi rgyu las shes rab 'byung bas na /
translated: However, wisdom arises from the cause of unmistaken realization and the effort to accomplish virtue.

original: de'i grogs su 'gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i grogs su 'gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because they are its auxiliaries,

original: shes rab kyi phung por gtogs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung por gtogs so //
translated: they are included in the aggregate of wisdom.

original: yang na 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad 'dis //
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad 'dis //
translated: Or, because these eight branches of the ārya path

original: yon tan brgyad skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan brgyad skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: generate eight qualities,

original: lam yan lag brgyad kyang brgyad nyid de mi mang mi nyung ngo //
analyzed: lam yan lag brgyad kyang brgyad nyid de mi mang mi nyung ngo //
translated: the eight branches of the path are eight in number, not more and not less.
